Summary: We've stayed here twice now, once in a double queen and 1 king room, and I'm super bummed they are sold out for our next Disneyland trip!  This place is awesome!  It's completely renovated and everything is so nice!!  The beds were "new stiff" but very comfortable (if that makes sense)  I liked that there was a separate sink and mirror area for us to get ready in that wasn't connected to the shower and toilet.  Not all rooms come with a fridge, so if you need one, be sure to book that room.  We usually travel with a cooler, so it's not a huge deal for us. The room was a nice size for a traveling couple, and the area is really quite. They have a huge parking lot that's well lit and the area feels safe.  We actually used the pool and that was nice too.  You can pick up pool towels

Zero stars here. Don’t think about it. My stay here was terrible. Hotel room smelled like pee  And the bathroom had mold.  The wifi sucked kept shutting off on all Devices. Next door someone was throwing a party with loud music and drunk loud people in the parking lot in the middle of the night. All of the wall sockets were loose I can only charge my stuff in the bathroom. 2 days I couldn’t get fresh new towels because there wasn’t house keeping and the front desk women didn’t do anything.  There is a hot grab and go breakfast but really it’s old cold danish and cheap granola bar in paper bag and doesn’t include drinks. Any extra you have to pay and what they sale in the lobby you can buy at the dollar store. The Asian place next door the food sucks and they over charge.  This

This is an older Ramada location on the other side of the freeway from Disneyland park.  Not exactly a "maingate" location, however its very close, and the the price point is good.  Our room was clean and pleasant, and the front desk people were nice.  Rooms have both fridge and microwave standard.

This hotel was close to Disneyland about a 20 min walk or 5 min bus ride that stops right out front. Staff was great. Room was big and spacious and very clean. We had a refrigerator and microwave which was nice to have. The only think that first bothered me was the smell of the room.  It smelled a bit musty but that was it.

Easy check in process beautiful lady at front desk at night extremely nice made us feel welcomed. Clean rooms plenty of parking. Nice and clean rooms, very comfortable beds clean and safe surroundings, Highly recommend

The floors were dirty in the room, and ladders and junk were outside of my window.  I paid cash for my room and then got home to find out they charged my card for the two rooms after paying cash. after many calls to the hotel and manager that did nothing to help me. talked to ramada customer service they did nothing, then called ramada guest relations and Expedia to see if they would help get my 365 dollars Canadian back guess we will see what happens. would not give this hotel another cent. if you pay cash they will not give you a receipt for your cash till they do their books at 7 at night
Room tip: the people upstairs keep you up can hear them walking around , if you going to stay get a...

Summary: Reasonably close to the Disney parks.  Comfortable bed and clean bathroom, but dirty floor, and "breakfast" was wretched. Staff not particularly helpful when asked about buses to the parks, just handed us a card and said "scan this and follow the steps".

I read some bad reviews about this place and can honestly say it was clean, quiet and close to Disney main entrance. Every hotel I looked for Oogie Boogie was double the normal rate. This place was not. Highly recommend

We booked a Ramada but the place was more a relabeled Hotel 6.   It’d you have minimal budget and low expectations then this may work you but as someone who has traveled for work and has specifics they look for this felt like a bate and switch.

The front desk during the late night and early morning were extremely nice The night clerk  exchanged my room to a different per my request because the original room’s air conditioner was making a squealing noise. My second room was awesome. The room was very clean and the bed was firm but comfortable. The walk to Disneyland was easy, even with my bad foot. There was no breakfast but a brown bag with a prepackaged danish, muffin and granola bar. That’s all I need to start my day. I was very happy with my stay there.

I would not recommend this location to anyone. It’s quite a walk from Disneyland.   Property is tun down. Staff is less than helpful. Overall a rip off of a location. Broken items in room. No privacy. Unhelpful staff.

Summary Heading: Clean and welcoming hotel for Disney
Summary: This hotel was perfect for our family visit to Disney. I’m writing a long review as some people have made some negative comments and I hope to provide a balanced viewpoint.  We chose the hotel primarily for its location as my sister’s family was at the rv park next door. It was a half hour walk or a $7 Uber ride to Disney.  Staff was very friendly and helpful. There are laundry facilities on site (looked fairly new) which families with small children may appreciate. I used the pool with my little niece and nephew and it was clean and a perfect temperature. Also it was never busy. This was surprising as I assume the hotel was full based on the number of cars in the lot.  Please note,  there are no pool towels to my knowledge.  Our room was very clean and I would guess that the

no breakfast, only grab and go bad, no hot coffee even, in the bad there is something barely cN eat, threw away immediately. not clean, can see blood SPOTS in the pillow and towel.   noises whole night, car parking and pulling beeping, luggage roiling, people talking at 2am,, avoid this hotel

Gross. Someone already used our room. They should check these rooms for cleanliness before checking someone in. Soaps used already and A/C was qeecky. Floor and carpet was dirty. Yuck. Said it was close enough top walk to Disney land but oh no. That is a very long Wal;k. Do not attempt

The motel is less than a mile from the park and very close to a city bus stop that got us to and from the park in a few minutes. Parking was always available near our room. Walking distance to Shakey's Pizza and there is a restaurant currently hiring across the parking lot. Also, traffic in the area was light and it was easy to get to nearby shopping and restaurants and the freeway. Also, the rooms were clean and beds comfortable, and there were no concerns for safety even late at night.

Clean, friendly and less than 2 miles from Disneyland. The front desk person was such a gem. We were able to Uber to Disneyland for less than $10 each way and made getting to the parks so much easier.

Nice Bed.  Clean and Comfortable Room.  Perfect for what we needed this trip.  Location was great.  Close to Disneyland but still quiet.  Breakfast was still affected by Covid so it was just a paper bag with a muffin and granola bar.  Worked ok for me though.

Summary Heading: Warning, employees steal from your room.
Summary: The hotel was barely adequate. Paper thin walls, loud guests. Room did not have a mini fridge, safe, closet or microwave. However, most importantly, items were stolen from our room by the cleaning crew. Items were there when we left in the morning, when we returned later in the evening, clothes and bags had been moved and an item left on the table was missing. I will never use this hotel again.  I have stayed at over 50 hotels in California ranging from 1 star to 5 star and I've never experienced theft until now. And please stop advertising the restaurant next door as being available, it is out of business. And the "continental" breakfast in the dinning room ended up being a brown paper bag.

Clean and basic motel. Friendly staff.   breakfast was a danish and muffin served in a brown paper bag!  internet is a pain and keeps getting disconnected!  basics are in place and a decent value for money

Our room was clean and everything was properly working. Staff was nice. We were able to leave our car before check in time. So that saved us $30 of parking at Disneyland. After we checked out we left our car and returned later and we didn’t have problems with that. The advertised breakfast was a bag with a granola and muffin, it was ok we took it as a snack inside the park. Walk was a bit long. Almost a mile to Disneyland.

While the room is close to Disney there’s more affordable friendlier Hotel rooms on same street. The rooms had bed bugs. The water did not drain from the showers. The front desk attendant is rude. The room overall is not very clean.  I was told to bring up my issues on Monday. Nothing could be done over the weekend. Was not told of a $100 hidden upfront fee charged to my card.

Summary Heading: Employee Ruined Property Owner Not Responsible?
Summary: A hotel maid tried to correct a freezer compartment that was full of ice by turning the thermostat to coldest setting which ruined expensive medication and food. Priceline had no communication from the owner of Ramada by Wyndham Anaheim even though Sam, the owner,  said he would send information to Priceline so I could go through them for compensation. Priceline would not agree to any financial  compensation. I called Windham and it appears that not only will they not take any financial responsibility but since Sam the owner of this hotel will not and Priceline will not my only recourse will be to file in small claims court for my losses as well as for costs incurred to me to make that filing and just put it in front of a judge. I've tried to reach Sam again for the past 48

We entered our room to a horrible odor, carpet was stained and sticky, bathroom was not properly cleaned. I went to the local wal-mart to purchase cleaning supplies and towels for our stay. The only positive for this hotel is it's proximity to Disneyland.

An ok place to stay. Woukd have been nice if hotel staff could inform you there is an Orange County Transit right in front of Ramada that drops you off across the street from Disneyland. 2.00 one way. Since we didn’t know we spent 25.00 one way to Uber. Walked it one day but with kids had to walk the overpass of I-5 freeway. Too dangerous and far. No restaurants close by other than Shakeys. 1st day we arrived walked in the hotel room and a cockroach coming out of bathtub drain. Did not complain because I’m sure the staff is aware. Bathroom towels were old, flimsy and worn out. Front office staff and housekeeping were great.

Summary Heading: Great hotel for a great price!
Summary: The hotel was well maintained - rooms, stairways, grounds, and front office.  The rooms and bathrooms were just the right size.  The staff was responsive.  The price and location were great for a Disneyland visit with a group.

It is a clean hotel that looks recently updated inside. The restaurant was closed down. The grab and go breakfasts were so so,2 pastries and a granola bar. No coffee available except 2 cups in the room. Absolutely freeeeezing pool, so unusable. Nice staff and comfortable beds.

Everything was great except for the extra $112.30 charge at check in after the charge for the deposit. Other than that my family and I are completely satisfied with our stay and still enjoyed Disneyland.

I always stay at this hotel coz is very nice and I enjoy my vacation here an is on a very good location and affordable prices they always give me the best price and always give me a choice of room downstairs or upstairs

Summary Heading: Sleep in your car for a nicer stay
Summary: We had three rooms here for just one night. Toilet rings in one room, grime and what looked like dry blood or maybe mud behind the door in another and the worst was spiders (yes multiple) crawling in the bathroom and just not clean at all in the third. Walls are super thin, the people above us were not loud by any means but we could hear them at their normal speaking volume. Essentially it’s a cheap motel and even those are nicer than this place. There was not anyone there staffing the front desk 24 hours a day.  When we tried to check out at 9:30 am, we tried calling and there was only someone handing out breakfast (that we would not touch due to the cleanliness of the rooms, can’t trust anything else there). We also saw the staff (not for checkout, just for handing out meals)

I walked into my room to sticky carpet and white dried liquid all over the fridge and all along the bottom wood area surrounding the fridge. The bathroom had black residue on the spout of the tub. It was clearly not cleaned.

You get what you pay for them. For our Disneyland trip, we chose to spend less on our hotel so that we could have more to spend at the park. And now, I’m really wishing we hadn’t.  Our first room, had massive stains all over both of the mattresses. We VERY politely asked to upgrade to a different room, which we did.  And this room has stained mattresses as well. Lives up to its 2-star rating.   Next time I’m going to spend the $150/night on a 4/5 star hotel.

Summary Heading: What you’d expect for the price
Summary: The hotel was alright. It definitely was what I expected for only paying $88 for the night. Check in and out was very easy and the front desk staff was helpful in fixing any issues we had. I would stay here again for another short trip to Anaheim.

From the outside, it’s a traditional motor court with drive-up rooms in a two-story building surrounding a parking lot.  Parking lot is well lit, and the single vehicle entrance made me feel secure.  Plus, parking here is FREE, a rarity for Anaheim!  Once inside, my room had been totally renovated from top to bottom.  Everything brand-new including the bathroom, and not a scuff to be found.  Bed was super-comfortable and room was quiet.  The comfort alone merited five stars even if their “Covid” breakfast consists of no more than a couple pastries, and the line at checkout was long (I just left the key in the room and went on my way).  Very pleased with the price/condition ratio here.

Room smelled like cigarettes and homeless. Also noticed something that looked like a mold substance on the ceiling in the morning of check out in which I made the decision to leave earlier than planned and get to the next destination. Disappointed in the property being under the Wyndham umbrella.

Breakfast wasn't breakfast at all with no choice in food if you can call it more than a snack. No juice or milk offered just so skimpy n disheartening. 😥! Left me wishing for more and still hungry and dissatisfied.

Summary Heading: Thanks for your service and effort to make us feel like at home
Summary: My family and I where in CA for a few days and ended up contained in the state due to the covit19 and with almost no options we stayed at different places but the only one that has make us feel comfortable and have been patient with us even when we haven't had the reservation or extension of the staying on time the staff work with us and make no pressure instead instead they try to make the tough times be a little lighter and less stressful

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay for a reasonable price
Summary: About a mile from Disneyland (Not bad for walking though the overpass over the freeway is arched, so at the end of the night that's one more hill before bed).  The price is pretty reasonable, it's no frills, but basically clean and decently kept.  They have a free breakfast (I slept in and didn't check that out).  If you're looking for a no-frills cost efficient place to sleep, this place will work.

The reason I gave this stay a two, was because the front desk staff was friendly and housekeeping did their best with what they had to work with.  This place is old and very run down. Our door had the appearance of a kicked in door that had been half way put back together. The rugs desperately needs to be replaced. The bathroom needs to be gutted.  This hotel suggests that it is being renovated, I truly hope so. I’ve stayed in many other Hotels of this chain and this is the by far the most ran down.  Another positive was, Location, it was in walking distance to Disney and Disney downtown. Lot of restaurants and stores around.

Hubby and I went to Disneyland and while the walk would be a good distance, we took an Uber and were there in 5 minutes.  The property and the room were very clean.  There is also a great Italian restaurant right next door. Would definitely stay there again!

Summary Heading: 6 night stay, hotel was as advertised.
Summary: I got a great rate through Priceline, and basically did it at near last minute. 2 weeks before. I would give it 3.5 if possible, but I err for the good there.   The bad, an employee was cleaning near the front of my room the day we checked out and was smoking weed. I don't care if it is legal, it is not legal when you work and I don't want to have it on my vacation or around my children. I hope the motel fixes that. We always got 3 towels for a room with 2 queens and always had to ask for a 4th towel.  The good. We checked in at midnight, it was quick but when I went to go to my room the key did not work. The person on duty locked up and walked over to my room (opposite corner of the property) to make sure it worked. The room was always taken care of, the floor was not carpeted,

Came on vacation with my family , and this one was really close to Disneyland. It allowed us to walk there and back ! So far great experience. Clean environment and friendly staff . Would definitely book again .

Clean rooms and minimal breakfast but reasonable price and sufficient to stay in for a Disney trip.  Staff was abrupt but helpful.  Appreciated that the hotel was a reasonable distance from Disney for young children to walk.

Don’t pass this one up if you are looking for a Great price. Our room was CLEAN. Breakfast was ok for coffee & waffles. Parking space was excellent. Drove 5 minutes to Disney. Walk is about 15 minutes and there is quite a crowd walking in that direction. It was an awesome value as we were not in the room all day. We enjoyed our trip and had extra money to spend as we saved with Ramada.

nice warm pool! clean and comfy not an easy walk to disney- we drove other than that it was a great value very happy and would definitely come back                          some of the online reviews seem either bogus or out of date, as of feb 2020 and at least our building things were good

We stayed here 6 nights, and appreciated the check-in man’s warm welcome, the daily housekeepers who cleaned with care and arranged our kids’ stuffies so nicely, and the quietly hardworking and diligent breakfast attendant. Excellent budget hotel about 20 minute walk to Disneyland. Breakfast had pancakes and waffles so better than strictly “Continental” fare. (Some protein other than yogurt would have been nice.) Service at the next door Italian restaurant was very good. We enjoyed our stay at this hotel, and would stay here again.

We love this hotel! NO resort fees, no parking fees, no internet fees. The amount you pay for the room is all you pay for. I hate all the extra fees, so annoying! Close to Disneyland has a decent little breakfast, a great affordable Italian restaurant next door, rooms are clean and amazing staff. We will definitely stay here again.

Unfortunately one employee can completely ruin your stay!  The room was basic but clean and this would be 4 stars if not for the night desk clerk.  After checking in and going to sleep my family was awakened by a call at 12:45am from the desk clerk demanding I come down to reception immediately to fix an error the earlier clerk made when I checked in.  After arguing that he should be able to fix the paperwork (my info was transcribed to another guest's room), or allow me to come in the morning, he threatened to call the police if I didn't come down.  I finally did and he was extremely rude and unprofessional, making me give him information that the hotel already had.  While I was down there the police showed up, so he'd already called them!  They left rolling their eyes, and he

Summary Heading: Convenient location and walking distance to Disneyland and Starbucks
Summary: We stayed here a few nights over the holidays and the room was decent, the bed was actually pillow top and comfortable, and it was very conveniently located walking distance to Disneyland with a Starbucks right across the street.  We would definitely stay here again considering the price compared to other hotels located in the area.

Really good value for the location. Disneyland was our destination; it was very easy to get there. An inexpensive Uber/Lyft ride or an inexpensive shuttle was also available. Quiet, comfortable room, with very efficient heater. Breakfast wasn't anything fancy, but there was a reasonable selection.

Hotel was clean, friendly, breakfast needs improvements.  Overall ok for quick getaway.  Close to shuttle and Disneyland.  They have room service and offer delivery of food which comes in handy when on feet at park all day!

Good value for area. Location is less than 1mile to Disneyland, only 20 min walk. Took Lyft as it was under $10. Breakfast items were reasonable. Free parking and internet was a bonus. Has a pool but did not use.

While leaving this Ramada after checking out we backed into a car causing a dent in the driver's side door.  I went to the lobby to report it, gave the license plate number to the desk clerk she didn't attempt to contact the registered guest or do anything other than give me a blank piece of paper so I could write a note and leave it under the drivers side windshield wiper.

Our stay here was riddled by noise , tweakers and office staff who didn't care about the problems  I wouldn't recommend staying here unless you enjoy noise and parties and syringes in the parking area  that the office didn't care about

Location was not terribly convenient. There was no information about the surrounding area restaurants or other entertainment. Bedsheets appeared to have been used (there was some hair on one). Bathroom soap was inadequate and barely lathered.

Nothing really stands out, it was above average. Just a place to sleep. It is pretty close to Disneyland. Room was nice and clean. I‘d probably give it a 4 star if the breakfast was better. Parking was okay.

Summary Heading: Excellent resort which exceeds all expectations
Summary: This report offers budget friendly minded customers an excellent hotel close to theme park entrances. The staff makes all attempts to keep the resort in tip top shape and looks and feels like a hotel well above its star ratings.  Overall we could not have been happier.

The staff is friendly and helpful. The room is great and clean, the beds are very comfortable.  It's very close to Disneyland. We didn't have breakfast during our stay.  I would definitely stay here again!

Pros: Clean rooms and comfortable beds with a nice breakfast. Cons: older hotel in a not so nice area. Made us nervous to walk to Disneyland so we used Uber. Also wished the rooms had a fridge and microwave.

Summary Heading: Rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable!
Summary: This hotel exceeded my expectations! It was close to Disneyland and the restaurant is a nice touch! I would recommend this hotel to everyone that is going to Disneyland! It's worth it and the price is just right!!

Had family from Texas visiting and to go for their first trip to Disneyland. Rooms were fine,  clean and looks like were newly renovated.  Coffee maker didn't work.  Breakfast was  good. Kept well stocked.

This property was clean, convenient to Disneyland, simple modern rooms and a GREAT Italian restaurant next door. Inexpensive transportation to Disney runs every 1/2 hour. Convenience store right at transportation bus stop.

Summary Heading: Great stay CLEAN ROOM close to DISNEYLAND .GREAT sevice over all .
Summary: Great stay CLEAN ROOM close to DISNEYLAND .GREAT sevice over all .Manager was great .House keeping good smoke alarm was churping and front desk came right away and fixed it .Will return with my family soon .

Summary Heading: Just a hotel to sleep at
Summary: This hotel is the most basic of basics. If you're looking for a place to sleep only then this is the place for you. The free breakfast has no cooked food (such as no eggs or sausage). There is only pastries and the juice has a very acidic taste to it. We ate breakfast off the site because we were so sick of just pastries.

This is a motel not a hotel, so don’t go in expecting any amenities or even a hall way. The rooms are entered from outside and the walls are very thin. Way overpriced and very disappointing. The room beside me got robbed, so I didn’t feel comfortable leaving any of my stuff in the room. The staff didn’t seem to care much about the hotel at all.

Summary Heading: Disneyland vacation stay at the Ramada
Summary: Thanks again for the great service. Happy to stay at this facility. Pool was a plus and the kids had fun. House keeping was all around nice and very clean. The rooms were cozy and the beds are very comfortable!! Felt truly safe as well in the location and room!!

This facility was exactly what we were looking for. We needed a nice place to stay in a strategic location. The breakfast alone was our favorite part of our stay. The parking was great and the staff was friendly and helpful.

No real curtains, totally see through. Calls ignored because they were on their cell phone. Door open when I arrived and told it's fine go in, It happens a lot.  No help or regard to the safety of my family.

Pretty good, very clean. Nice staff. Family friendly. Very close to ART stop. Close enough to Disneyland that you could walk if you want/need to. They try to be accommodating to whatever you need which is good - but they're forgetful. Asked for a crib and was told they'd bring it the next morning. Never did. Short staffed. Had to go pick up my own extra towels bc they didnt have someone to bring them to me.

Summary Heading: We were ROBBED someone broke in
Summary: We were ROBBED our room was broken into! Over $900 in personal items were stolen. (Tablets, car keys, personal items, gifts bought ar Disneyland) We filed police report, as well as alerted the front desk. There were signs of forced entry. NO CAMERAS on our hallway at all! It took TWO DAYS for the owner / gm to get back to us just to be told " you signed a waiver,  we are not held responsible. " NO COMPENSATION AT ALL WAS GIVEN. NOT EVEN AN ACTUAL APOLOGY! DO NOT STAY HERE! UNSAFE!!!

Loved this stay at the Ramada, we were able to walk to Disneyland. The room was clean, comfortable, and all around excellent. The breakfast was an excellent perk although there wasn’t much variety, my sister has gluten and lactose intolerance, she was only able to eat an apple.

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Basic accommodations. Don’t expect too much, including a greeting or thank you from the check in counter. The breakfast selection was nice, but could use protein items also. Location was near Disneyland, which was a great plus.

guest services was very nice and the rooms were better than expected. We even got a our own balcony view of the Disnyland Fireworks, up close and personal. I would definetly stay here again when Im in the are .

Close to Disneyland, super clean family friendly  will stay again. They have good customer service they take care of you right away no waiting and breakfast provided. Can't complain best stayed ever I recommend it

Summary Heading: Excellent stay, clean spacious rooms, great location and value
Summary: I looked at hotels online for 3 hours straight. I finally selected this hotel. I was hesitant because I’ve stayed in some awful hotels. The room was spacious for 4 adults. Enough room to add a rollaway twin bed for one of the adults. The sink, countertop, and mirror are on the outside of the bathroom so guests can brush teeth and get ready in the main room while another guest can shower or use the toilet behind a closed door. The room was clean. Breakfast was average with yogurt, muffins, cereal, and waffles, etc. Only a 7 minute drive to the Angels stadium and a 5 minute drive to Disneyland. There is also a stop at the front of the hotel for the ART bus that runs every 30 min and will take you to/from Disneyland for $6 per person per unlimited day use. This hotel was also

Pretty nice hotel to stay in, and close to Disneyland and close to alot of restaurants and fast food places. Hotel room was pretty clean, just needed some more sweeping and mopping. But over all I like this hotel.

The hotel was not as close to Disneyland as I hoped; there was not a good breakfast selection and the room was dirty (dust and hair on the floor). The hotel has had some good renovations and did look better than other places nearby that we've tried.

We arrived late Friday night.  We checked in with ease and went to our ground floor room.  The room was clean and very comfortable.  The hotel is close to Disneyland and nearby restaurants.  The only minus is their breakfast.  Besides that, this place is great.  Nice room and a friendly staff. Thanks for making our stay a great one!

Summary Heading: Nice convenient location for a quick trip to Disneyland
Summary: This is a great location to Disneyland. The room was comfortable and clean. It was surprisingly quiet, as the sound buffering in most motels isn't that great. We didn't hear outside noises from our room so we were pleased.   The staff was pleasant and helpful, no complaints with the check in or check out process.  There is an Italian restaurant right next door which was very convenient and the food was good.  We will definitely stay again and recommend this Ramada Inn to others.

I stayed here just for a night while my family and I visited Disneyland. Location is perfect, as it is literally like 2 minutes away if that. Rooms were clean, modern, and beds were extremely comfortable. The motel itself looks sketchy from the outside but from the inside it was perfect. Would definitely stay here again.

I had a crib which was free of charge, front desk clerk charged me for it and told me they will ask the HK for more info to see if I had a crib or a rollaway bed, after that they told me I have a crib but I used to have a rollaway bed so they can not reverse the charge. Front desk manager she was beyond rudeness

The room was clean and the location is near Disneyland. We were able to ride the ART bus wherever we needed to go during our stay.  There was a problem with the A/C unit in the first room we were given. The lady at the front desk upgraded us to another room at no additional charge.

Great hotel for the price. Very closed to Disneyland. We took Uber to go there only 5 - 6 dlls every trip. Very good located and safe area. Friendly staff and knowledge. Good breakfast (waffles, packed, toast cereal, juice coffee and sweets Will stay again

when we checked in we where greeted at the front desk by stephne  front desk agent with smile ,and she was very helpful, the location is close to disneyland to were we going with the kids and friends ,it will be on my list to come back in the future .

We checked in early to drop off all our stuff and headed to Disneyland. When we got back our key didn’t work. It was late and my family was in front of the door waiting to get in. I ended up going back and forth to the hotel window to get the key cards swapped out 4 times. I had it. I told the gentleman working to open it for me. He then showed up with a million ways to open the door but none of them worked. I urged him to get a locksmith there at once but he wouldn’t budge. He claimed that a guy would come in at 8am to help. I explained to him that our clothes, toothbrushes and everything was in the room. He didn’t care. He just kept trying to move us into a different room. We needed our stuff. Then when we go in the other room, there are bugs in it. I will never stay here

For what I paid really bummed,  never got to use the pool since it closed at 10, late check out was only an extra hour, which left us scrambling  still ..and never got my hotel rewards.. good things it was quiet, and pretty clean...

Locations to Disneyland was great.  The ART shuttle stopped almost in front of the hotel.  Easy access to Disneyland at a very reasonable cost.  We would definitely stay here on our next Disney trip.  Overall cost was one reason we chose this property.

We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights. It was fine. We had a bottom floor room more in the front. We found the room to be clean, showers hot, and property was picked up. The price was reasonable.  The public transportation was just ok. We decided to pay for parking at Disney the second day and it was more convenient. From the parking structure to the motel was maybe a 2 min drive and only $10 more then buying a shuttle passes. I did see people using lyft and uber with no problems.  The breakfast was a carb loading style for sure. The items they do offer all are fresh and stocked well. We ate there 2 of the mornings. Had no issues.  For families with young children this motel is "far". For healthy adults and teens the walk is doable. I prefer to stay closer to the main entrance

This hotel was very nice--clean, modern.  Had a decent sized pool as well.  The beds were comfy and everything was clean.  Any issues I had were dealt with quickly and professionally by the staff.  The breakfast is pretty good---pancakes, waffles, donuts/pastries as well as cereal, toast and yogurt options.  Coffee wasn't too bad, either.  This hotel is NOT right at the Disneyland gate--you have to walk over the freeway overpass, but it's only a 15-minute walk and you are right there and it was safe to walk there.   There are plenty of restaurants nearby within walking or car distance, too.  Very good choice for the price of a hotel near Disneyland.

This is a good hotel to get a goodnight rest. Breakfast is good they even have fresh pancakes. It’s close to Disney land. This hotel has been the best we highly recommend this hotel. My children and wife agree this is the best hotel we stayed at.

Summary Heading: Ramada inn at main gate north
Summary: Stayed here for 3 nights to go to disneyland. Price was reasonable for a Anaheim motel. Free parking,rooms are comfortable,had microwave and refrigerator,shower was clean and outside was clean as well Not really walking distance to disneyland,but for 6 bucks you can get pass to ride shuttle back and forth for the day. I would stay here again.

The room was very clean and the beds are extremely comfortable.  The bathroom was very clean as well. Nice pool area and nice size pool. Really good waffles for breakfast and good selection of bagels, toast, English muffins. Loved it.

Wouldn’t stay here again. The only good thing was that it was a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Breakfast no was no good. It was like having dessert for breakfast. All sweet items no eggs bacon sausage or even peanut butter for the toast.

Check in was a bit frustrating with the front desk having to look up reservations several times for everyone in line before finding it. The furniture in the rooms were poorly cleaned and the drains seemed to havve never been checked or cleaned. The location is great though, breakfast was decent and we had fun in the pool.

Great value for a hotel close to Disneyland. While the outside might look average, the rooms have been completely re-done with "wood" tile floors and decor was really nice. Loved not having dirty carpet to walk on. Everything was clean and bright and the staff was super nice and friendly was lovely smiles.

Two nights to visit disneyland. Great location. Room good but lost some money and hotel night staff horridly unhelpful. Day staff great but she's leaving. Suited purpose just not at all helpful if you have a problem at night. Thought I read 24/7 but the guy on duty locked door to office and wouldn't help.

The room was clean, but small for a family of 4. Laminate flooring is a nice touch and lots of outlets/USB plugs. Check in was very slow and front desk person signed me up for their rewards program without my knowledge..very inappropriate. Breakfast is marginal. Lots of carbs, some yogurt, minimal fruit.

The property was clean and the room was great. It smelled clean too. We will definitely be coming back.Breakfast had a good assortment of options and was fresh. The only suggestion is to have water with you. The vending machines did not offer any.

Beautiful location, very friendly and helpful staff, rooms were pleasant and cozy, tv could have been bigger but overall it was a nice room. Stayed in a queen double bed room with my wife and kids and we all enjoyed ourselves.

The walk to Disney includes crossing the on and off ramps to I5 which seemed very dangerous. A shuttle costs 5.50 per person per day so for a family of 4 you might as well just pay parking at disney. We requested a crib were told they would bring one. After several phone calls and hours later we were finally told they didn't have a crib. The walls were so thin you could hear people in the next room and Disney's fireworks sounded like they were beinf set off on the roof. The room was 80 degrees when we got there and it took a very long time for it to finally cool down. The manager was very rude. We requested to cancel after being there less than an hour due to the poor room condition and were told we would still be charged for our stay. Do yourself a favor and book somewhere else

Summary Heading: I gave a two rating because one was too mean.
Summary: If you are tired and can not find a place to sleep for the night and don't mind settling. This place is for you. It doesn't have curb appeal. The room not nasty but not comfortable clean either. The bathroom was about the same as the room. A very strong stale smell.

Checked into the room and found urine on the toilet seat and feces in the toilet.  Front desk guy said that housecleaning staff has left for the day and if I can wait until morning he will have them clean the room. When I said no way, he changed the room. Horrible!

Great place and value!  Clean, friendly, good neighborhood.  Walking to Disneyland except if you have kids under 12.  Within a mile of Toy Story parking to shuttles, easy to get out.  I will come back and stay again.

Between people stomping above us, drunkards outside the door, uncomfortable beds, and a foul smell emanating from the bathroom, I hardly slept. Then the breakfast was disappointing. The hoards of rude guests cleaned out most of the food, none of which was healthy except a single bruised apple.

Summary Heading: Don't judge this book by its cover....
Summary: Trip to Disneyland, chaperoning my son and his girlfriend.  Didn't want to spend a fortune, and this was listed at $111/room. Fair enough.  Not much to look at from the street, north of Ball Rd., away from motel row on other side of I-5; this is a two edged sword.  At the end of the day, I liked being away from center stage and all the action, but if you are walking it is a good 20-25 mins to Disney, and you will take your life in your hands crossing Ball.    All that aside, this is a great value motel.  Very pleasant reception, and we were allowed to check in early (thank you so much!!), and got to choose the location of our rooms. Parking not a problem, adjacent, and right up to the rooms.   Both rooms clean as a whistle, beds and pillows very comfy.  Air con worked to

Summary Heading: We were very happy with our stay.
Summary: We spent four nights at the Ramada Maingate North.  The young woman at the desk was friendly and helpful.  She gave us a room at the back away from the traffic noise (however, if you have loud neighbours in adjoining rooms you can hear them) and helped us with bus routes etc.  The room was  as clean as a whistle and the bed was cozy.  Housekeeping did a great job on the room each day. We only did the breakfast once and it was OK.  Not a huge selection but enough to get you going.  We had a one mile walk to the entrance to Disneyland and that was no problem at all.  We walked back and forth several times and once caught the number 10 bus from the Disneyland bus loop and got dropped right at the entrance to the motel.  We wouldn't hesitate to stay again.

More than pleasantly surprised at the quality of this hotel.  Beds were comfy, pillows were perfect.  Free parking and plenty of it.  Walking distance to Disneyland or take the bus from the hotel.  You can watch the fireworks from the hotel, very close by.  Breakfast was decent.  The breakfast server, Mary, does an amazing job restocking everything quickly and keeping the room clean.  They allow you to take food back to the room, which allowed me to get breakfast for the kids while they were getting ready for the day.  Check in was quick and no surprises on the bill.  Stephanie at the desk is super friendly and helpful.  Needed more towels one night and Ahmed was able to help us out with that.  Room was clean, included toiletries, and was refreshed every day for us.  LOVED the

The rooms were not very clean. The day manager is very rude... she should be fired. Overall if you need a cheap motel.... DO NOT STAY HERE. Customer service is very easy to deliver and they missed the mark.

Very good hotel. Very clean and a good value. Located near disneyland. A bit of a walk but in walking distance. Do recommend staying here if your in the area or visiting disneyland. Rooms are clean and internet works well. Big parking lot here also.

This hotel is below average in amenities, appearance and service.  The walls of the room were so thin we could hear the conversation of the guests in the room next door.  I'm sure they got a good dose of our crying baby as well.  The garbage cans did not have liners (ewww, used diapers).  We only stopped for breakfast one day.  I looked for a banana and nothing.  Lots of low quality carbs.  Definitely do not stay here. There was a shuttle to the park but cost $5/day per guest.  We walked.

I can't find a bad thing to say about this property. This "motel" exceeded my expectations in regards to room size, cleanliness, accommodations, parking, safety and location. It's perfect for a family on a budget, esp if attending Disneyland (so close!) or ASC or Anaheim Convention Center. Room includes a fridge, micro, coffee & WiFi... Plus free breakfast! Breakfast could be more to be desired, but you get what you pay for & I'm not complaining by any means. Cereal, yogurt, toast, pastries & donuts, pancakes... Not much fruit though. We will definitely be back!

Summary Heading: What is says on the tin
Summary: Budget hotel exactly as shown on web site. Plain, simple, sparsely furnished, everything you need for a couple of nights with no frills. Our room was large and spacious, clean and comfortable. WiFi a bit hit and miss, no external noise from the parking lot and no loud parties while we were there. Only criticism is lack of elevator to second floor for heavy bags and if staying in a ground floor room the noise of occupants walking across the floor above is very loud and can be disturbing depending on the time of day - listening to a herd of elephants stomping across the ceiling at 2am is not good!

This hotel was very clean and comfortable I was surprised how much the rooms were for a two story hotel. There was also ample parking and a good Itiallian restaurant in the parking lot. I would come back and stay at this hotel when I take My family to Disneyland. Very clean and comfortable.

Hotel close to Disneyland that won't break the bank!  Clean, quiet, comfy beds, friendly staff, free breakfast, free parking, close enough to walk to Disneyland and best of all affordable!!  We've stayed here twice and would definitely stay again!

Summary Heading: Attacked by ants and stayed in unsecure room
Summary: The first room we stayed in ended up having a crown molding that lifted. This ended up letting ants in our room. They made it into our luggage, clothes and one of the beds. They moved us to a room with a door that didn’t work.

Close to Disney, but not as close as they say. Walking not advised. Driving distance 2mins.  VERY clean with everything one needs. Fridge, micro, coffee maker, iron and board, blow dryer. Room was quiet and we got a beautiful view of fireworks.

We stayed here for Disneyland. Took a lyft for $6 to the Harbor Drive entrance. Saved us the $20 in parking, or the extra mile walk. The hotel was very quiet, and we could see the fireworks from our room. Seemed updated within the last year, very very clean. We were impressed, compared to other hotels the same distance away for twice as much money. The breakfast was general continental; waffles, yogurt and cereal. When we come back to Disney we will stay here again. Thanks!

Newly remodeled great place for Disney land trip not to far. Bus stop right next hotel fast food close. Even liquor store for snacks. Bed was comfortable.  Quite and right by free way exit and entrance

I booked a room and then couldn't find my reservation confirmation in my e-mail box.  I called to confirm my reservation and was told I didn't have a reservation.  This, of course, involved talking to a central reservations desk rather than the front desk after several transfers...that seems to be how things are done these days.  I didn't think much about it until I was charged for the "no-show".  I called the company to discuss the circumstances and experienced the several phone transfers necessary to get to someone who can do anything about it and was unsuccessful in getting someone to care.  Don't waste your time with this hotel chain.

To close at Disneyland, great people so friendly, cleaned room nice swimming pool and general great place for stay with the family or friends. This is my second time in this hotel and never have a problem.

Clean room, decent free breakfast and 10 min walk to Disneyland.  Free parking.  Recently renovated room.  Staff all very helpful as 3/4 of us got the flu during our stay.  Bonus our room and backside breezeway had fantastic view of the fireworks.

Stayed here to be close to Disneyland and the hotel offered complementary breakfast. The breakfast featured toast, danishes, crusty donuts, diy waffles, store yogurt, and (for one day) mushy apples. To drink: coffee and orange juice. It was nothing close to special. Our room was what we needed- a bed and a toilet. Clean with a fridge and microwave. Biggest complaint was the noise! The air conditioning/heater was extremely noisy! You could hear each time a nearby room turned on the water or someone walked in the hallway. And lastly, the fireworks....the nighttime fireworks show at Disney must be right over the hotel because it sounded like we were in the middle of a war! Absolutely terrifying since it started right as we arrived!! But really nice to be able to see the fireworks

This hotel was fine. We got a great deal. Apparently the breakfast spread was pretty good looking. Rooms are a weird green ha! Definitely would not stay here if you want a less than two mile walk to the park (we were initially fine with that walk, but you have to cross over the bridge on Harbor, cross the freeway on-ramp and then a couple large intersections. South Gate Ramada would be more ideal. We were there on a weird night with a lot of wind and it stayed fairly quiet in our room with all that happening. We needed a bed, and for the price, this bed was perfect.

great for completing family business now completed was worth the drive from Sacramento to Anaheim just relaxing and most of a really great staff whom are Ahmed,,Sue,and Stephanie i think are the greatest on the planet

This place is left a mess and continues to be treated this was. Staff and cleanliness are mismanaged. Claims to be a 3 star in and should be a 2 star motel or tent off skid row. Overal appearance leaves a lot to be desired. A/C is broken in rooms and food is old. Honestly stay somewhere else, it’s worth it. To you and your family.

We had a mediocre experience here. Our room was clean. On our first day, we were missing towels. When we called down to the front desk, we were told to come and get them because no one was there from housekeeping to bring them up. Breakfast was mediocre at best- it is held in a very small space and the options are almost entirely carbs (no protein- eggs, meat). No complaints about noise from the RV park like other reviewers, we barely knew it was there. However, anticipate the Disneyland fireworks at 9:30 pm every night.

Had a surprisingly pleasant stay. I was worried because I had booked a room the day of our arrival and that by booking so last minute we would certainly be at a questionable hotel. However, that was not the case. The check in process was quick. The rooms were quiet and clean. I am a stickler for cleanliness and the first thing I did was check the mattress for bed bugs and check the sheets for hair or dirt. I didn’t find either. So I was pleased. Breakfast was okay - would’ve loved to see some more variety. Service was great. I can’t complain, and I would definitely return.

Summary Heading: Booked 3 night stay, left after 16 hours
Summary: TERRIBLE STAY!! We had a 3 night stay booked and we left early Sunday morning after checking in around 4 PM the prior day. If you are a young family going to Disneyland I would avoid this hotel completely.   Check in was fine. I requested and upstairs room and they gave it to me. However I did not know there is no elevator at this hotel. We have two young kids (7 and 5) so we obviously had a lot of stuff with us, but since there is no elevator to get things into your room, we had to lug everything up a flight of stairs. We dealt with it.   The night we stayed, there was a very loud contingent of high school students who were super loud from the time fireworks ended until almost midnight. I called the front desk at around 10:30 PM and they said they would take care of it, but it

This hotel is nicely located close to Disneyland.  The room was clean and tidy. Very spacious considering the cost. Friendly and helpful staff. Free parking The WiFi is a little temperamental unfortunately. Definitely recommend.

First time here and very pleased with room. Clean and well kept. Comfortable beds and updated bathroom. Close to a good Italian restaurant called Carolina Italian Restaurant which serves quality meals within a minute walk from the motel. Twenty minute walk to Disneyland but a bus ride available for$5.20 each way.

Clean room, professional friendly staff.  What more could you ask for?! The front desk personnel were terrific.  Within walking distance of Disneyland.  We had a great happy 9 day stay.  We’d try to stay here everytime we come.  Thank you!

This is my 4th stay at this property and they did not disappoint. I have stayed here because the hotel is nice and not too far of a walk from the Disneyland park. It is also decently priced. This was the first time I have needed to interact with the front desk besides check in. Everyone we talked to was so nice and helpful. We even had a lightbulb burn out in our bathroom... I reported it on the way out for the day and it was fixed when we returned.

Though it looks a little old from the outside, don’t be fooled.  For a value hotel it’s very nice on the inside and the people were extremely nice!   The room was very clean and the beds were comfortable.  Though it didn’t have a fridge, it did have a coffee/tea maker!   5-7 minutes from Mickey’s Parking Garage and 10 minutes from a huge Walmart for any forgotten items (or cheaper than the parks souvenirs, seriously it had an amazing Disney section).  Staff were very polite and helpful!  They even had my room ready ahead of time and I was able to check in at 12:30! Very satisfied and would definitely stay here again!

Extended out holiday by one day so had to check out of our current hotel  and then found a room in the Ramada. Rating based on $$ value vs amenities considering Distance to park. Here's the skinny:  - When at Disney, we spend very little time in Hotel. Usually most of our time is spent at park or other attractions  - The room was $115 (USA) less than the hotel we were staying in (previous hotel was a 12 min walk from Disney main gate square).  - Average breakfast included. Previous Hotel had none  - Room was clean, reasonably updated. Beds comforatble, bathroom clean and modern.        - Found to be a 24 min walk from Disney / Adventure main gate square. - Found to be $7 Lyft/Uber from Disney's Maingate Taxi stand. Uber/Lyft and Taxis readibly availible all day, all night. -

My son and I went to Mickey's Halloween Party. It was fun, but that's not the purpose of this review. The purpose of this review is to talk about my experience at Ramada by Wyndham Anaheim Maingate North so you can decide if it's worth it or not.  When my son and I checked-in the hotel, the room looked nice and they look just like the pictures that other people took of the place. What the pictures don't convey is the noise we experienced.  First, our room had a view of a RV parking area that's located next door to our hotel. That wasn't so bad, but we could hear people partying beyond 12am. I mean, I get it - Disneyland, but c'mon people!!! Fortunately, the partying was drowned out by the noisy a/c system. It's old and I think they need upgrading. So that pretty much covers the

This hotel doesn’t seem very nice from the outside. They let me check in an hour earlier so we could get to Disneyland at 3. It is only a couple of blocks from Disney. Very good location bc in the same parking lot the bus stop is there where a Disney shuttle can pick you up. You can buy shuttle tickets at the hotel and the shuttle schedule is posted at their front desk. It runs every 30 minutes. They have a huge menu available however I cannot review on that bc we didn’t take advantage.  The front desk seemed to always be busy in the back office, as she didn’t know there was a line of about 4 people after 10 minutes. The bathroom is my only complaint bc I had to turn the hot water lever all the way to the hottest for it be warm. Very small, like you can barely shut the bathroom

After bookings.com book me in a room at the Frontier Motel in Anaheim which had to be the most disgusting place I've ever been in my life I pulled into the Ramada Inn and was saved. A wonderful lady named Sue help me out got me a room two double beds refrigerator and was so nice so pleasant so understanding I couldn't say enough good things about this lady. Not only will I be back I guarantee my friends will be back here to when we visit Disneyland again next year.

nice hotel, rooms are clean, pool, free breakfast. open 24 hrs good location close to disney, golf and lots of restaurants and shopping. would stay there again. auto pancake maker was really neat. also waffles

When I checked out I asked for proof that the authorization for $200.53 would, in fact, be processed as $150.53 which is the rate I booked the room for (the extra $50 had been authorized as some sort of security deposit).  Despite repeated assurances from their very rude Manager Chris that the $50 would not be charged, he refused to let the front desk person write that on my copy of my bill at check out.  He was rude, talked over me any time I tried to explain why I wanted that proof (in the event the hotel made an error and charged me, I needed something in writing to prove I didn't owe it), he told me I didn't know what I was talking about, and he even insinuated I was lying when I told him I run the lending division for a financial institution and understand very well how

Room was very nice, clean and well maintained. Has everything was needed, sheets were clean and room was well décor. We will definitely will stay there again. very close to Disneyland. We didn't experience any problem well located and we are really happy with the service.

The hotel was kept clean (but are dated) and stocked. But the noise was bad. I heard evey person near our room, and the stomping above us. There are not refrigerators in the rooms. The rooms have the AC unit next to one bed so that bed gets very cold (with only sheets available). It is close to Disneyland but you pay extra for the shuttle passes.

Lovely property. Very close to Disney, could watch the firework display. Staff lovely, extremely helpful. What I like most was laundry facilities, great if you have kids. Rooms large and clean. Would recommend it highly

Summary Heading: A decent and affordable option in the Disneyland resort area
Summary: This property is located on the "other side" of I-5.  Not as many choices for lodging.  The property is a typical two floor "motel type" of lodging.  Access to guest rooms are from the outside.  The property on the outside definitely shows it's age in the nondescript style.  The interiors of the lobby, breakfast room and guest rooms looks to have gone through a quick facelift with newer style furnishings and Pergo type flooring.  Guest rooms are adequately furnished with your basic motel type furniture.  Room temp controlled by wall mounted AC unit; no separate thermostat. The beds are adequate but could certainly use replacing.  Formica bathroom counter is located as part of the room; not separate.  The bathroom is small with a tub shower and toilet.  Bathroom hardware is worn

This hotel wasn't as horrible as the reviews claim, that being said it's no 3 star hotel. Bed's are comfortable, breakfast leaves something to desire but at least it was free. Would be nice to have the egg wrap and meat. Free parking and wifi was nice. No trash or ice bags provided in the room and there was a creepy hallway to get to my room. Overall, I paid a low price to stay here, but if I'd paid full price I would have been upset.

A clean and well kept up hotel with free breakfast included.   We have stayed here twice now when coming to Disneyland and will likely come back again. There isn’t an elevator, so be prepared to carry your luggage up a flight of stairs if on the second floor.

We enjoyed our stay at this hotel. I was a bit leery after reading some reviews, but honestly, I don’t know if those people were just super picky or what,  we were very pleased with the room. The hotel was not as close to Disneyland as I thought it was going to be, that was my fault, not the hotel’s. It was a $5 Uber ride to the park, which was great, no parking hassles!! Our room was clean and comfortable, and the area around the hotel was quiet. I would definitely stay at this hotel in the future.

We stayed here during Thanksgiving weekend while visiting Disneyland. We were pleasantly surprised that the rooms were actually modern and updated. Clean rooms, complimentary continental breakfast and shuttle to the park (additional charge). Let's be honest, you're spending most the time in the park and on the hotel room so why splurge on the room cost, Disneyland is already so expensive. It's not walking distance to the park, and you have to wait for the shuttle. If I had small children I might want to stay closer. There's an Italian restaurant next door and a convenience store walking distance. We could see the fireworks from our room. Overall good experience. Would recommend for a clean value motel.

Stephanie greeted us when we walked in with a great smile and was so friendly.  Our check in process was literally 5 minutes tops I mentioned which direction we should look at night for fireworks and she gave a room facing towards the fireworks.  When we got to our room our ac wasn’t working. I called Stephanie and in seconds she had us a new room assigned. You have an amazing employee there and as a hotel manager myself I know they are hard to find. The room was great. It was comfortable and clean and newly updated. We will definitely be back.

I ended up at this hotel after I had to leave a hotel due to an uncleanliness issue.  I was  greeted by friendly understanding staff.  The room was luxurious for the price.  And super clean.  Love the big pillows too.  Nice pool plenty of parking and beautiful view of the Disneyland fireworks.  I will stay again.

This is a nice place to stay if you plan to visit Disneyland.   The motel is very clean. The beds are comfortable. This is one of the few motels, that I have visited, that have comfortable pillows.   Our room was quiet—away from a busy street.   The staff was friendly and very accommodating. The cleaning staff was excellent.   It is about 1.5 miles from the Disneyland main entrance. The shuttle stops near the motel—in front of the neighboring motel.   Will definitely consider staying there the next time we visit.

This hotel is a great location as is near Disneyland but not so close to be noisy. Rooms are spotless and pool is nice. You can see fireworks from parking lot. Tv is small but who comes to Anaheim to watch TV?

Summary Heading: Good hotel. Not so hot Breakfast Bar.
Summary: My only hang up was the break had waffles, pancakes, cereal and diff types of bread and bagels.   There was no Ham, Sausage, Eggs, Hash-brown or briskets and gravely like other medium or high end hotels.   Chose due to close proximity of Disneyland and California Adventure Theme Parks. Took the shuttle to both parks. Last shuttle leaves Disney at 10:30pm.

The hotel is a perfect if you need a clean room to get some rest. It's way above it's competition in the cleanliness department. There isn't much to see except the fireworks from the balcony and parking lot. If you are looking for a no frills place to sleep after a long day at Disneyland this is perfect. If you do not want to pay for  fancy lobby's and high parking rates this is a good spot. If you need to choose a 2 or 3 star location but  do not want to feel the need to  disinfect the place yourself before the kids are allowed to touch anything at all then look no further. Standard rooms do not have a fridge. There was no  microwave in my

Pretty decent hotel at affordable cost for family trip to Disney Land. Close proximity,free breakfast are added advantage.internet service is poor and unreliable. Bedsheets are very old and looked dirty even though they were washed.

Easy access to mass transportation. A couple of restaurants and a liquor story within walking distance. If you go into the parking lot at 9 pm you can see the pyrotenic display at Disneyland. Other than the fireworks noise it’s a quiet property.

Very satisfied.   Great service.  Staff did everything they could to help us with our needs.   I will definitely stay here again.   They held out bags safely and allowed us to use the pool since our flight was later than check out

Summary Heading: A great place to stay when visiting Disneyland
Summary: The location was great, room quality was amazing for the price, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. My only complaint was with the breakfast, which could have been better, but that is so minor I wouldn't let it affect my decision to stay here again. I would definitely recommend this hotel if you are planning a Disneyland vacation!

The theme for this  review is “lost” because that’s what my wife and I experienced.We lost out on the ability to feel cared for, to be a valued member of a hotel rewards program and to all around be treated respectful and literally human. The women who gave us our “room” could care less about us being disabled. The room itself was a disaster. Terrible, dirty and screamed “unwelcome”.  We took a month and a half long trip and this room was by far the worst, and the only Ramada we stayed at out of dozens of hotels. The customer service was by far the worst.  There was a sign accusing patrons of the repercussions of stealing  from them. Awful, intrusive and insulting to say the least, especially since this was a “main gate” Disneyland hotel being advertised as part of the

Taking a few days for family fun here in California at Disneyland. Booked a three day stay here at Ramada Inn steps away to Disneyland. Hotel has just been updated has modern furniture, swimming pool. Rate depends on month so it will fluctuate . They have a rewards program if you stay three nights get one free but at different location at later date.

Our stay was excellent. The rooms were clean and location was great for a family trip to Disneyland. The value couldn’t be beat. Free parking and breakfast. The customer service was amazing as well. They were very friendly and accommodating, even at 2am when we checked in after our late flight. Would definitely recommend it to anyone.

Summary Heading: My friend and I got food poisoning from the restaurant and...
Summary: My friend and I got food poisoning from the restaurant and the manager did nothing about it when we reported it

Summary Heading: Not quite a 3 star rated hotel
Summary: This property is rated as a 3 star but its more like a 2 star. The beds weren't very comfortable and the T.v. was small with limited channel options.  Internet connection was too slow to use our fire stick to make up for it. Breakfast was ok only because of the cool pancake maker but not much to talk about. Overall it was a decent place for a last minute booking.

arrived on extremely late flight from LAX. Got to hotel after 0200. Check in was fast and easy. Attendant was very nice, offered us late check out since we were arriving so late. Plenty of free onsite parking. Hotel was quiet and grounds are well maintained. Room was clean and spacious. Beds very comfortable. Would stay here again.

Uncomfortable beds. Room had a odd smell. Bed sheets smelled odd as well. Television was a bit too small. Air ventilation was not that great. Stuffy room especially on a hot day. Short distance from Disneyland.

Rooms weren’t bad. Shower head made a noise when it was on so it was annoying. Bed was uncomfortable to me because I’m used to memory foam. It’s loud in the morning quiet at night. Overall ok stay tho

Summary Heading: Decent for price and proximity to Disneyland
Summary: Stayed a couple of nights celebrating daughter’s college graduation at Disneyland. Very close to parks. Area is a bit sketchy at night. We stayed in pairs. Room appeared clean. But there was permanent staining in tub and walls/doors could have been wiped down easily. Bed was comfortable. Only noise was when people began waking up for Disneyland about 6:30. Did not eat the breakfast.

Great for the price. It's a 20 min walk to the park -- but you really can't beat the price and the free parking included. They also let us leave our car there after we checked out -- a great way to not pay for parking at Disney.

Great location close to Disneyland, easy walk or catch a bus for $5 from the bus stop out the front.  Rooms were clean, tidy & comfortable. All the staff we encountered were friendly and helpful. Recommend to anyone.

We were there for a family Disney vacation.  While there my 22 year old Son was out at night for a smoke and was hauled into the office by the night manager and questioned.  Even after establishing that he was a paying guest there, the manager would not allow him to leave and threatened him with the police if he did.  He told him that he looked lowly and what was he doing out at night.  Perhaps the hotel should be in a better neighborhood if you have such a problem with people at night.  Treating one of your guests in such a manner is unacceptable.  Also, asked for an extra towel and was told that we could come down to the office and get one.  I guess customer service is not their strong suit.  Breakfast was bleak.  Only carbs and some apples.  If you are looking for cereal and

Very nice clean rooms. I liked the design. Super close to Disney, like... walking distance. Beds are nice, the carpet was new in my room. We only needed a place to rest for the night from the hard labors of walking in Disney. I recommend for the value.

I booked this through another site that said I was getting a three star hotel. This is not a 3 Star hotel. It’s a 2 Star hotel. It was very very clean! It was very quiet except during fireworks time at DL. Beds are way soft and not comfortable. It was located very close to Disneyland and the ART bus stop was super close and convenient. Down side to location is that we were located very close to long term motel rental properties that the city put the homeless in. Staff was friendly and knowledgeable. I was offered to be signed up as a Wyndham Rewards member. I said sure but was never told if I was actually signed up. After I started getting emails saying welcome to Wyndham. I was like oh I guess I got signed up. I was disappointed in the fact that I was told I was getting a 3

I didn't realize this was a wyndham property and I am an owner.  Because  of how terrible it was it makes me second guess my timeshare.  The customer service was horrible, the manager rude, and they did not give us a room with the amenities I paid for. I booked this property because it was under properitties with pools search result.  They said pool was closed and had been for months.  Instead of offering suggestions the staff argued with me and said that I should have known it was closed.  I asked how I would know that when it's not on the website.  They had no answer for me and no solutions .  The rooms aren't cleaned properly and are very small.  I would have paid a lower rate for a property without a pool if this were the case.  Never again

Summary Heading: When checked in, found unclean room. There was food on the...
Summary: When checked in, found unclean room. There was food on the floor, not vacuumed, hair's on the pillows, indicated they were not changed. When communicated to front desk, no apologies..!!!
The stay was very quite and check in was fast and the front desk staff was friendly. The location is great near all of the area attractions.

This place was clean, had a decent breakfast and was good enough for our family of four who have traveled to Disneyland a number of times.  My children are 10 and 12 and don’t need the water park at HOJO anymore as they can last all day and night at Disneyland now.  You can catch the ART bus which takes you to Disneyland, back and forth as much as u want for $3 to $5.50 per day.  You can buy the tickets at the lobby.  We will stay here again!

The only person that was nice at the recpetion was Larry. The other ladies were NOT nice at all. The day we got there the lady that look for my reservation didn't even had eye contact with me. She seem like she didn't want to be there at all. The ladies at the breakfast were very nice. The over all of the hotel was good👍🏼👍🏼
Wonderfully located to the theme parks. Kind staff and comfy rooms would recommend this room for a quick family get a away.
This place is awesome! About a mile walk to Disneyland. Super friendly staff. Nice big clean rooms. Great value! Definitely going to stay here again!

Summary Heading: Rooms are what you pay for, they are clean but a little...
Summary: Rooms are what you pay for, they are clean but a little worn. Management was very helpful at all times and went the extra mile to ensure our needs were taken care of.
Everything was great , looked exactly like the pictures. It was nice and clean . Highly recommended

We stayed 2-nights at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North for a quick trip to Disneyland. Staff were helpful and friendly. This hotel really is not within short walking distance to Disneyland, especially with small children.
The carpet was so nasty that if you rubbed a wash cloth against it it would be black. Both my kids got pink eye.

VERY VERY THIN WALLS - NOISY FROM MIDNIGHT TO 3 AM. Not sure if it was the water pipes knocking in the walls in the morning or something else. I decided to bug out the 2nd night even though it was non refundable. I couldn't stay another night. The room was clean, beds and pillows uncomfortable for me. Front desk person was indifferent when I checked in. Not much of a greeting. She wasn't rude. She was on the phone when I arrived, I'm glad I wasn't the person on the other end of the line.

I was a little hesitant to book a room here because of some reviews, but glad I did. Nice clean room with comfy beds and pillows. The breakfast preparer was super sweet and helpful. The only negative were the kinda loud people next door. I think they had more kids that the hotel was told.

Summary Heading: Very Courteous Staff and Comfortable Rooms
Summary: I spent the weekend at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North, and with every dealing with the staff at the front desk, Sue, a manager there, and Stephanie, I was greeted by a very friendly Good morning! and an immediate request on how they could help me. As I passed the cleaning staff along the walkway, they each also greeted me warmly as I passed by.  The rooms were very clean and fresh, and the property itself was a quiet location, where I relaxed and enjoyed myself following a fairly busy and hectic day.

Summary Heading: Stay here,  don't waste your money at the expensive hotels.
Summary: Perfect place to stay, it's close by Disneyland. Don't expect a lavish hotel, especially not paying a minimal amount. But expect clean & comfortable rooms. We stayed during the early part of the week and had no issues with noise outside the fireworks from Disneyland. Check in and check out was a breeze. We drove to Disneyland, since there was so many in our traveling party. Parking was a breeze and we were back to our hotel in no time. Next time we go to Disneyland this place is worth every dollar. Thanks Ramada!!!!

Summary Heading: The quality inn has much nicer staff for much better rates...
Summary: The quality inn has much nicer staff for much better rates with more spacious rooms and better breakfast. Other than Chris who was fantastic the whole time! Thank you.
Room 240 has two comfortable queen beds and the amenities--hot shower, fresh towels, morning breakfast are excellent.  No complaints.

I read the reviews about the hotel before I booked and knew what the hotel was going to be like. It was very close to Disneyland and had free parking. It was more of a motel which I didn't realize. The breakfast was perfect, it was a continental breakfast like it states. We heard the fireworks one night and it was loud, louder than I ever imagined they would be....but that was expected also. For the price it was perfect.

The location of the room was a distance from Disneyland but did driving to the park was not an issue. There were not very many eating places within walking distance but we spent most of our time at the park.
It is very clean, could use updating. Hotel staff is extremely friendly and helpful. The free breakfast exceeded our expectations. Close to Disneyland with a bus stop very close.

Summary Heading: Great place for a mini vacation!
Summary: We went on a mini vacation to Disneyland. I thought the room was great, it was clean, and spacious, I thought is was nice. You can see the Disneyland fireworks from the second floor. The parking was free and there is a Continental breakfast. The staff is nice and check in/out was very quick and easy.
This was the perfect location for our trip to Disneyland. We were there for 4 nights and the hotel was great! Satisfied all of our needs and were able to get a great night of sleep every night!

Needed a last minute hotel after a solid day at Disneyland. The accommodations were average for a low budget Priceline find. Had to leave early in the AM so really just slept and left. I'd stay here again with similar circumstances.

The motel itself was ok.  The room was clean and fairly updated.  They need to add more and/or thicker sheets because they were scarce.  The front desk was not very friendly at all, nor helpful.  Close to Disneyland with a shuttle stop right outside the motel.  Free breakfast was basic and they needed to keep up with the cleanliness more.

We were very satisfied with our stay at Ramada. The staff was friendly and helpful. The room was clean and appeared to be well maintained. Didn't see anything run down. No problems with parking. And it was nice being able to purchase our ART Shuttle Bus tickets to Disneyland right there in the office and the pick-up/drop-off was nearby. Very convenient. We'd have no problem staying there again.

The managers at this location were very unfriendly.  would NOT work with us when our daughter was rushed to the hospital on the date we were scheduled to check in.  Even though we rescheduled our trip and reserved rooms here again they refused to give us a any credit for the the night we had to cx last minute due to an health emergency.  We will NEVER stay here or use Ramada again!

Summary Heading: Just needed a bed within distance of Disneyland
Summary: Hotel had no elevator for room I had, decore was bad because it felt like a normal hotel not one near Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Ehhh. The rooms weren’t shabby but they wwere very spartan.  def  were nothing at all special. Very spartan
Summary: This place was not all that at all. I expected the place to be better being a Ramada. I’m not saying I would never stay here again, but I’m def gonna look for something better before I do resort to staying here. Yeah  I’m diappointed
This is the second time we stayed there. It is a nice place to stay and is really close to Disney

Summary Heading: Needs to be remodeled badly. I would not recommend
Summary: Older hotel needs to be remodeled badly. I wouldn’t recommend. Hotel not to Wyndham standards.
Room was ok, no towels for the sink...check in had to wait several minutes while customer before me toured the room...before renting. Alittle irritating.

Summary Heading: Disabled guests shouldn’t be punished, the staff lied and had no interest in being helpful.
Summary: My colleague had a broken ankle, they wouldn’t allow her a ground floor room, they have no elevator, so when she said she couldn’t do stairs (on crutches) they actually charged her for the room even though she had to find another hotel with a room she could actually get into!  She never even stayed here and still had to pay!  The next day, the manager on duty, Miguel, said that they were not sold out of ground floor rooms the previous day when she checked in so they could have moved her. But still, they are charging her because she didn’t cancel within 24 hours of arrival. How was she supposed to know there is no elevator and that the person working LIED about no ground floor rooms being available?  Shane in you Ramada, and your horrible staff!

Summary Heading: They put us in a handicap room & we are not .
Summary: They put us in a handicap room & we are not the water ran out of the shower into the other room. If you have any diet restrictions like gluten free there was nothing to eat not even fruit. They told us we could park in front of our room wrong we had to back out of the area there was 1way in . I have not heard of charging you for an early check in charge !

Wow this place has a great value. Free parking, free breakfast, and only a $6 Uber to Disneyland. The manager checked us in at the front desk and he was very friendly and helpful. The property has an Italian restaurant next door and a convenience store only 1 minute away. The rooms are spacious, we had no trouble fitting 4 people and all our bags inside.   The only thing that could be approved upon is the breakfast- it's only sugar and carbs. How about some cut fruit, potatoes, or oatmeal. The coffee wasn't that great tasting so we stuck to hot tea.  I will stay there again next time so we can save money for the park.
It was wonderful last min stay and had a room available and parking directly in front of the room.
