Room was clean, service was average. Said they had a pool but pool was closed for renovations. Also did see a couple of roaches in the restroom.

Went for vacation good location but once in room sheets looked slept in asked for them to change them the bathtub wasn't holding water they fixed that too friendly check in the breakfast needs protein for people with soy allergies

Summary Heading: Amenities were not good.. breakfast served lacked even eggs and real butter for bread.
Summary: Please don't go to this property as it is almost more than a mile away from Disney and they do not serve continental breakfast as promised by them.. Even eggs are not part of the breakfast menu and there was no butter even for the bread only available option was spread.

Good location close to Disneyland and rooms were updated but bedding needs attention. Very thin substandard comforter / bed spread. Also, staff made no acknowledgement of my Wyndam Rewards status. This is something the brand needs to work on. It is hit and miss that they make you feel valued.
My  Wife and I stayed there a couple nights ago and  as we entered the room there we saw ants on  the door and we noticed there is no blankets on the bed. All they had were throws to sleep with.

This was rated three stars on priceline but I’d have to give it a two star. No fridge. Ants crawling on the door. No blankets. Just really thin throw and sheet on bed. Staff was friendly just not impressed with room.

The property is being updated, which is great. The rooms overall were ok. The beds are hard, and the individual air condition units in the room will wake you every 20 minutes. I ran to buy something from the store in the morning, and the women at the desk was too busy playing a game on the computer to look up. Why the one star? The property knew they were changing out their transformer, yet didn’t let any of their guests know. I was in the middle of blow drying my hair, when the power went out at 8 AM. After calling down they gave me no time frame. I booked through Priceline, and thankfully their customer service rep called down to get a time, the very rude woman at the desk would not do for me. Don’t stay here. Even if you get a good deal, is location to Disney isn’t even the

Summary Heading: Awesome price should have been a hint...
Summary: Overall I was in a pinch and looking for some place that was rated as 3 star by Priceline. I'm not sure how this hotel was rated 3 stars. The rooms are tiny and so is the 20 or so inch TV, but would be fine for a 2 star. There was hair in the shower/tub and curtain from the previous occupants and they were long and black strands so I don't know how housekeeping would have missed them. The pool has apparently been under renovation for months... And where there's construction, there are portable restrooms. A lovely side affect of those restrooms is that the pool is in the middle of the complex so when they come to empty the restrooms, the stench makes it's way into your room and sticks to your cars that are all parked right around it. I realized that since I booked through

Our bathroom had a mold spot that grew over time and the toilet was overflowing from the tank every time we used it..construction directly adjacent to our room. Several drunk people in the parking lot and bus stop.
Experienced a power outage on my second night stay but no one addressed it or tried to tell me what was going on. We ended up getting a new hotel.

The staff and hotel here were fine, pretty comfortable, but there was a neighbor that took very long showers and each time they took a shower there was a loud, high pitched noise that at first sounded like an alarm going off. They took 3-4 showers in the 2 nights we stayed, and each lasted around 45 minutes to an hour and a half (at all hours of the night). I forgot to let the front desk know about this when I checked out, but it was awful!

This hotel is supposed to be in the Disneyland the sanity but is not actually very close to Disneyland. The hotel was a little bit run down and parking was atrocious. The one bright spot was the breakfast. Although they ran out of  fresh fruit the first day and did not have any fruit the second day. The bathrooms were clean the beds and rooms were nice. This hotel deafly does not deserve a three star rating. It is a solid two star hotel and for the right price is definitely worth it. I would never pay more than $70 a night for this type of hotel.

Summary Heading: There is no elevator which made it challenging with our...
Summary: There is no elevator which made it challenging with our stroller. The staff was super helpful! The front desk operator turned down the music while I was on a conference call, a housekeeper helped me carry my stroller down the stairs, and a food service worker brought my son his sword he left in the eating area. The staff is super nice, decent breakfast, and the rooms were comfortable and clean. Biggest downer was there was not an elevator and we probably got the last parking spot. Other than that I enjoyed the stay.

Honestly the stay was fine however during an interaction with the front desk I felt very uncomfortable. I went to ask for a few towels and the man asked my bf for the room number he wasn’t even by the front desk or the one to ask and yet anytime I answered the man would not acknowledge me as a person he would by pass me however he did toss me the towels but I felt disrespected as he would not even look at me. Like he had something against me. Other then that it was fine
Check in was pretty quick. Staff was very pleasant. Location to Disneyland was a short bus ride. Overall, our stay here was good.

Summary Heading: Thought the distance to walk to Disney was longer than...
Summary: Thought the distance to walk to Disney was longer than expected...place is more motel than hotel style...though walk to Disney was longer drive there was easy...eat your breakfast early if you come in last hour most food was gone or empty...

Summary Heading: Not as hotel is described at all
Summary: The hotel is not clean at all, puddles of water all outside by the rooms because of leaks, ac in room didn’t work, staff wasn’t friendly, free breakfast was gone within two hours of it starting, pool was closed which was very disappointing, food service was crazy outside service, employees weren’t friendly. Tried to get help due to ac and pool out and they just said sorry nothing we can do. Totally not worth the money
The staff were not helpful. There was no place for us to park our car for the night in the parking lot.  People were loud all day and night.  I will not go back to this location in the future.
Property is near Disney, which is all it has going for it. Rooms are dated and dingey. Breakfast would have been average, but they ran out of fruit and didn’t refill.
I booked this hotel through Priceline.  Upon arrival the customer service was awful.  It took over a hour to get a cot delivered to our room at 11pm.

Summary Heading: A very clean and quite place to stay
Summary: I really enjoy staying here. The check in was fast and easy, the rooms are always clean. It is close to the freeway that makes it easy to visit local attractions. I have never had any problems staying here and would recommend it to my family and friends.

This hotel worked for us. We only needed a bed basically. The room was clean and breakfast was your typical continental breakfast with pancakes and waffles. Just enough to get our day started before heading to Disneyland. I guess you could walk to the parks, but there is a hill to get over the freeway.The price we paid was perfect and esp with the free parking and breakfast!

Summary Heading: Not much different from a dank motel
Summary: Maintenance and upkeep is poor, the place is really a motel that is charging hotel rates. The disinfectant / room freshener used in the rooms has a somewhat strange odor, even if not offensive. Ramada clearly doesn't care about what level of property it lends its brand to. I have stayed at the Ramada Plaza Anaheim (on Katella Avenue on the other side of Disney) during my previous visit to Disneyland in the summer of 2017, and had a great experience there (nice rooms, clean and well-maintained property, great WiFi, good breakfast etc). As I was booking for a last-minute trip, I didnt get a room at that property - but booked @ the Maingate instead, believing that I would have a similar experience. Big mistake!  Dirty water puddles at different spots, a crowded breakfast room,
I would like to recommend this hotel to family and friends. You can walk to Disney in 15-20 minutes.

Summary Heading: Okay for the price you're getting
Summary: Overall, a good stay.  Room is okay but smelly.  Breakfast was okay for the price you are getting per night, which was $80 dollar. However, it's pretty close to Disneyland park so can't complained right?
Very reasonable rate because of Priceline.  No problems.  Checked in late without issue and enjoyed the included breakfast.  Second time we stayed there and will be happy to return.

The customer service was horrible, the desk clerk and the manager were extremely rude and unhelpful. The rooms are old, and not very clean. Parking is terrible and they have no elevator to get to the second floor.
I really liked the staff and location of the hotel. It was very nice yet affordable. I would stay there again. Recommend
Rooms very spacious.  Staff was able to accommodate for all three rooms to be next to each other. Close proximity to Disneyland.

This hotel is absolutely perfect in a number of ways. It is dated in the outside but nicely updated internally. It was me and my two years old for two nights and it couldn’t have been more perfect. Despite the outside access to the rooms, the interiors are updated. Free breakfast was a big driver of our stay and you can’t beat the value. Proximity to Disney (1 walking mile) is good too but we ubered a couple of times. All in all, for the few hours we spent in the room....perfect. Clean but a bit noisy.

Summary Heading: Great stay but pool was closed for renovations
Summary: The staff was awesome. The food was great. Rooms clean. We were bummed to find out upon checkin that the pool was closed for the next couple months for renovations. This would have been helpful to know beforehand since my kids were really looking forward to playing in the pool.  It was a great stay and the hotel was nice. I didn’t realize when I booked this that we’d have to walk over freeways to get to Disneyland. But overall, very good stay for the price

Summary Heading: Great location but that’s it. The property is run down and not very appealing. We’ve stayed at other   Remodel ends
Summary: We’ve stayed at other  ramada inns that were way more clean and safe feeling this one was not. From the time we check in to the time we left it was not a good experience. The location is great. Buts that’s it

The beds were awful. The mattresses were hard and the pillows were lumpy. Had we stayed more than one night, I would have talked to the front office to see if we could at least get new pillows. It took a few hours the next day to get the kinks out. Other than the beds, this was a decent stay. The front desk clerk was helpful and efficient. We didnt encounter any noise. The room was clean and was stocked with what we needed for the night. There was ample parking. The breakfast was decent. They have a waffle and pancake maker, cereal, yogurt, and pastries. We didn't see any fruit.  This hotel is NOT walking distance to Disneyland, so plan accordingly. I would probably stay here again if the beds are updated. If not, not a chance.
From the staff to the room which was freshly renovated everything was great. Would stay and will stay there again
Room size was great. Easily accessible to rooms. Parking was limited due to construction to pool area. TV was small for the room size.

Summary Heading: Expected much more for the price
Summary: This hotel was clean and comfortable, however I expected much more for the price. Front desk staff was very slow and left us standing for over 15 minutes, without even acknowledging us, while they (two of them) tried to help another guest.  We just needed towels because our room only had one at check in.

Charged my card 100 bucks for smoking in the room when I don't even smoke. Terrible experience, loud rooms, musty, a.c. doesn't work, pillows smell like every single person that's ever stayed there. Bought a fan to bring in the room to move the air around because the a.c. unit literally turned on and off.

The room was nice. A few broken things, but we did not mind. We worked around it. The front desk was awesome. We originally had a room with no refrigerator or microwave. Front desk moved us, no problem. I wish the complimentary breakfast had more healthy options. But our refrigerator made up for it.  The internet was slow, but I find usually is the case in hotels. I would stay again.

Summary Heading: Our stay was great. Close enough to Disneyland to walk...
Summary: Our stay was great. Close enough to Disneyland to walk. Food in the morning was good. Hotel was clean and staff were few Friendly
Location was easy access off freeway,very close to all of the local attractions. Staff was friendly and very helpful. will be back when in area again.

I booked these reservations through Priceline.  I was promised a 3-star hotel.  I wouldn't say that the Ramada Maingate North is a 3-star hotel, but I felt that I got a good deal staying there.  The price was very reasonable for Thanksgiving weekend and the accommodations were average.  The room was clean, and the entire staff we dealt with was very friendly.  The only drawback to this place is that the Anaheim Resort Transit bus serving this motel is awful.  It's not their fault, but you should know if you're going to stay there, your A.R.T, route is terrible.  In fact we finally figured out that it was better to get off at the first stop on Harbor Blvd and walk the remainder of the way to the Motel than to wait for the bus to drop us off there.  Overall, average accommodations
Very clean hotel with great suites within walking distance of Disney . Breakfast is very basic but nice to have available, unfortunately the front desk staff was less than helpful.

We spent 3 nights and found the Ramada very comfortable. Rooms were clean and beds were comfortable. Housekeeping was very good. Breakfast was average, but also a value as well as sufficient. Only minor complaint I had was the front desk. I dealt with 3 different attendants and all shared the same characteristic. No smiles and not overly friendly. On one incident, I waited as no one was at desk. I needed to shout hello and then she came out with a mouthful of food and along with the rest of her breakfast. All in all, I would re visit this Ramada based on all other amenities, location and close proximity to restaurants and attractions.

Summary Heading: Smelly with someone else's sock left under the ironing board
Summary: Booked this motel on the Hotel.com app and I had a free room. Walked into this room and it was musty smelling. There was no comforter on the bed just a thin blanket and sheets. The rug was frayed at the threshold. The shower ceiling had black spots on it not sure if it was mold. There was a pair of socks left under the iron board from some other person. Because I booked a non refundable room there was nothing I could do. I spent the first night but checked out because I couldn't spend another night there. I had to use a Bobby pin to keep the curtain from opening and having the light shine through. I get it's a motel but I would rather sleep else where and forfeit my room than to sleep on more night. I will have to spend a tad more for a refundable room next time or I will not

Reserved via Priceline, expected a nicer place/location. As I drove in to the parking lot, I could see several transients, and made me uncomfortable about leaving my car. Beds where Dusty, tub dirty, appears room was updated, clerk appeared to have no people skills.

Went for a family trip to Disneyland & Universal Studios, and this hotel worked perfect. We were kept busy sun up to sun down so didn’t need a fancy hotel. We wanted something clean, quiet, and a easy drive to Disney. We will use this hotel again! Some things we found include,  Pros: This hotel is about one mile from Disney (translate cheaper then across the street from Disney), in a quiet neighborhood, & easy to get to the freeway. Room was clean, beds were firm (we didn’t mind, but if you need a squishy mattress this may not work).  Cons: The walls are thin, continental breakfast needs a couple protein options to accompany the carb options, and it would be nice if the room had a fridge, (but none of these things are a deal breaker).

Location was perfect, we walked to Disneyland in the morning, but took the ART bus on our return back from the park. The value, location and customer service were all great. Rooms were clean and comfortable. Only issue was parking, their isn't enough for the number of guests checked.

Hotel management at the Ramada Maingate North Anaheim was very accommodating to our requests and needs. In particular, Sue was amazingly helpful.  Next time, I will book directly through Ramada. Thank you!

Very clean and nice, though there are some aspects that could be improved. There are not enough parking spaces, though they advertise parking is included in the stay. We returned from Disneyland around 10:30 pm and there were no spaces left except for (not even a parking space) space in the corner of the parking lot near the broken/extra furniture that was covered with a blue tarp. We made it work, but it is sad if they advertise space and do not actually have enough. They suggested to wait an hour until the restaurant next door that they share a parking lot with closed. Though they say they will tow people, it doesn't seem like making customers' paid parking space is a priority. The continental breakfast was kind of light. There were only waffles, pastries, cereal, juice (that

Summary Heading: Decent place to stay not far from Disney
Summary: This hotel looks recently remodeled and is a very decent place to stay for the price.  It is not dirty or out dated, it is nice enough if you don't want to spend a lot.  I would stay here again in the future if I had to make my way back to the area.

This was one of my worst hotel experiences. It’s also my first ever review.  I gave my wife the weekend off and took the kids to Disneyland myself. Not a lot of notice, so I was glad to find rooms available. I had issues with not having an ID with me (LONG story) and Ramada allowed me to pay cash and use the scanned copies of ID I had with me. I appreciated that immensely. The room smelled of smoke, but it was clean. The beds were comfortable enough. We checked in late - after Disneyland closed; so I requested late check out. That was “no problem”, and we could check out at noon, so we went to bed.  Sounded like a party above us, plenty of stomping around. But we were all so tired it didn’t bother us too much.  In the morning we woke up late and I got in the shower. Just as I

Summary Heading: Close to Disneyland without the Disneyland Price
Summary: Clean, close to Disneyland, fairly priced, and a great complimentary breakfast!  What more could you want?
I was worried because I booked through PRICELINES EXPRESS DEAL, but was very pleased. Only downside was kinda far for walking to Disneyland and no fridge in room.

Summary Heading: Poor guest service, Long Hair’s on bathroom ceiling, plug in bathtub broke when checked into both rooms
Summary: When checking in, asked for roll-a-way bed, took over an hour to receive because after personally going to see what was taking so long, the hotel clerk was on her personal phone. She also did not mention to tell us there was an additional $10.00/night until finding this out when checking out. Had we known, we would have take it back sooner. The bathroom had hairs on the ceiling and the bathtub plugs were broke in both rooms. Would not have been bad but the issues mentioned above was disappointing when staying a week. Not worth the cost either.

I had a pleasantly unremarkable stay here. While the accommodations were basic, the room was clean and the bathroom appeared to be recently updated. Crisp white sheets on the bed greeted me (reinforcing the clean look of the room) and there were no mechanical issues.

Great end to a long day at Disneyland! Close to park, Convenient location, Clean and Comfortable room, and professional staff!  Internet was a little slow, but everything else was so good that we didn't even care. Breakfast was delicious, fresh, and appealing.
Room was spacious and clean. Beds were very comfortable. Staff allowed us to park our car there for the day, even though we had checked out that morning.
Easy to check in. Night staff were super friendly. Room was clean. Really nice restaurant right next door.

We stayed here while visiting Disneyland park and really enjoyed it. Rooms were up to date with a extra clean bathroom. Kids enjoyed the heated pool and the continental breakfast which included pancakes and waffles. Friendly staff and easy check in.
While my family were staying with you at your hotel out room had no tv and the manager never was able to get it fixed the 2 days were there.  Very sad thank goodness I had my laptop.

Highly recommend for a Disneyland vacation on a budget. Hotel very clean and renovated. Breakfast was perfect with coffee, fruit juice, yogurt, cereal and pastries. The fresh waffles and pancakes made it worth the stay. The kitchen staff is very good and restocking everything. Hotel room clean. Hotel staff nice but clueless when it comes to Disney questions. Overall great stay for $119 a night

Summary Heading: OK for Disney but take walking shoes
Summary: This hotel is close to Disney and with free parking here many will be thinking about walking to Disney. The distance is not that bad but, there is a interstate overpass you have to walk over.  If you are pushing a stroller up and back just be prepared especially if you are tired of walking all day.  We ended up paying for a cab a few nights because we were so exhausted from walking all day in Disney.   Cab is only about $10 bucks one way and that was for our party of 5.  Room was nice and clean, and we asked room service for extra towels and blankets and they brought us the extra each day.  Free breakfast was nice along with free parking.  Overall the hotel and stay was nice and perfect for Disney since it was inexpensive.   Our AC did not work and the front desk quickly moved

Hotel is good proximity to Disneyland parks... easy access to freeways and amenities near by. Hotel/Motel is quiet, walls and floors are thin.  Can hear footsteps and movements above while listening to conversations from your neighbors beside. Continental breakfast needs improvement, more fruit, maybe some meat to go with pancakes and waffles... restaurant on property... no incentive as a hotel guest to stop by for food or beverages. Went elsewhere for meals.

Summary Heading: Great little place to stay when going to Disneyland
Summary: I’m accustomed to staying at 4 to 5 star hotels for work, so please don’t mistake this for that. But for a clean room to crash in and affable service it is perfect.  Tip: catch an Uber or Lyft to the park.  Best $5 spent.

Summary Heading: Close to Disney, good enough breakfast, friendly and helpful staff
Summary: We checked in fairly late, maybe 10 o'clock or so. One guy working the desk and he was very nice and helpful. I misunderstood the map and was going the wrong way and he found me and directed me to our room. Breakfast was good. It was crowded one day, but that's to be expected. Room was good, not amazing, but you know that at this price point. Me, my wife and two kids had a great stay. If you Uber/Lyft to the park, make sure your GPS is picking you up in the parking lot of your hotel. My GPS that I was in the hotel behind the Ramada so our Lyft driver took a little extra time to find us. Wi Fi was plenty fast enough for me to stream the Dodger's game :)
Great place to stay close to Disneyland. Would recommend. The breakfast could use a bit of work, but considering most hotels in the area don't offer breakfast it is decent. No protein offered.
They had nobody to come fix the toilet. No spa. And ants in the room. Got there after midnight and had to stand outside to check in. Carpet was a little sticky.

Relaxing, peaceful resort first things I loved- golf, lighted tennis courts for perfect tennis play at night since it was 100 degrees during the day. Second the resort was clean and  beautifully kept. Loved the stream bridges and babbling brook. Disliked freezing pools, and hated the lack of cell service and you have to pay for Wi-Fi- at nice resort??? Don't get that! Condo needs better non stick pans in kitchen. But we had a relaxing visit overall.

Perk: unobstructed view of fireworks from second floor facing back of lot. Very loud! Downside: view also of inside of people’s apartments who leave their windows and doors open. Cleaning lady never cleaned because we turned here away at 9 am and she never returned. I got a spider bite on my leg while sleeping. When you or another room uses the shower the noise is defening. The beds were hard and the pillows were lumpy. They closed the breakfast doors more than five minutes before it was supposed to end. Front desk put me on hold and never came back to the call. I called back and they picked up but didn’t say anything. I called a third time and told them what happened the first two times and they didn’t care. This was also much further from Disneyland than I had anticipated. We

Summary Heading: Not impressed, location name not exactly true.
Summary: The motel is a 20 minute walk to the main gate. The ART bus only has one route passing motel (Route #10) that goes by every 30-40 minutes. Parking is good and free. Motel beds very uncomfortable room #137 was down a very dark hallway, 1st floor with a window that did not lock. Bathroom in lobby was nice. Could hear noise from upstairs room all night long.

Summary Heading: Water pipe noise sounds like a tea kettle screaming
Summary: Woke up at 4am from someone presumably taking a shower that made the pipes near my room scream like a tea kettle.  This went on and off the rest of the night/morning.  The included continental breakfast was fine, but I waited 15m just to make a waffle (at 2:30 each waffle, this feels like forever). My room was clean however, and the location was fine.  Would not stay here again.

I liked the Ramada. It was clean with newer interior. The staff were pleasant and helpful. It is conveniently located a few blocks from Disneyland with the ability to purchase bus tickets at the front desk and an ART bus stop, Rout 10, next door that drops you off at the security entrance and picks you up later (last bus is 12:30am). You cannot get dropped off any closer to the front gate! The continental breakfast was good, with fruit, cereal, milk, juice, coffee, tea and make your own waffles. It was very quiet and easy to sleep. There were a veriety of cable channels and a take out menu for all types of food. Ample free parking. Very please with the stay.

The staff was friendly, the room was clean, but the lack of minifridge complicated our week there. We used hotwire and couldn't see that a minifridge wasn't included in what we were paying for. You kind of just expect to have one in your room wherever you stay, especially during an extended stay. Overall a good experience, but was really let down by that one detail.

Summary Heading: The lobby was not open when we arrived. The gentleman who...
Summary: The lobby was not open when we arrived. The gentleman who eventually came to the lobby was very nice however. The free breakfast was so bad that we threw it out and went down the street to buy breakfast. Our expectations for this hotel stay were not very high and the hotel therefore met our expectations. It was fine for a place to sleep. Is clean and is convenient to take the ART bus into Disney. There is an Italian restaurant next to the hotel with good service and surprisingly good food!

Stayed overnight at this hotel in August.  The exterior of the hotel looks like a cheap motel.  Our room was a looong walk outside the hotel lobby and it was hard to find because of their numbering system. We had to go around the building twice to find it.  Also, I did not feel safe staying at this hotel. The breakfast was pretty bad too because there was hardly anything to choose from.

We stayed here in a recent Disneyland trip. First off, we did not choose tho hotel, it was falsely advertised as "California Disney area" by Hotwire. When we got there the check in process was rushed. The breakfast? Horrible. I am diabetic and the only food available were: pastries, fruit, yogurt, sugary cereal, pancakes and waffles...all things that are not helpful for me. There was not enough parking either. I brought up the issue, and the front desk staff raised his voice with me. I chose not to pursue it, I was on vacation after all. I parked by the restaraunt and walked to my room. Thankfully my car was ok the next morning. The room was OK...but just OK and not enough to make up horrible/rude service, insufficient parking, and terrible breakfast options. Spend your money

Summary Heading: Horrible would not ever stay here again.
Summary: We had the do not disturb sign on our door while we are away. We requested that no staff enter our room. It was very hot that week, close to 100 degrees. We came back to our room after being away for several hours and found that the staff completely disregarded the do not disturb sign , entered our room, disturbed out things and turned off the air conditioning. It took several hours to cool off the room, it was miserable. We reported this to the hotel management and still have not heard back for a resolution.
I will never stay in this hotel, where staff puts their personal live in front of guests and you feel like your bothering them from the moment you check in!

I would just like to say, if your looking for an inexpensive hotel to vacation at this is THE hotel! They had a small renovation a few years ago, and they are at it again. New dressers, night table, and writing desk to go along with the new carpets, flooring and walls. Great front desk help, great housekeepers and plenty of parking. With a restaurant in premises, what more could you ask for!

Summary Heading: Stained bed sheets. Dirty old carpet. Too much price for the condition. Breakfast is mediocre. I booked an Airbnb instea
Summary: Stained bed sheets. Dirty old carpet. Too much price for the condition. Breakfast is mediocre. I booked an Airbnb for the weekend...

My stay here exceeded my expectations; it was clean, quiet, and decor was nice. The only complaint I would have is that the breakfast is lacking a protein (beyond sugary yogurt). I would love to see some eggs and a meat offering.

Overall I was pretty disappointed with the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North. I booked through priceline as an express deal listed at 3 stars and I wouldn't say this is a 3 star hotel quality. There were HUGE spiders in my bathroom, the room was small and cramped, I could hardly understand the man working at the front desk checking me in, the continental breakfast had a selection of waffles and pancakes and not much else and when I went to check out, no one was in the office so I had to go back to my hotel room, open the door, leave the keys there then call the hotel to advise them to check me out. More hassle than it's worth.

This was definitely NOT a 3 star hotel. It's a renovated motel. Horrible vending machine ate my money front desk did not reimburse. Place looks sketchy even saw a prostitute walking into room. Gross experience not a hotel I repeat! MOTEL

Summary Heading: Inexpensive alternative for a quick Disneyland trip!!
Summary: I booked our hotel room here for 59.00 per night which included free internet, free parking, and free continental breakfast. This was literally going to be the fastest vacation in history, so I wasn't too concerned with having every amenity possible. We really just needed something clean, convenient and not too expensive because we were going to only be spending very minimal time in our room to go to our annual Halloween Disneyland Party. We arrived on Sunday night at 10:30 PM. The woman at the front desk was VERY FRIENDLY and you could tell she was not having a great night, but she treated us very well. I was traveling with my 24-year-old daughter. She asked me if I would like a 1st or 2nd floor and I opted for the 1st for obvious reasons. They put a 50.00 hold on my credit

Summary Heading: Very poor quality for your money.
Summary: Requested non-smoking, assigned room next to smoker. Cigarette smoke drifting to room. Relocated to room with dirty bathroom.. pubic hairs on bathroom. Not enough towels. Not enough time to request a another relocation. Poor sanitation of bathroom made me look bad with partner in what was supposed to be special time...
The hotel was very nice and clean. Their breakfast was good and fresh. There were some issues with their WiFi, but that happens occasionally. The pool was nice and the staff was very friendly.
This hotel was very amazing from check in to check out! Breakfast was amazing! The only problem was the remote in the room was barely working

Only thing that wasn't working was the Wi-Fi but I received a later checkout to compensate for the inconvenience. Very friendly staff and the room was extremely clean and nice. I would definitely stay here again.

The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Our rooms were spacious and clean. The location was good for our trip to Disneyland (we took Lyft for about $6). Our stay here was excellent except for the breakfast. There was only 1 fruit available - a type of apple that no one in our family liked. There was no protein, only sugar and carbs.

It is not the perfect place to visit Disney regarding its location, but more than enough for staying in it and avoid spending a lot of money in hotels with the family (shutter to Diney is possible with a reasonable price)
The beds were very uncomfortable, the air is turned off until you enter the room and it is very hot and stuffy, it took almost 8 hours for the room to cool down.

I got in late with my 8 year old son the night clerk was rude and unhelpful I was not informed of the deposit and when I told him I was not aware of a deposit he responded very rudely he told me it was $50 i told him I would have to go find a store open at that time and left I returned with $20 cash and the rest on a debit card he then proceeded to tell me that won't do he needs it all cash or all credit and I asked why didn't you tell me this this morning before I went to get the other twenty he said we can do it and it wasn't his responsibility to inform the guests of such things then called me a dumb #$@
This is in a great location for Disneyland parks.  It is clean, quiet rooms, good quick breakfast.

Years ago, as I remember,  Ramada Inn (I assume same as Ramada now) was a good, nice hotel.  I was totally disappointed with this stay, rooms are outdated, the cabinet of the TV stand was not closing.  I felt it was not worth the price we paid for the hotel.

Summary Heading: The rooms are great however the location is terrible...
Summary: The rooms are great however the location is terrible. People outside talking and listening to music till 2 am . The next morning I was awaken by A hard slam of a door and fighting. I didn't feel safe. That was our first night and had to live even though We had paid to stay there for a week. The front desk lady didn't ask why we were leaving all she said was you will not be reimbursed. mind you I did ask the front lady how safe it was when I was checking in since we were stranded there bc we couldn't get a flight back home to Houston bc if the hurricane and we weren't familiar with the area. We will not rely on 3 star hotel.

The beds were very uncomfortable resulting in a sore back. The towels were rough and not what we would expect from a 3 star hotel. Actually this is a motel advertised as a hotel! After booking through Priceline, no one that I spoke to was willing to offer me a different hotel or would even admit it was a motel.

The property is maintained properly and nice setup. Staff are friendly and helpful. Area close to everything we need. They need to replace their pillow cause it's small and all air. When using pillows it's goes flat.

we got in really late so not much of an experience the rooms are updated which is nice, but the building can use a little re vamping. It's really close to the park but we still drove since we were staying in another hotel the following day but over all good for the hotwire price.

Summary Heading: Needs major renovations. No refrigerator and the walls were...
Summary: Needs major renovations. No refrigerator and the walls were paper thin. I heard footsteps and stomping all night from the resident above.  Front desk not very welcoming at all.  The employees working in the breakfast area were kind and helpful.

I wasn't given the room the manager promised me since another employee gave it away so I had to sleep on a rollaway bed that was uncomfortable. I understand mistakes can happen but I was in no mood to find another hotel at Midnight that I could use my reward points at. The room should have been free for thier mistake but I was only offered a rollaway bed so my elderly mom didn't have to walk up the stairs.

Summary Heading: Location makes up for a terrible room experience
Summary: So This hotel is so all over the place in how I feel about it. The location and prices were great. Got a good deal on the room during the summer and it is a 10 min walk to disneyland straight down the road. The rooms were clean and the staff were kind and helpful. Loved the soaps in the bathrooms, such a great scent.  The breakfast on offer was fine. Pastries and waffles that get the job done.  Outside of those positives, there were some big negatives. The room seemed really worn down. Dent in the wall, ripped up carpet, dings and cracks in the furniture. The bed was super uncomfortable. Rock hard mattress that you could not get comfortable. Even worse was the pillows. I am not exaggerating when I say the pillows at this hotel were the worst I have slept on in my entire life. I

This hotel was not as expected. The pictures online made it seem nice thanks it was. The breakfast room was way too small for so many people. We couldn't even get in to eat breakfast. We did get in one day & took cereal back to our room. That's all that was left. We stayed at 8 different hotel on our trip & this hotel was the worst & the most expensive.

Check in with Susan was great. Great place to stay if you are going  all day in the park The hotel is walking distance Disneyland.and fast foods,stores etc... The room is large,clean. Bathroom very clean Breakfast  very good. Safe place and great parking lot. If you stay more days but do not go to the park, you watch the fireworks from the pool or the parking lot
Basic clean room.  Helpful staff.  Breakfast was all carbs except for yogurt and a type of apple I don't really like.  3/4+ of a mile from Disneyland entrance.  Good  stay.

Great place to stay. Very close to Disneyland.  Clean rooms. Friendly staff.  Excellent restaurant next door. Nice breakfast, yogurt, muffins, sweetrolls, ceral, pancakes & waffles. Coffee & juices.  Would definitely stay again.

Summary Heading: Ramada Anaheim Maingate North 921 S Harbor Blvd, Anaheim, CA 92805-5530
Summary: This Ramada is walking distance from the disneyland park maingate north. hotel is having rooms like a motel with central parking, although they have shuttle service for disneyland which is expensive but its walkable distance. rooms are cleaner & all air conditioners are windows based.

The hotel was fairly close to Disney land. At the time of check in the receptionist was very rude, the day staff was very polite though. Breakfast in the morning consisted of waffles, cereal, donuts and other sugar based treats. Not really a breakfast. The rooms were clean and we had quiet nights. Overall an ok hotel but maybe a bit pricey compared to its amenities and location.

They were very accommodating at 11:45 PM Sunday night when we had a reservation somewhere else and had to make a last minute change. I didn't get the name of the gentleman that helped us but he was very nice. We enjoyed the room and shower. The check out was easy. Would definitely stay there again when in the area.
My only complaint was that we had a big noisy upstairs neighbor who stomped around all night, but that was beyond the control of the hotel really....

Summary Heading: Everything was great with the stay, except the shower...
Summary: Everything was great with the stay, except the shower overflowed. There was no tub and the water didn't drain fast enough.

My family and I stayed for only 1 night since we were seeing a baseball game and going to Disneyland the next morning.  Being that all the rooms are outside, it was just loud with the amount of people coming and going and not really caring about their volume levels when doing so.  And upon pulling in, I did see a few homeless people walking by and through the parking lot which didn't really make me feel safe. Otherwise, the room was fine for the one night and since the rate wasn't high, worth it even though we didn't get as much sleep as we were hoping.

The top sheet of the bed was dirty. We did not have blinds that closed the first night - so everyone could see in to our room. Despite the notice that they are an environmentally friendly hotel, they took all of our towels that we used and had hung up, and then did not even bring us new ones. When we got back at midnight to find zero towels in our room, after calling the front desk twice (because no one was picking up), we were not even given an apology. The front desk just asked if we needed any (of course we did or I wouldn't be calling), and then told us to come down to the front and pick them up.

Summary Heading: Everything was perfect except all the people smoking by the...
Summary: Everything was perfect except all the people smoking by the pool. We were unable to swim because of it!!

Summary Heading: Although I did not experience anything negative while at...
Summary: Although I did not experience anything negative while at hotel, I still would not recommend or stay there again.  Just little things that are important to me, an elevator, the muggy smell of an old room. We left for the park at 7:30 came back at 4:30 and room was just being cleaned.  Little things add up and makes you not want to go back.

Summary Heading: Decent hotel with close proximity to Disneyland
Summary: PROS: Easy check-in and check-out process, close proximity to Disneyland (Less than $5 uber ride or 15 minute walk to the main gate), free decent breakfast, pool, free parking, next to a delicious Italian restaurant  CONS: Small seating area for breakfast, no jacuzzi

You get what you pay for, this is a budget hotel. So, don't expect a luxury hotel. You have your basic amenities and the rooms are fairly clean. The towels are a bit old so they look dingy. The location is good fairly close to Disneyland. You can actually walk to the park, but it will take about 10 minutes an Uber ride will get you there in 10 minutes. The bus that runs in front of the hotel takes a while to arrive. Therefore, I never rode the bus. There is a Carolina's next to the hotel, it is a fairly decent Italian Restaurant with over 200 craft beers. The staff at the hotel was very helpful and checked us in fairly quickly. Overall, with this hotel you get what you pay for. It is clean with a good location. The a/c is a bit odd. It doesn't blow toward the bed, it blows
Clean Room but window had no ability to blockout light from exterior. Relatively quiet. Very good location.

I was look for a place that was relatively central to everything.   Only thing to note was I had 4 adults staying in the room and the room was only supplied with 3 towels, sometimes even just 2 towels.  There was no microwave or fridge, but we could see the Disney fireworks every night so that was cool.  the complimentary breakfast was okay for a free breakfast.  There was no hot chocolate and the orange juice was sour.  Other than that I can't complain too much.

It's a motel style with doors to the rooms on the outside.  It is an older property but the furnishings were new and clean.  We had a double queen room.  It was spacious and comfortably fit our family of four.  For less than $200/night, it would be hard to beat this close to Disney and get the same quality, but again, the property is old.  Other pros - coin laundry (2 washers/2 dryers), free parking, and decent breakfast.  The laundry works well, washers take about 45 mins.  The dryer's on high took about 20 minutes.  Cons - old property, motel style, loud plumbing.  Overall I would stay here again if I wanted to save $, get a good nights sleep, and have breakfast in the morning.

Summary Heading: Shady charges to my Credit Card
Summary: I paid for this room up front trough Priceline.  Upon checking in, they placed the standard $50 hold on my CC.  No problem so far.  We were in the room relaxing just after check-in when housekeeping just walked in, not even a knock on the door.  Apparently, the room wasn't ready for check in as there were no towels, but the front desk checked us in anyways.  I did not appreciate this, but I looked past it as we were just napping on the bed.  We checked out the next day, no problem.  Then 3 days later, I see a charge on my CC from the property.  I promptly called to see what it was about, and they could not tell me!  They kept putting me on hold, and even asked me my room number, like I am supposed to remember that...shouldn't their reservation system tell them that?  Luckily I

Summary Heading: Room was great, service could be improved
Summary: Only 1 person was working check-in/check-out which meant I needed to wait for about 15-20 minutes just standing around in the lobby before I could get to my room.

Summary Heading: Happy and Comfortable stay at RAMADA!
Summary: Happy and Comfortable stay at RAMADA. The experience was awesome!! My family enjoyed this stay as these are clean and well-maintained rooms. The office staff is excellent and friendly.  Overall, we enjoyed the stay and we would like to visit the hotel once again! .

Summary Heading: It was good for a one night visit
Summary: The room was clean and quite, the beds were comfortable, however the only drawbacks were the price of the one night stay and breakfast. The room for breakfast was too small and crowded for a pleasant leisurely breakfast. Other than that, the stay was average. If I work in the area again, I would have no problem staying overnight there again.

The room for 3 guests only had 1 bath towel. I called for more and was advised that I had to go to the office for additional towels. I went right away and there was no one in the office. I waited so long that my husband came looking for me worried that something had happened to me. I  would not return to this property.

Early check in process was a joke. Ricardo answered the phone and was very rude. I could hear him laughing and sighing when I was asking for early check in. I won't be staying here again, and I've stayed here countless times.

Everyone I encountered at the front desk was so nice! The room was very clean with comfortable beds. The towels were even better that most hotels I have stayed at. Great hotel for a non outrageous price!

Summary Heading: No rest for the Disney Traveler
Summary: To be honest we spent very little time in this room as we were visiting Disneyland. The room was a decent size, very clean, and conveniently located. I originally booked this room because the listing said that they had a shuttle for a small fee, which turned out not to be true. There was a bus available that stopped next door and was $5.50 per day. It was very easy to hop on and off the bus to go to Disney, so it may as well have been a shuttle. I have no real complaints about the room and it was decently priced compared to other local motels.

If you need a place to crash at night after an exciting and eventful days in DisneyLand; need budget accommodation and not fussed about luxuries; this is a right place.  It is a short walk to the DisneyLand park or en-route of most paid shuttle services. The rooms are spacious with mini fridge, micro-wave, comfy beds, daily cleaning; and self-service laundry is very handy.  Has a small outdoor pool if you feel like relaxing. A restaurant next door and a pizza place 50 mtrs away provide good food options.  The hotel serves a daily continental breakfast too; which gives a good healthy start to the day.  The staff at the front desk are very helpful and accommodating, they will assist you with tour bookings and inquiries.

Summary Heading: Building is not near the main gate to Disneyland!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Summary: This is a very old hotel, check in was slow, building is old, parking lot is old and the neighborhood for being by Disneyland was awful!

Summary Heading: Clean rooms and polite and helpful staff. Convenient to Disneyland.
Summary: A very convenient Motel. Close to Disneyland. Staff was helpful and rooms and bathrooms clean. A good value.
would have been better if there was a mini fridge and microwave in the room. Too far to walk to disney.
All in all a good stay. A bit of a walk to main gate at Disneyland, but doable. Staff was friendly and efficient.

The hotel is a good stay next to Disney and is at a very good location. The rooms are very specious and quiet. The breakfast is only cold. Please don't expect anything hot.   Only drawback for this place is that there is no elevator and we had to pull and drag our bags on the 2nd floor.
Rooms loooked dirty,beds really uncomfortable,little refrigerator did not work,ironing board broken

Summary Heading: The rooms were nice and clean. Bed was comfortable but...
Summary: The rooms were nice and clean. Bed was comfortable but pillows were too bulky and stiff. Service at check-in was great and helpful. The only down side to this location is that their free breakfast is very very limited. And the hot water for tea tastes like day old coffee!  The hotel is close to Disney but not close enough to walk back after Long day at the park

We stayed here for 5 days. The place is ok for the price. They have free breakfast  (Waffles, pancakes, coffee, donuts, cereal, orange and apple juice). It's about a mile from Disneyland. The place is clean.
There was no towels in the room and the bed I sleep in had sand on the bed and the trash can did not have any bags in them.
Nice fast check in and check out. Front desk very polite. Room was great saw the fireworks from room.

The only thing that i really disliked was the fact that there was nooooo communication with the staff. I asked how late can i check out to the lady in the front desk and she said 12. So i told her can i get a later check out and ill pay she said u can check out at 230.  We won't charge u unless u go pass 3pm..... well the next day they bangged the door at 10 am.. we said we are checking out at 230.. then we get a call at 11am we said we are leaving at 230. Then they banged the door  at 1pm and we said we are leaving at 230,  i got a call right after that as well. At that point i was already annoyed that i packed and left.

Summary Heading: Great location to Disneyland, other than that the rooms were average, nothing special about them, no refrigerators.
Summary: Great location, close to disneyland. Staff were rude and arrogant. The rooms were average, no refrigerator which was a downfall if your staying there for more than a day.

We enjoyed our week's stay.  The room was very clean.  The staff was very kind and helpful.  The breakfast was good but it would have been nice to have had some protein such as eggs to add to waffles or pancakes.  The only complaint was coming back at the end of the day to a very HOT room in the name of "conservation."  Why could they not have adjusted the thermostat to a more conservative level instead of completely off?

All in all I would return to stay as a place to sleep as you see the local sites.  It's not a destination hotel, but it is nicely decorated and clean.  My only complaint is the  check in staff was a bit unwelcoming - she wasn't rude, just not excited to be working there.  Otherwise, everything was great!
Close to Disneyland, food spots, freeway, short 20-30 minutes to the beach areas. Decent free breakfast especially for kids.

I have stayed here many times before and it's always been a pleasure. This time was awful. We got room 101. The linds did not close so all morning long people were walking by our room to get to breakfast and staring in as they walked by. Plus allnight long the bright lights from next four were shining in. We didn't realize the blinds didn't close til midnight and exhausted. Didn't have the energy to try and change rooms and move all our luggage, etc.

The hotel was clean and comfortable. The neighbors upstairs were loud, but settled down in time for bed. The hotel is just around the corner from Disney, and the Italian restaurant next door was fantastic. Lots of food at decent prices. Parking at the hotel was scarce when we returned from Disney late one night. Overall, great for our family of 4. We have 2 small children. You probably could walk to Disney from the hotel, but it would probably take a good 20-30 minutes,  and you have to cross major roads. We decided to drive since we have little kids and would be returning late. The parking structure at Disney is $20/day. There is supposedly a bus that takes you there from the hotel, but we didn't investigate that option.

The room was clean. However on our last night when we returned to our room. Our bed had no comforter.  It was so late and were so tired we didn't call because we didn't want to wait. The registration desk, had no welcoming feeling. The breakfast quality was as cheap as possible.

I booked this hotel on Expedia, price was a driving factor. It's a bit of a walk from the park, but doesn't charge for parking like the hotels that are closer. Friendly staff. The rooms were clean and comfortable, nothing exceptional. The restaurant next door "Carolina's" was excellent.

No bugs in the room which is always my main concern when booking anywhere. Good draining shower. Office has things for sale in case you forget to pack something which was pretty convenient. Good sized pool, no hot tub. Good amount of parking. Disneyland fireworks were visible from the pool which the kids enjoyed. Walking distance to Disneyland if you don't mind walking, I mean you're going to be walking all day at Disney, how much can an extra half-one mile hurt? Oh and good wifi. Overall we had a great stay for the price.
I picked this hotel at random, they were able to get us a first floor room. Nice clean room every night with queen beds! We parked in Disney parking and it was literally right around the corner!

It was an average stay. I wish they offered more than just apples as a fruit choice for breakfast. I've stayed at hotels that offer oranges and bananas as well-- for less than what I payed here. My only complaint is the fact that the sheets had obviously not been replaced for us. This hotel takes the "green" approach to the extreme. I did not feel comfortable laying my daughter on a bed that had hairs, toenail clippings, and drops of blood under the sheets.   I'd show the clippings, but I was too disgusted to look at them long enough to take a picture.

Summary Heading: perfectly fine for an overnight stay
Summary: We stayed at the Ramada the night before an early flight out of ABQ Airport. The beds were comfortable, and the room was clean. There was a nice kitchen nook that supplied any needs we would have had for our stay. It was nice and quiet. There was only a shower in the room, not a bath, so this probably would not suffice for a family with small children. The Neighborhood was not the best in Abq, but we were familiar with the area so knew where to steer clear of. Overall, we were very satisfied with the room.

Maingate title of hotel is a bit misleading, and one has to walk over a freeway overpass to get to Disneyland. Walking fast and with lights for crosswalks we could make it in 17-20 min, though the overall distance with no lights is shorter. Hotel very clean refurbishment is nice and I liked the flowering plants in landscaping.
no insulation between rooms. very small area for breakfast not big enough for more than 15 people. when told the front desk about all the issues she said she was sorry, and so was i
Not a bad place to stay. It was clean, the staff was friendly, the breakfast was good and it was close enough to Disneyland to walk or take the bus and avoid paying for parking.

Reserved room with king bed paid in advance. Arrived and was given a room with a double queen. I went to the office and told them i had reserved the king room and had already paid for a king room. I had already paid extra to specifically get a king room. The original employee that checked me in said there were no more rooms available and at that point i had given in and said just refund me the difference. At that point the other employee said there is a king available to put me in and the confusion between the two of them was quite a display of unorganization at this place. After about 15 minutes i was given keys to the new room and was told to return the other keys immediately to the front desk. After moving gathering my stuff and bringing them the room keys, then going to the
It was clean, but breakfast was VERY disappointing and when we found a previous customer's socks in our room I was totally done with this establishment

Summary Heading: I will never stay here again!
Summary: Horrible experience. First off, the staff was rude. I thought it was just one shift, but it was the same with the night shift as well all 5 days that I was there. I actually had to change rooms on the 2nd day because there was a loud noise coming from the walls that kept us up all night. They said it may have been the washer and dryer. Anyway, they moved us to another room. That noise wasn't there but the AC would make a loud noise every time it cycled and the walls would vibrate every time another room turned the water on... anyway... I can go on and on...

We arrived in Anaheim very late the evening before we were due to check into our accommodation so walked in requesting a room for just a few hours to sleep. We were given a standard room with 2 double beds, bathroom & coffee facilities although our coffee machine did not work.  Our room was clean & comfortable, there was ample car parking at this hotel & a swimming pool. It is a little bit further away from Disneyland than some of the other Harbor Boulevard Hotels but still in a good location

For a budget choice when going to DL, stay here. The rooms are clean and nicely renovated. The bed is good and the sink/vanity is smartly places out in the room instead of inside the bathroom. The space for breakfast is too small so prepare for that. The food choice is okay and good for a grab and go.  Seek out this clean budget minded property for your DL trip. Free parking, no resort fee, free breakfast and internet.
We stayed here for our trip to Disneyland. Its 5 minutes from the park and the rooms were clean. We will definitely book again!

Was a little skeptical about this hotel from some of the reviews but not to shabby for the price. Over all a good expirence check in easy room looked pretty clean once opening the door but when we got closer to the beds the head boards where stained pretty nasty. But everything els was like the pic upgraded, small tv but we were not in the room that much   The good room upgrades  , price , restaurant next to us , staff   The bad   Head boards pretty nasty no tram to Disney, walking to Disney not an option

Summary Heading: This motel is decent for the price. It is close to Disney...
Summary: This motel is decent for the price. It is close to Disney parks and others places with a close busstop for the ART bus. It is clean, fairly quiet, comes with fridge, microwave, hairdryer. Has decent continental breakfast in the morning. We have stayed herw the last 5 times we have gone to Disneyland so it must be decent. Lol

We enjoyed the room, it was very clean and spacious. However, the bedding and pillows smelled so strongly of chlorine and bleach I could hardly sleep. And the pillows were so uncomfortable. Other than that, it was perfectly fine and the staff were friendly.
Pleasant experience with check in and check out. Breakfast was average. Only concern/problem was lack of parking spaces. Convenient shuttle bus very near by.

Summary Heading: Paid for a 3 stars hotel equivilent to a 1 star motel
Summary: its not a 3 stars hotel, its more like a motel. Smell of mold and urine once you open door. You can hear your neighbors
Hotel was great. Clean, comfortable and safe. Only issue is packing is limited...we were able to park but not always by our room.
Hotel was really nice, room was clean and comfortable. Restaurant right next to it was also a plus.
This hotel was very clean and the staff very nice. The rooms were cozy and big and I liked that it had a mini refrigerator.

Summary Heading: We have been a regular here.  We have always been treated well and the staff has always been kind, and helpful.
Summary: We have been a regular here.  We have always been treated well and the staff has always been kind, and helpful.  The rooms have been clean and comfortable.

We stayed at this very clean and quiet location, one mile from Disneyland. Very friendly staff. The next day we left our car in their parking lot, for free, and took the public bus for $2 each and it dropped us off in front of Disneyland in about five minutes. Definitely would do it again. There is the ART bus that comes every half hour and drives on to the Disney property. It is $5.50 for all day. The public bus showed up first, so we took that one. The pick up was right next door to the hotel.

Stayed for our trip to Disney. It was a clean and comfortable. Room was on the small side, but had fridge and microwave and one chair. It isn't too far from Disney, and able to be walked. We opted to take the bus over most of the time because we were with small kids. Breakfast was a decent selection,  continental breakfast as well as hot pancakes. Being just north of the freeway, it's out of the way of the hustle and bustle of Disney.

Summary Heading: Clean and updated, but thin walls
Summary: We stayed for 4 nights from May 14-18 2017. This hotel was a secret hotel on Priceline under the 3 stars category. Since it was only $72 a night we decided to give this service a try for the savings. We travelled with our autistic toddler and planned to spend the majority of our time in Disneyland. So my review will reflect what worked for our needs.   The best parts of this hotel: *The room is clean and modern *A/C works well *Beds are comfortable, firm but soft enough for comfort *TV is wall mounted (which is safer for families traveling with small children)  *They have cribs (ACTUAL travel cribs. They are mini cribs but they have metal bars, a relatively thick mattress, sheets and come with a large blanket.  They are "by demand" but after explaining that my toddler needed it

Summary Heading: Room was good but need other service improvement
Summary: Room was clean and comfortable. I found two problems. 1. Parking lot is not enough. After I come back from Disneyland at night. There was no parking space. I spent a long time to find an empty spot. 2. Breakfast quality was bad. Butter was margarine. Waffle maker was slow and uncleaned. Juice quality was low. Need improvement.

Summary Heading: The hotel overall was nice. I prebooked and they did not...
Summary: The hotel overall was nice. I prebooked and they did not mention a 50 auth hold. I feel that should have been told at the time of booking.
I consider the Ramada Inn with the happiest room on Earth I don't do Disney the room was very relaxing I wish there was a microwave maybe I would never leave Anaheim love the Ramada 05-14-2017
The hotel was ok, staff was nice, but the walls were super thin and it was very loud all 5 nights we were there. We could here the people's conversation next to us pretty clearly.

Close enough to Disney, was able to walk there! Starbucks nearby as well. Everything was really great. I even enjoyed the small fitness room they have. The breakfast they provide though is just bread so not so good but other than that it was an awesome place to stay at.

We had a very nice stay at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North.  The hotel was clean, beds comfortable, and within walking distance to Disneyland.  The breakfast leaves a little for desire but for the price and location this hotel is hard to beat.  We will definitely consider this hotel on our next Disney Trip.
The room was dirty, toilet was broken, no maintenance onsite so I had to change rooms, called down to the front desk several times and no answer ..... I won't stay there again
Clean, easy check in, nice remodeled bathrooms, close to Disneyland. Terrible breakfast options, but otherwise good overall.

It was very frustrating that the front desk person did not explain where or how to find the room, I could not find it! Went back and asked, still provided me with minimal and not good info, I had to find it myself, it was no numbers on the walls for this specific room, outside a lot of kids screaming and playing (11pm) but the noise didn't bother inside, the breakfast area was good, specially the lady was always checking to refilled food.

Good deal and quiet location away from the busy Disney park area, but close enough to get there easily.  Free continental breakfast with make your own fresh hot waffles.  Rooms were clean and comfortable.  Free parking too!  Microwave and mini fridge in the room.

I was upset with this room purchase initially, since I booked it as an Expedia name your price, surprise booking.  In no way do I feel that a Ramada is a 3 start hotel, nor would I even classify this as a hotel - it is a motel.  I felt like this was a very misleading purchase.  Instead of complaining, we just went with it and we're glad we did.  The room was huge, especially compared to the Holiday Inn we stayed at next to Disney.  The beds were soft and comfy and the room was very clean.  They had the typical continental breakfast which was clean and stocked well.  I was appalled at breakfast when I watched a mother steal food from the breakfast bar for her family to take to Disney.  I realize that food is expensive at Disney, but come on.  We joke about bringing the big purse
You can hear other guests taking a shower. The sound woke me up at 1am when other guests came back and we're laughing and got in the shower.

Summary Heading: It's exactly what I expect a Ramada to be
Summary: My room was lovely, pretty updated with a brand new bathroom. There's a fridge and a microwave. It's close to the parks & there's no charge for parking. The beds are comfy, the neighborhood is quiet, the staff is efficient & kind. The free breakfast isn't much, but I wasn't expecting fresh pancakes, either. I will state, that there was a horrendous and giant, unacceptable problem happening with another party's room when I came to check in, however, it appears it was resolved when I came down an hour later for extra towels. It's not perfect, but it's perfectly acceptable for a weekend in Anaheim.

Summary Heading: Good hotel but had some flaws
Summary: The hotel was mostly clean and had friendly staff but breakfast was very small and we had an issue with the first room they gave us. Plus the internet was slow.Overall it was okay but im going to try a different hotel next time.

The walls were so thin and you could hear everything from the other rooms. Our neighbors that night were fighting until 1 am when they knocked something hard against our wall and my bf flipped out. He yelled for them to shut the hell up and hit the wall back and they finally stopped. The overall hotel was mediocre, the flat screen was so small I have stayed at many hotels and have never had such a small tv. The pillows sucked and you really didn't have a real blanket just sheets. The water never got hot and the overall expiernence was bad, I would never stay there again only bonus was the location to Disneyland
We were there on Spring Break at Disneyland. Accommodations were adequate as we are spoiled by normally staying in a two bedroom condo.

Summary Heading: They did not clean my room i check one they early book same night at difrent hotel pay dobble look for an other hotel
Summary: No terrible they did not clean my room i book some were else no money return pay dobble book difrent hotel at 12pm

Summary Heading: My stay at Burbank Rmada inn
Summary: Good hotel, a bit old, amenities are good, the rooms can use an upgrade.  The AC in the room is very noisy.

Summary Heading: Ramada turned a nightmare trip into a dream!
Summary: We had to leave one hotel in the middle of the night and checked in at midnight here. A few hiccups finding our last minute reservation but finally turned our trip around from a nightmare to a pleasant one. Only complaint was the check in could have went smoother if the staff was trained better.

Summary Heading: The room smelled bad, t needed a deep cleaning.
Summary: The room smelled bad, t needed a deep cleaning.  I was surprised that they did not have an elevator.

We stayed here for a trip to Disneyland over spring break. We were on the first gooor two doors down from the lobby, it was amazingly quiet there, very near breakfast and the bus stop. Breakfast was plentiful, enough to fill us up until lunch. We brought peanut butter to add to the protein. The only complaint I had was the bus stop was a half a block away right in front of a liquor store and at all times of the day and night there were drunk guys hanging around on the benches. We never had a problem or interaction with them, just sort of scary. We walked one morning and it was pretty far, but doable. Coming home on the ART shuttle, get off at the first stop and walk a few blocks back instead of riding around the whole loop that took 30 min. We were able to walk back from the

Summary Heading: Affordable comfortable modern within walking distance of Disneyland and right off I-5
Summary: I've stayed at this hotel twice, and enjoyed both stays.  It is much more modern and well appointed than the dated exterior suggests.  Rooms and baths have been gutted and remodeled with contemporary tasteful furniture, furnishings and fixtures.  There is a nice Italian restaurant onsite with BOGO specials for hotel guests, and fast food, Starbucks, and convenience store are within one block walking distance.  Disneyland entrance is about a mile away, still walking distance, and there is both a commercial shuttle and a municipal bus that leave from a stop by the hotel to Disneyland.  Located about a block from I-5, it's also a good base for daytrips to downtown Los Angeles, Hollywood, Universal, Orange County beaches and cities.

You get what you pay for at Ramada Anaheim Maingate North. The room we got was clean, comfortable, and appeared to be recently updated. The breakfast room was clean with plenty of seating, but options were narrow. (Breads, cereal, donuts, waffles, apples, and yogurt) You're paying for basic and that is what you will get. That said, if you're just looking for a place to sleep and don't need the resort amenities this might be the place for you.

My stay was adequate.  The TV never worked properly.  They replaced the remote, but the TV still had issues.  The hotel was close to the venues I visited. I had to add an additional day and the staff was very helpful in getting me a reduced rate for that night.  Thank you
Good hotel, close to Disneyland. Rooms were very clean, and staff was very nice. Only bad thing about the hotel; no parking at night. The staff had me park in the handicap parking areas.

Stayed here for one night, on a Saturday for a 2 day trip at Disneyland. I booked via Priceline and the check-in was easy and simple. The location is within a mile of Disney, but I would recommend staying somewhere a little closer. The walk to and from was very laborious after walking all day. The room was decent, albeit a little bare. The fridge worked, TV was a little small. Nothing too bad or spectacular, which was in line with the price. The towels looked raggedy and the bathroom was a bit small. The water was also not very hot, lukewarm at best. The complementary breakfast was just basic toast, cheap donuts, cereal, coffee, nothing amazing, no hot food, although there was a waffle maker for you to use with their mixed batter. My complaint, which is ultimately my fault,

Nice rooms. Cold pool...at least in March.  Friendly staff. Continental breakfast was nice...plenty of carb options...no meat, but still several breakfast options, including waffles. Twenty minute walk to Disney security entry. Shuttles are available, but not for free. Parking at the hotel is provided. Room did allow outside noise in, but after all day at Disney, we basically passed out, and did not hear anything. Rooms were updated, and clean. We appreciated not having carpet on the floor, as those are often filthy.
I would never stay here again inch was shocked that Wyndham with use this as a rewards location.

Summary Heading: Room decent, Hotel really a Motel
Summary: For $185 I would expect more. The room was fine. But this is really a Motel, not a hotel and has a dingy, low quality feeling to it. I wouldn't stay there again.

we checked in at 1030pm and left by 930am. best 11 hours i have spent in anaheim. great room, comfortable and good value. only complaint about the room was that the floor was really dirty. i only know that because my 11 month old daughter was crawling everywhere and her feet were completely covered in dirt when we picked her up after a couple minutes. upon checkout the attendant was not persoable and would not print me an invoice or receipt because i used hotels.com
Our room was nice but mostly it was very clean which is a huge priority for me. The service was good, the staff was friendly and helpful and the free breakfast was great!!

I was very unhappy with this motel. The area is unsafe at night as there are many drug addicts riding around on bikes. It's about a 20 minute walk to Disneyland which is fine during the day but unsafe after dark. The bedding and towels were supposed to be white but have turned grey over the years. Sheets have small holes in them because they have become so thin. The guy that checked us in literally did not talk to us.  He grabbed my ID out of my hand and then handed us our keys. Very unwelcoming. I could go on and on but I think I've wasted enough time on this place...

This hotel looks more like an apartment complex that's been converted to a motel. The parking lot is small and it's unlikely that you'll get to park close to your room unless you get back before 5pm. Other reviews mentioned homelessness and surrounding slum areas and while I did notice quite a few of the nearby businesses with metal security fences on their windows and doors, I fortunately didn't see any homelessness or sketchy persons during my 4 night stay. Since this was a family Disneyland vacation, I was thankful for that.  The complimentary breakfast is okay: bagels, toast, yogurt, waffle maker, OJ, apple juice, and cereals. A bit lacking in the hot breakfast category (e.g. sausage and eggs) but I tend to avoid those types of foods at hotels anyway. As for the room, it
Great place to stay for our Disneyland trip! The WHOLE staff (from housekeeping, the gal serving the breakfast to the man at the front desk) were friendly & accommodating! My Grandson loved the pool.

The room was a nice room in an older hotel. With a ground floor room, we had loud upstairs neighbors as we could hear them walking around their room. It was too far from Disneyland to walk, so we had to drive and pay parking prices. When they cleaned our room, they didnt replace the towels, so i had to go find the laundry room to get more.
was great. Close to disneyland.. Rooms clean. Slept well.  Just what we needed for our stay. Will stay here again.

This particular Ramada is a what I refer to as a motor in where you enter into the rooms from the parking lot. The room was small but was clean and comfortable the parking was something to be desired as there were no spots available. The breakfast in the morning is a very small room with tons of families trying to eat so almost impossible. For the price in the area it's average but not worth the money for sure

Very expensive for such a basic place. I would never use the pool because it is old and small. The curtains wouldn't close so we had to use my hair tie to keep it closed. The remote of the tv wouldn't work so we couldn't watch tv.

First night a bug crawled up on our bed and had to kill it that was by our heads. Wall so thin that people could be heard in both side rooms and ceiling. Breakfast was waffles and toast. The title main gate I felt was misleading, you could walk a couple blocks, to get to entrance, but I thought it was close to entrance based on name of hotel.

Summary Heading: Front Desk Rep not helpful, it was like pulling teeth!
Summary: I never write reviews because usually I have great experiences with most of the hotels around the Disneyland area. We are annual passholder's so we go often. We arrived early, so I already figured a room would not be ready. So I still go in and at least them know we arrived. I walk in and the gentleman is on the phone or watching something online. Does't say hi or anything. So I had to initiate his attention, because he is not welcoming at all. He goes sorry we don't allow early check in until 2. And gives me a blank stare to basically excuse my self and go. Just rude! Didn't even bother to ask the reservation name. I never experienced this at a hotel before. Usually they at least let us leave our car and call us when the room is available.  We came back around 2. Again he has

No hot water. Not clean. Dingy discolored towels and linens. We both broke out in rashes after one day and night - (linens, towels, soap)!?!?!? Who knows. Exterminator for rodents there one if the days. Hot water boiler broken!!!!  Terrible breakfast - waffle was the only hot item. No fruit except 2 apples the three times we went for the breakfast. We ended up going elsewhere. Very lame. Noisy - scary location - bums laying around and also urinsting right by the buildings. Don't bother!
We arrived and the staff were very professional n courteous...The room was amazing n very clean..We enjoyed our stay very much..will be going back in the summer for sure...

Summary Heading: $365 Cdn for suitcases full of ANTS....
Summary: We where charged $365 Cdn for 2 nights our cloths where full of ants when we asked to have someone come we where told so we have nobody to look at this here are a few bags for your cloths - we where going to a funeral.
