We received no reimbursement - I received a email from the manager saying sorry we will try and fix for the next guests and from the Wyndham Corporation I receive a sorry this is a Franchise we can do nothing about it. DO NOT STAY HERE they do not care about you or the cleanness of there rooms. It was stomach turning to see all our cloths including my 5 year olds covered in ants...

This was a quick family trip to Disneyland. We had 2 rooms, both were clean and comfortable. Staff was friendly and helpful when we had trouble with our key card not working. Kids loved the waffles at breakfast.

The last 2 days of our stay, for some reason there was no hot water and we called and called 0 from our room but no one answered and I couldn't leave my kids in the room while in the shower to go to the front desk. Also the breakfast bar here is awful, lots of sugar and unhealthy options.
Very adequate place to stay.  The beds were nice and the breakfast was good.  Close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Cold showers no matter what time of day.  No sufficient waffle makers only one with long lines to use.
Summary: the location was nice, the room was very small, only enough for 2 beds.  Bathroom was only toilet and shower, sink and counter in the room area.  Always a cold shower no matter what time of day it was used and only one waffle maker for breakfast always 3 to 5 people waiting to use it.

Breakfast was a little skimpy just waffles and cereal.  No fruit and no protein. One waffle machine with a big line.  No direction on how much batter to put in. Eventually they did bring out some yogurt.

Summary Heading: The buck stops at the desk
Summary: I believe they use their proximity to Disneyland to forego all customer service and hotel quality.  We stayed here with friends and as we had only one day to see Disneyland we wanted to be close.  The breakfast is a poor quality montage of bread products... the staff was pretty much comatose and the rooms were "definitely" not clean with the towels resembling cloths that had been borrowed from a nearby auto shop.  In my travels to all 50 states and to 88 different countries, very few times do I take time to write a negative review.  So, since you're paying good money, my advice is put your bucks on a different desk.  On the up side it's near Disney!
One of the cleaner rooms we've stayed in using our Wyndham Rewards. Good location and quiet area.
The place is clean, staff is friendly and helpful and great place to stay close to Disneyland!!

Summary Heading: Room was nice but customer service lacked a lot
Summary: We had dresser drawers that would come out all the way where you would run into them. This was reported to the staff for 4 days straight and they came up pushed them in and  10 min. later they were out again.  We finally shimmed the dresser up in the corners to keep drawers in. Very unhappy with the service. Will probably not stay there again. Desk clerk on check in day was very unconcerned about getting up registered and not very accommodating.

Summary Heading: Good value for the location and price
Summary: We had a decent room, and the closeness to Disney was great.  The beds were terrible, but we are used to a great matress at home.  Nothing bad but nothing special.

Summary Heading: Okay motel, not the best neighborhood
Summary: I was attracted to this motel because it was within a mile of Disneyland, had free parking, a fairly low nightly rate (around $100 a night), free continental breakfast, and decent overall score on Trip Advisor (although I should have read the most recent reviews). I have stayed in worse motels, but like those motels, I won't be returning. The pictures online looked decent. The rooms looked fairly renovated in the pictures. But the main problems are the house keeping and location. The carpet was very dirty and not vacuumed (there was major garbage on the floor), there were hairs in the shower, ants in the bathroom, and flying ants in the windows. You could also hear the neighbors next door, as well as the floors creaked from the people in the room above. The location, although

Summary Heading: Great value hotel in a great location
Summary: We stayed here for two nights due to the proximity to Disneyland. There was an inexpensive shuttle right outside, and we could easily have walked in about half an hour. The hotel itself was great value - good sized room and great value free breakfast. Free parking was included.
Great place, just hard to understand one of the gentlemen who works as the receptionist. Right place for the price you pay.
Ramada (921 South Harbor) is the only place we stay.  They have always treated us wonderful.  The rooms are nice, clean, and quiet.  I will continue to stay there when we head to LA.

We did stay there 18-21 jan 2017. On our last night we did notis ant´s on ouur bad. Day after I found that I had bug bits. I came back home and I have over 20 bits on arms ,back ans head. Brakfast in not thr best with plastic fork and kniwes, I do not recomend this hotel. Lots of noise going be tween room. I was on ground floor noiise from room above was like you can hear all from that room.

Summary Heading: Recently updated and a good location
Summary: I recently stayed at the Ramada Maingate North for a quick weekend trip to the Anaheim area visiting some family and friends. I did not go to Disneyland or any of the other local attractions, but noticed that this hotel is located very conveniently for them - right across the 5 freeway to Disneyland, maybe a couple miles away. You could easily walk if you want to save $$ on parking and are up for the trek. Also a pretty good view of the fireworks on Friday nights if you'd rather head back early.   I booked the hotel on Hotwire so didn't know what I was getting until after I reserved my room. Based on the outside photos I didn't expect much - however, I was pleasantly surprised when I arrived to check in. The lobby was clearly recently updated and in good shape. The rooms were

Room was not clean, towels were discolored and smelled dirty/stale, coffee machine had old coffee and coffee bag still inside, heater spit out dirty/debris all over bed we were sleeping in. Requested a late checkout which we were granted but were disturbed 3 times by 3 separate people asking us to vacate 15 mins after checkout time. Last person was very hostile. When expressing concern over cleanliness of room only option was to relocate to new room which is a huge headache with two toddlers and a weekend worth of stuff especially when trying to head out to parks to enjoy our vacation. Initially when we expressed our concerns we were met with hostility and front desk seeming annoyed as if we wished to have a dirty room. In addition maid service was extremely rude and

We stayed at Ramada for the first time last week. I wasn't sure what to expect, but we decided to give it a try. We were pleasantly surprised! Our room was spacious, clean, and everything was in good repair. We had a microwave and mini fridge, which is always a plus. There was a free breakfast that included hot waffles. The only thing that would have been nice is if there were some type of meat/protein included. There was plenty of free parking, and the hotel staff was friendly. The one downside is that the hotel is a ways from Disneyland. It is possible to walk, but may be a long walk after a day of walking at Disneyland. Overall, we were happy with our stay and would stay there again!
Not happy with the location area is not safe to walk at nite also the breakfast was poor quality.

Summary Heading: Front Desk person was not nice
Summary: Stayed here many times before but this time desk called my house to tell it was time to check out. What happen to calling my cell or the room number.   TV in room could not turn off

we've stayed at many ramada's and have always had good experiences, but this one fell a little short. the towels in our room were dingy and we actually found a dirty towel hanging in the bathroom that housekeeping must have missed. the trashcans didn't have liners, which isn't a big deal for us, but i can imagine it can be unpleasant for those who have to empty/clean them. their breakfast is decent- waffles, cereal, fruit, etc. the juice dispenser was not working, which isn't their fault, but it would have been nice if they'd had an alternative (juice boxes, a cooler, or even just someone filling cups from a pitcher). we might stay here again, but it probably won't be our first choice.

Summary Heading: Good location very cheap quality hotel
Summary: The hotel beddings were very very very old. Like really old. They were not ironed and the doors were extremely old too. The only good thing about the hotel was the breakfast
Overall we had a great stay at the Ramada.  The staff was friendly and the rooms were clean and offered good overall value.

Rooms not stocked with enough towels and blankets, was able to receive more at front desk. Poor insulation in walls, could hear every sound from all directions at night. Sheets were stained, despite asking for clean, unstained sheets. Basic continental breakfast, broken, fake OJ dispenser during stay.

A good spot to watch the fireworks, we just opened our door and there it was unobstracted. We were looking for a hotel with fireworks view close to New Year's time. Unfortunately, most of the hotel around Disneyland was either full or out of our budget. This hotel is perfect for us, I'm glad we stayed for 3 nights. There was no fireworks on our first night, apparently it was cancelled. And it was raining on the last night, we were lucky to catch the fireworks on the second night of our stay. You won't miss the firework if you decide to wait inside your room, the boom will not go unnoticed unless the firework is cancelled for the night.
Everything was great except I had a do not disturb on the door and the maid didn't even knock and opened my door!  BAD MAID!

Summary Heading: New location........... Not as nice as the old location
Summary: We stayed a Ramada Maingate many times over the years. We had no idea until we arrived that the hotel had moved. When I called to make the reservation they never mentioned the new location................which I nowhere near the Maingate!!!! The hotel was average at best. The room was functional and no frills for sure. Our room was pretty quiet. The towels looked stained and were in need of some bleach. The room was pretty clean.  Nothing to write home about.  The breakfast was very weak. There was cereal, toast and waffles. A few Danishes. No juice.  Pretty disappointing.  They need to change the name for sure as the hotel is over a mile from the Maingate of Disneyland. We didn't mind the walk but it might not be for everyone. The name doesn't fit the location for sure.
I come here occasionally and always enjoy myself. It's quiet, but has a great view of the FIREWORKS! Its spacious 2 qnbeds. Pool. Restaurant in parking lot. Larger than it looks. And friendly staff!

The hotel is obviously fairly old, in a somewhat sketchy neighborhood but, the place is cleaner than some 4-5 star hotels. The location is within a 5minute drive to the Disney parking structures or you can pay for their shuttle to the park.  The room was pretty decent. Except for the desperate lack of an in room mini-fridge. (When you are spending money for a few days to go to several local parks, it would be quite nice to have had.   The biggest caveat here though is not the neighborhood (room prices acknowledge that). Its the Disneyland Fireworks. Because of the close proximity to the park area where the fireworks are fired off, you can expect a "war zone" type feel of rockets being launched and exploding for 30minutes per night.  While there are some small issues with this

I wasn't sure because we had never stayed there and always stayed across the street from Disneyland and this place was WAY WORTH IT! it was clean, the staff was friendly, the comp breakfast was really good and everything was perfect! The price was well worth the stay!

Summary Heading: Good choice for a short stay
Summary: Was in Anaheim for two nights, and decided to play Hotwire roulette for something close to Disneyland. Ended up here. Some of the reviews here had me worried, but I encountered no real issues. Prompt check-in, clean room with good heat and AC. Beds were unspectacular but weren't uncomfortable. Didn't use the Wi-Fi or breakfast, so can't comment there. If I were going for anything longer than two nights, I'd probably pick a different spot, but for a quick trip, this is a pretty good hotel for a good price.

Summary Heading: Clean, convenient & basic hotel near Disneyland
Summary: Ramada Maingate North is a convenient hotel to stay in if you want to be in Anaheim, California. It is near Disneyland. The hotel itself is not glamorous but it has its own functional charm. Their wifi was spotty before but it has improved since my last visit... though I suspect the good wifi signal may be related to the room's proximity to their front office. The hotel room is basic and clean, and I usually stay at one on the 1st floor. The bathroom in the hotel room was also clean and the bathroom looked like it was recently renovated.   Better get to breakfast early as I think tour groups going to nearby Disneyland stay here. Usually can get a parking spot at the exact front of your hotel room so you can see your car when you look through the hotel room window.
We had items stolen out of rooms and when we addressed this with the hotel, no manager was ever available to deal with.

Summary Heading: Still a good place to stay at while visiting Disneyland.
Summary: Been staying at this place quite a few times in the last 3 years. They keep improving their accommodations and it is really impressive! The only few minor issues I have are the Internet speed, and the walls are really thin. Other than that, great service all around. Looking forward to next time!

I was on a business trip and stayed there for 6 nights. So here is my experience:  LOCATION: You won't find a budget hotel near Disneyland except Ramada or may be Days Inn. It's very close. A bus stop right outside the hotel. I even walked all the way to Anaheim Marketplace,   ROOM: Nice and spacious rooms, but there was a constant foul smell coming out from the air conditioner whenever I turned it on. Beds were good. I was at the front face, ground floor of the hotel, so you except it to be noisy due to people and parking.  But I never found my room cleaned till  late afternoon.  STAFF: Good, sometimes rude. The guy at the breakfast whose duty is to maintain supplies, is very humble and helpful.  FOOD: They offer free breakfast which includes hot waffles, coffee/tea, juices,
The hotel was clean and the staff was polite.  The only issue was that the room wasn't cleaned until late in the day, usually just after I returned for the day

Summary Heading: Office called me while I was at Disneyland to check out but my reservations were for 2 nights
Summary: Too expensive for hotel room and they messed up my reservation and took three tries to get a key for one of the two rooms I booked.

We walked to Disneyland from the hotel.  The walk was not that far considering you plan to walk around the park all day anyway. We did an early check in and had a great night sleep.  The front desk was very helpful.

It was amazing trip and Ramada hotel made everything much better. Everthing was amazing, great service, the front desk woman Bernice m. Was very helpful, nice, she was there if we needed her or when we didn't, she was very helpful, she made every clear and she made sure we had a great stay, the room was perfect, The room was nice & clean, every time we came back from Disneyland our room was always clean, with fresh sheet and clean towels and everything room Thanks Bernice m. For making my husband birthday magical..

Hotel was very noisy and fairly outdated but all around a good hotel for the area and very affordable. Not too far from Disney, it is definitely walk-able but quite the trek. Bus station right out front takes you to Disney if needed and all the way up to the Anaheim Packing District. Breakfast is free so can't really complain but nothing too fancy. I would love to comment on the reception staff. So friendly and extremely helpful from the second we arrived to the second we left.  Definitely a good stay for Disney on a budget. Would stay again.  (Shout out to Carolinas Italian just out the front. It's fantastic! )
This location requires a security deposit which i wasn't informed of when I rented the room through hotwire.com and I was not happy

Summary Heading: A surprisingly nice place to stay!!
Summary: I booked here last year for a race as it was a cheaper location and expected to "get what I paid for", but was pleasantly surprised at this hotel!  Clean, friendly, fantastic location...everything I could have asked for.  Only one suggestion....there are no refrigerators in the rooms.  That would be PERFECT...but NO COMPLAINTS!!

Summary Heading: good location, that is about all
Summary: A few complaints: I booked on hotels.com and apparently if you book with hotels.com and get a standard room you don't get a refridgerator in your room. That is what the front desk told me anyway. The hot breakfast consisted of a batter dispenser and a waffle iron, we ate fast food down the street. Both my wife and myself absolutely hated the bed, unusual for both of us to be unhappy with a bed. It is an ok location for Disneyland and the price was decent.

Stayed here for 2 nights during a convention. Average hotel tried to update but bathroom was a mess with mold on ceiling. Spend a little more to be closer at a nicer hotel. If price is a problem it would work in a pinch.

After making my reservations more than a month in advance, I was surprised to get two rooms the furthest from the hotel lobby.  They were quiet, though sort of isolated.  Thank goodness my wife and daughter weren't too upset.  Friday morning must've been pretty busy, since they closed breakfast earlier than posted.  We walked a mile to the entrance to Disneyland, so I'm not sure where the Anaheim Maingate is.

Picked this hotel for its location to Disneyland thats only a mile away also the hotel is on an Bus route that drops you in the heart of the Disney downtown district. The hotel itself in nice with Lovely large rooms with the standard room add on of Fridge and Microwave and a comfortable bed that after a full day at the Park is very very welcome. If you plan a trip to Anaheim this is a good chose.

The hotel was clean, beds were fine, location was decent, the price was great! Nothing fantastic, but totally OK. Continental breakfast wasn't great, staff was friendly and helpful, had to take a bus to Disneyland or drive, but it's quite close, definitely can't walk as you have to go over a freeway to get there. Overall it's a good value for the price.

Summary Heading: Great Disney Vacation with the family
Summary: The hotel was fantastic. The rooms were clean for us every night, they brought up more pillows when we asked for them. Gave us more shampoo and conditioner when we needed it. The Continental breakfasts in the morning were perfect. The staff were friendly and very approachable. It was our first family vacation out of Country and it will be remembered always.

My family and I planned a trip for mid-October. We were forced to delay our trip to another time, and this property location did not have the same room available for our intended period. Although our room was successfully cancelled for the mid-October trip. For some reason we were charged for a single day later in the month, for a period we neither reserved nor stayed at the hotel.  After calling the hotel, I was told to send an email. I sent an email and received no response almost a week later. I cannot comment on the reason why the erroneous charge appeared because the person I spoke with on the phone said he could find no record of my name in the hotel databases. When I asked him how my credit card could be charged by that hotel for a night's stay without him showing my name

After years of visiting Disneyland with our kids in tow, my wife and I decided to visit sans children. This hotel, while not the fanciest, was perfect for what we wanted. Clean rooms, quick access to the ART, and free parking. The frond desk staffer, Laura, was INCREDIBLY helpful. We had erred in part of our reservation, and she was able to correct it right away. We were very impressed. Our room was a typical hotel room, and if we had brought our children, we would have needed another to comfortable fit our family.

Summary Heading: Not worth the amount of money I paid
Summary: I asked for early check in was told no rooms ready then 5 mins later a room magically appeared. While searching picked this location because they offered transportation back and forth to Disney. Come to find out that there was only a shuttle bus and it cost to ride.  The towels were so dingy I had to go to store to buy my own towels. The mattresses if they haven't been replaced they need to be. There are no elevators so if your disabled or have some physical challenges you need to be sure to make note on your reservations so that the reserve a room on the 1st floor

Booked through Hotwire so I did not know what I was getting until I paid. When I found out the property I booked was this place, I was disappointed because I stayed at a Ramada before and did not have the best experience. We arrived on a Saturday around 11am and was told we could not check in early until 1:30pm. We came back at 1:30 and immediately got our room. I was expecting a stinky, old room.. but the room we got was clean and updated. The bathroom looked like it was recently renovated. The only things I did not like were the condition of the towels and the green paint on the wall..  There is an Italian restaurant in the property, which we were able to try and it was delicious!  Disneyland is walking distance, but there is also a stop right outside for the ART bus. $12 for

Great for travelling to Disneyland!!  Shuttle service is pretty good and is right at the corner.  Breakfast is okay but room is small and one morning a team got there first and there was no room for us!  Room is good size and the staff is very helpful.  Everything went smoothly and we were there for 8 nights.

Summary Heading: Good service and clean hotelWould have liked if were...
Summary: Good service and clean hotel Would have liked if were offered free shuttle to Disney because it is more than walking distance.

I highly recommend staying here! The room was very clean and the beds comfortable. They also offer a very good breakfast every morning! Our family was there to go to Disneyland which was in easy walking distance or you can buy bus passes which work great as well. All of the staff were very friendly and helpful!

Roach motel. Literally had cock roaches and spider Webbs and the whole room smells like urine. Staff was super nice and the breakfast wasn't bad for what it is either. But the room itself is pretty bad. I've stayed at other hotels near by for cheaper that were nicer.

My family and I stayed here for our trip to Disneyland, it was comfortable and accommodating. Housekeeping serviced our room everyday, and brought us more towels promptly when asked. Coffee, yogurt and pastures in the morning were good, cereal was good for the kids. We could of had waffles also or toast. Overall the stay was pleasant.

Summary Heading: Perfect $ saver with a nice room.
Summary: I wanted to make sure we had a decent room, as I knew we would be at Disneyland ALL DAY and ALL NIGHT, so we didn't need a fancy room, just a nice one to sleep in.  This was the perfect option for us.  They had a shuttle bus just outside on the corner $5 ea. for the day that took us back and forth to the mouse house.   Nice staff and clean comfy rooms.

Nice room, rude front desk person. Ask to check in an hour early and instead of checking if room was ready rudely said check in isn't for another hour. Had to go to lobby for pool towels. Had to buy bus tickets to get to Disneyland. Breakfast was very select; waffles and cereal highlighted it with pastries and fruit to accommodate. Only $20 more to stay across the street from Disneyland with full breakfast.

I did a lot of research on this place... AFTER I blindbooked our stay on Hotwire. It was just my boyfriend and I for a two night stay. We got a king room. The staff was so friendly and receptive. Ricardo is a total sweetheart. We arrived early Friday, before checking was available, and they allowed us to park our car there anyways. The shuttle is super duper convenient at $5 a day. The breakfast was just fine, as we are both "grab a piece of toast and go" people anyways. Our room was so clean and beautiful. It was comfortable and despite what other people said about the towels, I found them to look fine... and I'm a germ freak. For what we paid, our hotel was by far the nicest of the three couples that were on this trip and they booked at competitor locations.

Located just up Harbor Boulevard from Disneyland, this motel is close enough to walk to the park. It offers a free continental breakfast, free wireless internet and free parking. It was clean, but not fancy.

We were on the first floor, every night at 1a.m. We could hear the people above us come back to their room and wake us up. We could hear other rooms to the side of us showers running. We will not stay there again.

Summary Heading: There were a lot of ants in the room.
Summary: Everything was good except for a huge amount of ants in the room. Told front desk twice but they didn't seem too concerned.
The room was very clean, it was a little noisy, the receptionist guy needed to smile and be a little more friendlier.  Overall it was good, it being so clean made up for everything else.
Very clean very quiet close to everything right off of the i5 rooms are great non smoking property so for the kids it worked like a charm they have breakfast and coffee close to Disney

Summary Heading: Terrible... I would ask for at least a partial refund
Summary: Hotel staff did not change bed sheets with clean sheets even after they were piled on floor to ask for exchange.. room was musty and humid..

Summary Heading: Average motel, no problems with the room or service...
Summary: Average motel, no problems with the room or service. Breakfast was mediocre, too much carbs with very time protein options.

Location is close to Disneyland, (not really walking distance, as the normal person would think as walking distance) no where near the "maingate" as in the name, but most people drive to Disneyland so its not an issue.  Free parking is nice touch and it seemed plentiful for a full Saturday night.  This is only a two story Motel (doors open out to parking lot, no interior halls).  The room had been remodeled and was clean and not run down, hence my 3 star rating.  The "free breakfast", is basically just carbs and sugar.  Cereal, doughnuts, bread and a waffle machine. No fresh fruit, no proteins (eggs, meats, etc.).  Apple juice only, not even water is available!  Motels should stop labeling that a stay includes "free breakfast" unless there is a minimum of selection.  This would

The staff was friendly when they were available but they were not knowledgeable about transpirtation options. The curtains in the room were where so there was NO privacy at night when we had our lights on in the room and the lights from the parking lot shined in our room all night. They had good options for breakfast but there was no room to move about or sit because the breakfast room was too small to accommodate hotel guests. When I needed to check out there was no one there and now one would answer the phone.

Our problems with this hotel began when we found that we were at the wrong hotel - a similarly named property whose desk clerk said they had many experiences with people who thought they were booked at one hotel, but were actually at the other.  After a frustrating additional taxi ride to find this hotel, we were greeted by a manager type who had no apology or sympathy for the mix-up, telling us "It's close enough, the walk isn't that bad."  Thankfully we didn't have physical issues causing the extra miles per day to dampen our trip.   The adventure didn't stop there - the room we were placed in was noisy (people walking in the room overhead could be easily heard), the tiles in the bathroom area were slippery even when not wet, and the curtains couldn't be closed.  Yeah, it's

This property was very nice! Its down the street from the Disney resort and you could actualy walk to it though it may be a little far for elderly or young kids. The staff was very friendly and professional.  The room was clean and modern with plenty of outlets. I had a king room and it was very roomy. Ivhave 4/5 stars because I feel the breakfast is skimpy. It was all carbs and sugar. Not even a banana was offered Though they did have activia yougurt. No eggs, not even hard boiled. I will defiantly stay here again! Also the room had a good working fridge and microwave. I was pleasantly surpised at how nuce the room was!
I felt like this Ramada charges to much for what it was worth. It smelt very musty and the towels were horrible. We decided to wait until we got home to shower.

Summary Heading: Very happy, would definitely stay again
Summary: We stayed with a family of 4 in Sept 2016 and I was extremely happy, would highly recommend.  They upgraded us to a bigger room so we could get a cot so our kids didn't have to sleep together (small charge to do so) but we were happy they could do that.    We arrived 3 hours early to check in as we just came from getting off a cruise ship and they worked quickly to ready a room for us so we could head straight to Disneyland.  They have an excellent free breakfast with fresh fruit, waffle machine (although there is only one and it gets in high demand!) coffee, juice, oatmeal, cereal, toast etc.  The ART (Anaheim Resort Transit) stop is right beside the hotel (next building over) and you can buy passes at the hotel.  The staff were very helpful with everything.  You could walk to

Summary Heading: Nice and close to Walt Disney
Summary: We've spent 4 nights there. It's about 20 minutes walk from Disney land (that's with a 5 year old kid), and just by a shuttle to Disney. The rooms are big and clean. There's a minibar and a microwave in the room. The pool seems nice. The dining room is very small and we always found it crowded. The food is very simple - fruits, cereal, waffles and juice. The cutlery and fishes are plastic. It could use decent cutlery and dishes and water... but serves the purpose of "refueling" before the long day. The staff are very nice and knowledgeable - especially Laura - who seemed to have the best advices - from food to tickets to everything...  there's no safe in the rooms... The area was quiet and we could even see Disney's fireworks from the hotel. We also have to give it to the crews

Stayed here for 9 nights and it was very nice, it's about 20 mins walk to Disney of which you don't really think you have walked that long..the rooms were very clean, towels were changed and bed made every day..had a small pool but was nice. You can see fireworks from disney.. Breakfast included is topped up all morning, but is only toast waffles cereal, tea coffer so don't expect a large breakfast.. Worth the money people always expect more for there money, but if your not fussy then this is ideal, if you want flash go to a 5* hotel ..
we were going to Disneyland and the hotel was about a mile away, so you could either walk or take the city bus . For the money the hotel was worth it.

Great location! The room was very nice and clean. The service however, could've been better. They met my needs but could've been more friendly and more willing to accommodate my family and I. I would stay here again for the location alone.
Front desk was courteous and location is close to Disneyland without the high price. Don't rely on the breakfast options though.
It's a comfortable hotel, with good location and the price is reasonable, only the sheets and towels are in bad conditions.

We stayed for one night, arriving early morning after two nights on the train from New Orleans.  While we were prepared to just leave our suitcases and go to Disneyland, we were very pleased to be given access to our room so we were able to have a shower.    We were pleasantly pleased at the facilities given that this was listed as a 2 star hotel.  The room was fine and the bed very comfortable.  The local bus service was very close and an easy way to get to Disneyland.   Breakfast was good with fruit and decent yoghurt.  The Syrian guy on reception was very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: A nice quite place to stay
Summary: Close to Disneyland. A nice clean place to stay, fast check in and check out. Breakfast area was clean.
Not so great location.  Very noisy guests.  Took 20 minutes to walk to Disneyland.  Food was very poor.  We had ants in our room.
front desk very helpful , clean room,  everything worked, property looked good and close to bus for Disneyland at an affordable price. What more could you ask for

Stayed one night with friends. Was able to check in early. The art stop is very close so was able to leave car their and take the bus. Room was very clean and nice. Had no trouble sleeping since we got back really late. Slept like a rock. Beds are very comfy.

Summary Heading: Stayed for 4 nights. Room was clean. Breakfast were ok.The...
Summary: Stayed for 4 nights. Room was clean. Breakfast were ok.The room has no microwave and fridge. Toilet seat was loose and the towels were clean but they should get new ones.
Great value, great location, interior has been remodeled. Near Disney so expect fireworks on weekend. Breakfast could be better.
Overall o great experiance with the kids when stayed here, the only downfall was no mini fridge to store milk when traveling with little ones, but room was clean and good size. Will return next time.

Fully freshly renovated like new from carpark up. Rooms quiet very clean comfortable. Nicely decorated with zero faults. Great Disney location walk or shuttle with good local store and restaurant within steps. Fast food all within 2km / 1mi best driven.

I loved this place. Clean, nicely decorated with a much better breakfast than other similar places we have stayed in the area. Every single person at the desk was helpful and friendly. We will be back!  FYI, it does have a tiny pool and no hot tub.

This is a short 10-15 walk to the front gate of Disneyland. Nice clean room.  Has a good Italian restaurant out front and a liquor store/deli right next to that for supplies. Fridge and microwave in room. No complaints. Free breakfast is very simple. Pastries,waffle maker, bagels,toast,yogurt,fruit, juice, coffee.Shuttle bus to Disney is $5 round trip and picks you up at the bus stop 20 yards to the left of the hotel office on S. Harbor. You can call tour buses for trips and they pick you up at that same spot, making it easy.  Would use again.

Loved this location. We frequently visit Disneyland throughout the year and the majority of the time we have always stayed in hotels that are south of the park. I highly enjoyed the location and will make this our go to hotel in the future. You can walk to the park or take the shuttle bus, but I prefer to drive my own vehicle and pay to park. It took a quick 2min drive to the parking garage and so much less traffic and hussle and bustle being north of the park I loved it. The room was beautiful and I think newly remodeled. We didn't try the continental breakfast so no feedback there. There is an Italian restaurant next door that had some pretty amazing pizza and lasagna for when we returned late from the park and there is a shakies pizza a few doors down too.  Oh yes, the beds

While we didn't stay long and didn't use many of the amenities, we were pleasantly surprised with the room and furniture upgrades along with the overall cleanliness of the hotel.  It certainly was nicer looking and cleaner than some 3 or 4 star hotels I've stayed at.  They've invested the money back into upkeep and upgrade of this hotel and it was a very pleasant stay.  Beds and pillows were great too!  One con, some people said you can walk to Disneyland from here.  They must be extreme walkers because it was pretty far from Disneyland and crossing major highways and streets.  You're better off catching ART from a stop near the hotel to get to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Worst hotel I've ever stayed in.
Summary: This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. When we first checked in we had to switch rooms because the bed and headboard were stained and dirty. The staff was very rude and unhelpful. There was no water for us to drink in the breakfast room and the vending machines were out of water. We switched into a new room and there were ants all over our bathroom and the floor. After returning to the hotel one night we were locked out and had to wait half an hour for someone to give us a new key. It was decently close to Disneyland but you have to pay for the shuttle service to the park. Definitely not worth the money.
I noticed the bed sheets were not washed properly and the room itself was not up to the price paid for.

Summary Heading: Great Service, Clean room, Good location
Summary: We chose this motel as it was reasonably priced and not too far from Disneyland with breakfast supplied. We chose the standard room, but that was a mistake on my part. We had a coffee percolator, but no fridge for any milk. I thought I had booked one with that and the microwave. We stayed on the ground floor.. my only suggestion would be, please try and get a first floor room as you could hear every footstep. We could see the fireworks display from the carpark, don't try and sleep before 9.30pm. They are super loud! Awesome! The room was clean. AC was great, the shower fantastic. The staff were efficient. Not one for chit chat though. The breakfast was an eye opener for us. High fat, High sugar. We were pretty over it by the end of the 6 days. The bus stop is just outside, which

Summary Heading: Simple, Clean, Tidy and all we needed
Summary: Keeping it in perspective. This is a sub $100 a night room. It was clean, quiet and tidy. On a trip with the family, we had 3 twin share rooms. All were great. Very simple and a little dated, but all we needed. We were lucky to spend more than 20 hours at the hotel in 3 days & nights. Breakfast was very busy and very simple (toast, cereal, coffee & tea) but once again, it's a sub $100 a night room and anyone expecting anything more needs to get a little perspective. Air con was a bit noisy, but I've heard and had much worse !! Very close to Disneyland for a short shuttle trip ($12 for 3 days per person) and you can see the whole Disneyland fireworks display from the car park (nightly from 9:30-9:45). Having stayed at other similar priced aniheim hotels previously, Ramada Main

Stay was good, very clean room and close to Disney.  But we did had a very bad experience with the staff, one of our souvenirs bags (a very large and heavy  bubba gump shrimp bag) was missing from our room, and when we call the front desk, we just were told that "they will ask around if anybody took it" and to call back in 15.....When we did call back of course they say nobody saw or bag or took anything !! So I went to the front desk and demanded some answers, and the girl very polite just told me that "maybe the cleaning lady throw the bag in the trash", so there was NOTHING  they could do, I asked to speak to the manager, and she told me she didn't want to bring her or let her know, because she didn't want the cleaning lady to get into trouble. so my stuff was missing, they

I was very skeptical of this hotel because of the bad reviews I had read, but its the total opposite rooms are very clean, staff is friendly, rooms are spacious and good size beds. The free breakfast was very continental and simple, but totally ok with me and my family. I was traveling with a 2,5,7 year old and the stay was great.

Not what I was expecting but the recent remodel saved us!! Made it acceptable. Don't plan on eating their minimal breakfast, it's so crowded you can't move in the tiny room and they had not many options. Even the fruit only red apples) were gone.

Summary Heading: Hotel was nice but breakfast sucked.
Summary: The hotel was nice, clean and quite. But once we got to breakfast there was no milk left for my girls to have with their cereal. To many people in there all at once trying get breakfast and letting there kids run around.

Room was smelling and small. The air conditioning makes a lot of noise and its location might help the person who sleeps next to it to catch a cold. Breakfast is OK. Coffee, juice, yogurt, bread, butter and jam. Also, you can make a Belgian waffle for the kids. The shuttle to Disneyland cost 5 USD a day and it goes next to the hotel.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay for a good price
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay here. We stayed for two nights and had a great experience. The rooms were updated. They were clean. It is very close to Disneyland. Breakfast was good. We got a good deal on the price here. Would recommend staying here and will probably stay here again ourselves if the price is right.

Summary Heading: Good one if you are planning to go to Disneyland
Summary: The hotel is about a mile from Disneyland. Costs about $8 by cab one way or $5 per person for one day pass via ART bus. The bus is only until midnight.  Clean and economical. Decent breakfast! Parking is free.

Summary Heading: Excellent location for Disney Land. Free parking and Disney...
Summary: Excellent location for Disney Land. Free parking and Disney Art bus on doorstep. Would use again.  Breakfast does not look anything like website! Go early to breakfast as gets busy!
Pictures do not resemble the hotel. Carpet in room was filthy, you could feel the dirt on your feet. Hair in the beds and bath and earwigs in the room. Great location for Disney.

Summary Heading: Fine for a short stay to visit Disneyland
Summary: Motel and room were fine generally - had everything we needed without being anything exceptional.  It was good for a two night stay to visit nearby Disneyland but wouldn't want to stay much longer than 2-3 nights. Continental breakfast included but the breakfast room is too small and limited for the number of guests trying to use it.
Rooms have been updated and were very comfy . Only negative was that the breakfast area was always crowded. Pleasantly surprised since it was an older hotel.

This is an older hotel but it has been updated nicely and everything was clean and in good shape. The beds were comfortable. The only inconvenience was not having an elevator. It made it difficult hauling luggage up and down the stairs.   The hotel is walking distance to Disneyland (maybe 15-20 minute walk) but considering how much walking you will be doing at the park, you might not feel like walking back at the end of the day. If you want to save money and be a little further away from the park, I would recommend this hotel. We had a good view of the fireworks from our room too.   Not impressed with the breakfast area. The room is too small and not nearly enough tables. We took our food back to our room but it is difficult to even get around in the room to get your food. The
Comfortable and mostly clean room.  There were ants in the bathroom and trash bags left next to the bins outside. The breakfast and location were a plus.

After searching for hours for a reasonable rate at a hotel I booked The Ramada. It was a 1 night stay and well worth it. Room was cleaning and beds were comfortable Love that the rooms had a small fridge and microwave. Continental breakfast was fulfilling; Eating area was small but clean. We didn't get in the pool, but the area looked clean.  Definitely will stay here again!!
Not for a business traveler. Staff was courteous. Rooms smaller. There were ants in coffee area. HBO was blocked on TV
Room and bath area were a good size for the both of us who stayed in the room. The staff was nice and friendly. Great $5 shuttle service to the Disney Parks.
This hotel was perfect for needing a place to stay for the night.  If we were staying longer may want something else with a little better amenities.

Summary Heading: We were extremely happy with our stay.  Beds were very...
Summary: We were extremely happy with our stay.  Beds were very comfortable and slept soundly. The staff was very friendly and knowledgeable. The room was clean.

We needed a room for five nights that had some space and was near Disneyland.  We looked at several places, but decided on this hotel.  Check-in was quick and easy.  The room was basic, yet had a lot of space.  We were pleased to have a suite with two rooms.  The entry room had two queen beds, a TV, a chair, refrigerator and microwave, and the bathroom area.  There was a door to a connected room which had a queen bed, sofa, chair, tables, and a TV.  It was perfect for our family vacation.  It was easy to get in and out of the parking lot, and was close to Disneyland.  (We mostly drove, but were able to walk, as it was not too far.)  There is a Shakey's Pizza within walking distance, as well as an Italian restaurant that shares the parking lot.    Wifi was good, but we had to

The room was fine.  The problem... my daughter left her stuffed animal behind.  The policy of the hotel was to hand it to a 3rd party (a UPS store) and wash their hands of it!  Not what I expected. I was fortunate that the UPS store took care of my stuffie, as the hotel had no intentions of caring for it! I will not return.
Good room. Okay continental breakfast. Easy ART access. I didn't like how, right when you walk in the room, you enter through the bathroom.

Location was walkable (around 20 mins) to Disneyland and if you don't want to walk, there is a bus stop very close to the hotel. You can buy the day trip ART bus ticket from the receptionist.  The room was clean and comfortable, plenty of spaces for the luggages. Tv, fridge, microwave and coffee maker were available and worked well. The beds also comfortable. If you have lots of luggages, please request ground floor as they don't have elevator.  Breakfast is standard just like other hotels (waffle, cereal, toast, yogurt, etc).
Fantastic location- great service- neat & clean everything- close to Disney and other interesting locations.
Overall it was good stay except one thing! They informed that shuttle is available from hotel to Disneyland but never informed that it's paid :(

There are pros and cons of this hotel. I stayed three nights while visiting Disneyland for the first time.   It isn't far from the parks, but you can't walk it. We used lyft, and depending on traffic, the journey was 5-10 min.   The hotel was a little sketchy looking outside, but on the inside was basic and clean. It had a nice clean bathroom. The beds were comfy enough, we were all dead from Disney and slept well. We weren't in the hotel hardly at all, pretty much to sleep and shower.   The only cons I felt were there weren't many towels initially, but I'm sure you could ask for more. Also, both of our keys quit working. They replaced them, but after being at the parks all day, that last trudge to the office to get a key isn't fun.   If you are looking for a hotel on a budget
Relaxing. And beautiful. Very nice stay loved our room will recommend. And will book here again. You can see Disney's. Fireworks

Summary Heading: Good value for the price I paid.  Clean room, good enough...
Summary: Good value for the price I paid.  Clean room, good enough to just sleep in while at Disneyland

The location of this Ramada was convenient for my business travel and the room was clean.  I travel alone for business and didn't feel safe since the room was on the ground floor and had only a deadbolt on the door. I prefer to have at least one additional lock/latch for security. I called my travel service and had them find me another hotel for my second night of travel in the Anaheim area.
Not enough room in breakfast area, need two waffle makers, hotel room wall paper thin even with a/c on.

Very clean, even behind the bathroom door (my pet peeve). Very helpful staff. One of their maintenance staff notice we were having trouble with our keys and he dropped what he was doing, jogged over and tried to help us open the door. When that did not work he ran all the way to the office and got us new keys and ran back. Beds super comfy. It was the best stay we have had in a hotel in a long time. Thank you very much to the entire staff.

Bed and pillow was lumpy, carpet felt moist. Saw 2 cockroaches about 1.5 inches long. Even though it is the ramada main gate, it's about a mile (20 min walk) to Disneyland. I was able to Purchased bus tickets at the Front desk for 5/per person for a day pass. You can see fireworks from the hotel parking lot/ partially obstructed by hotel building. Staff was friendly and seemed concerned when I told them about the cockroaches.
Overall, no complaints. Easy (late) check in and check out, clean comfortable room, quiet. Would stay again

Very easy booking process online. Check in was easy. Parking can be crowded. Room was clean and had a view of Disney fireworks (slightly) Breakfast was decent with a variety to choose from. I would only suggest upgrading the pool as I was there for business but would have been disappointed if my family was staying with me.
Our room was clean and comfortable. Beds were nice and so was the bathroom and TV. Very close to Disneyland but I wouldn't say walking distance. Would stay here again in the future.

Summary Heading: Cheap Motel For The Area But . . .
Summary: This motel is just a few minutes (by car) and within walking distance of Disneyland.   Given the outrageous prices for hotels this close, this is not a terrible option.  If you really only need the place for sleeping, showering,  etc. because you want to be at  the park(s) from open to close, it is a clean, no frills place.  Otherwise, I would not recommend.

nice and clean ,breakfast was ok too . They had small things to buy personal things,bandages as well. You have to catch city bus ART BUS to Disney not a shuttle ,but was ok .$5 a person . Would stay again

Over all it was a good staying at Ramada Anaheim, staff was friendly, clean room, bathroom, good internet connection, breakfast was ok but if you guys add some eggs to it would be even better, mini fridge and microwave was a plus, personally I would like to come back and stay with you guys again Thanks.
Clean and well maintained. Great deal for the price during a holiday weekend. Very friendly staff.
the pool was clean, that was very important for us. All of the Maid s are friendly and helpful. Great staff
Decent room and walking distance to Disneyland. For the price along with free parking, I couldn't ask for more!

This motel is not quite as close to Disneyland as I thought. It's isn't just a short walk, but a mile and three tenths, up an overpass. Walking there would have been fine, but a walk back to the motel at 11 p.m., just is not feasible for us. However, the ART bus #10 was maybe 20 feet from our room and dropped us off right in front of Disneyland. It costs $5 a day per person and is well worth it. Don't even think of driving, you Disney World fans. This is nothing like WDW parking and takes up a lot of your time - not worth it! Now the room. It was not luxurious, but that was not expected. It was clean and comfortable, with two queen sized beds and comfortable pillows, plus the usual amenities. It was just what my daughter and I needed. The staff couldn't have been more helpful.

We were looking for a location near Angel's Stadium and this was perfect.  The staff was nice and the room was roomy and clean. The free breakfast was simple but good enough to get you started in the morning. A nice surprise was the amazing Disneyland fireworks show we could see from our room. We would definitely  stay here again.

While I've stayed in a number of hotels, this was the first time I'd done so with my infant daughter & it was an interesting experience.   First, what they did right: the staff we interacted with were all very courteous & friendly, & the room was clean.   Mixed blessing: the hotel is VERY close to Disneyland. We weren't there for the theme park, but you pay more because of the location, &, on nights they have fireworks, they are VERY loud.   Downsides: it was extremely hot the day we checked in, & the room was totally sealed up. I understand that we all want to conserve electricity, but the hotel KNEW that room was booked, so why wouldn't they set the thermostat for, say, 80°, so just walking in wasn't a totally miserable experience? I was relieved to see blackout curtains over

We have just spent 5 nights and couldn't fault the hotel. Arrived early from Australia and our rooms were ready by 11. Rooms were clean and of a good size. Beds were comfortable and there is a laundry on siteThere is a pool but we didn't use it as we were at Disneyland the whole time. There are service stations and a liquor/ mini market close by. It took us about 20 minutes to walk to the main gate of Disneyland.Perfect hotel if you want to be away from the Disneyland crowds and expense.

Used this room for a Disney weekend. It was comfortable, room was clean and it had a grea view of the fireworks at the back of the complex on the second floor :) would recommend the upstairs room so don't have to worry about hearing foot steps above you :) and Complementary breakfast is decent. You can make waffles!

It was the perfect place to start our trip at. Clean, nice views from the room. Free parking, free breakfast (actually pretty good). Best of all, it is right next to another hotel which is was on the bus line to disney so it was very easy to get to disney early and come back late. (You can buy the bus pass from the hotel next door). Also, as a tip to save money, get groceries from nearby and keep in your fridge, warm in microwave. We got packed salads and lots of snacks and took to disney to keep us going all day. It worked perfectly.

Summary Heading: Great place to stay on Disney trips
Summary: Clean hotel. Shuttle to Disney is near. Breakfast is good, but get in there early as it's crowded. We always come back to this hotel on Disney weekend trips-great value!

We enjoyed our stay the bed and Roman was comfortable it was a very handy location to Disneyland and some food outlets. Ample parking and I enjoyed a swim in a nice clean pool. The only fault the carpet and flooring was dirty. You had to wear shoes or else your feet or socks got filthy. Possibly residue from the car park or heavy foot traffic but the flooring should be properly cleaned not just vacuumed. Nice complimentary toiletries were offered. The White towels although clean were quite grey in colour. The breakfast offered was yoghurt, pastries, waffles, coffee, juice, fruit, cereal, donuts and toast or muffins. The room was clean but stocks were not replenished enough. I would definitely stay here again. The hotel was very good value for money given its location and

The hotel was very clean and was easy to sleep in. The people working there though were not very helpful gave bad information on everything and didn't know very much of anything and didn't seem very happy to be helping on anything.

This hotel was great for our quick Disneyland trip.  The beds were a little too firm for my comfort, but everyone else in my family slept fine.  There is a small pool, nothing fancy.  The fireworks show was really loud, and startled us at first.  The nearby ART shuttle to Disneyland is convenient.  (Yes, it's in front of a liquor store, but my family never saw anything unsettling/suspicious.)  The neighborhood is no worse than any other city street.

Summary Heading: Our adjoining rooms suited our needs.  The staff was very...
Summary: Our adjoining rooms suited our needs.  The staff was very helpful and the location was perfect.  We were able to Uber to and from our destinations easily and quickly.

The ramada main gate north was an excellent stay on our recent trip to Disneyland. 20 minute walk from Disneyland or a 5 minute bus ride (Anaheim resort transportation $5). Clean and comfortable rooms and a decent continental breakfast. You can watch the nightly fireworks from the parking lot. Would definitely stay here again.
The room was nicer than I expected. It had a mini fridge and microwave. The pool was eh. It was in a weird spot and looked very small. But overall I would stay here again.

We have just returned from my grandchildrens 1st trip to Disneyland, and for the first time in my 60 years of age, I am loaded with bedbug bites, I am so miserable, I have traveled extensively and this is a first.  I was in room 239!  Also the shuttle they advertise is actually the RTA (public transportation) $5 for adults $3 for children, Disneyland is NOT walking distance.  Don't let housekeeping in my room when traveling, but I usually exchange my towels when they are in the hallway, I handed them 3 big towels and she didn't have any and said here take these and gave me 6 washcloths and 4 hand towels, another attendant told me to call front desk! Good things microwave/refrigerator in room. Fireworks at night from Disney you can view and were nice. Breakfast room nice, typical
This was my first time staying at this property and really enjoyed my stay. The room was clean and the beds were super comfortable!!! Would stay here again.

Family of four looking for a clean, comfy, budget place to stay, close to Disneyland.  Ramada Northgate ticked all the boxes. We walked (15 min) to Disney everyday.  Saw the nightly fireworks display from or room.  Filled up on a nice, basic breakfast of cereal, toast, waffles & fruit in a clean dining area. There were plenty of restaurants locally, and easy access to the freeway & shops. The room was basic, clean and quiet place to rest/sleep each night.  Nothing more, nothing less.  We saved plenty by staying here, and spent it shopping at the local malls.  I was disappointed to find there was space for a fridge, but one wasn't installed as a standard item in the room.  In three weeks of traveling the USA, this is the only complex which charged more for a room with a fridge.

Hotel claims i's within walking distance to Disneyland but it is not. you need to drive your car and pay parking or pay for shuttle. wished it was closer to Disneyland too far for our 6 year old grandkids to walk and for us to walk especially after a long day spent at the park.
Excellent budget accommodation.  Shuttle bus outside.  Wonderful restaurant out the front.  Please ant experience.

Let me start of by saying that the hotel itself is actually pretty nice. We were pleasantly surprised at the rooms, they were clean and renovated. However, the neighbourhood that it is located is super sketchy. My sister and I did not feel comfortable waiting for the ART bus, as we were constantly being approached by locals, and drug addicts, and people asking us if we were here alone. We read a ton of reviews on this hotel and were both shocked that no one said anything about the neighbourhood. The "hotel shuttle" which is actually ART does not pick you up from the hotel. It actually picks you up at a bus stop that is directly in front of the liquor store. The park is too far to walk to, even for us young adults, so you have to take the bus, which was also never on time. The

Staff are extremely pleasant, accommodating, friendly, and helpful.  Rooms are modern and clean.  Only a 15 minute walk to Disney, but shuttle bus also available.  Breakfast was plentiful with a wide range of hot and cold selections.  *BONUS*  An amazing view of the Disney fireworks directly from my 2nd floor balcony where you can set out a chair to watch.  A very safe location to walk to and from Disney,  I felt comfortable walking even late in evening.

Summary Heading: Clean rooms, friendly staff.  I recommend it!
Summary: Stayed here for a trip to Disneyland.  Staff were very accommodating and helpful.  Rooms were clean and adequate for families.  Outside swimming pool was great for the kids.  Too far to walk to Disneyland but just a short drive to parking and a free shuttle from there.  Great shuttle service back to your car. Try the Italian restaurant next to the hotel, absolutely amazing!

We stayed 3 nights. It was clean and safe feeling. Close to Disneyland and I-5. Had a fridge and microwave and a washer and dryer available. Reasonable priced. Free Parking. Free breakfast although basically just sweets. Some sort of protein could have been provided. Overall great stay for the price.
awesome clean jackie at the front desk was very nice and informative good pool housekeeping staff was outstanding

I was sadly disappointed by the claims of this hotel.The staff was amazing ,the room was clean, and location was great. The problem that I had with this hotel was that I specifically called in advance to find out if the pool is heated (that was a determining factor In where we were going to stay ) they told me yes it was heated but in fact it was not.

Summary Heading: Affordable. Clean. The part of the shuttle is a bit...
Summary: Affordable. Clean. The part of the shuttle is a bit misleading though. It is not a hotel shuttle. It is the general anaheim resort shuttle which you catch from the bus stop. Breakfast room a bit small. Can't accommodate all guests. Bedroom needs a cuobiard for clothing .Otherwise good value for money

When we first got there finally after a 9 hour drive. I went in the lobby to ask a question and there was two guys in there and they both looked at me and I started to ask a question and they both ignored me then one grabbed the phone and I continued asking my question to the other guy who ignored me and looked angry that I was even talking to him. The other guy got off the phone and just looked at me and I asked again about being able to check in later he said yes and then they bth went about here business. Later on the night when we came back to check in it was a different man and he was nice. The carpet in the room turned the bottom of our feet black and the last morning we stayed there, there was a roach by the sink area and we found a weird black beetle in the bathroom. Was
Very close to Disneyland and clean/organized property. Basic appliances in the room. Just make sure you know this is not a hotel, but a motel.

Wyndham needs to stop adding substandard hotel to their chain. This place was noisy at 4 am & people stepped out of their rooms to smoke right outside the door. For a nonsmoking room, it's annoying to feel the effect in your room.

This place was fine and clean. I had hoped that we would be able to walk to Disneyland but with two small children we ended up sucking it up and paying the $18 for parking both days. Sigh.  Our kids really enjoyed the breakfast here and we enjoyed being able to sit outside and relax in the evenings. You also get an excellent view of the fireworks on the 2nd floor.

My daughter and I had one day to enjoy Disneyland from open to close. So, this was the perfect stay. We got there at 9pm, checked in, slept, and got up early for Disney. An easy 10 minute walk to the park, a safe midnight walk back afterward, to sleep, and then left in the morning. It was great for being "on a budget". I didnt want to pay alot to just shower and sleep. It was clean, and simple. No extra "fluff" of any kind.

Summary Heading: We went to Disneyland for the weekend, so we were hardly in...
Summary: We went to Disneyland for the weekend, so we were hardly in our room. It was nice to have the shuttle so close and free breakfast.

This place was awesome! Sooo clean. The front desk help was very nice. The beds were comfy and the pillows too and I usually always have issues with those in hotels. I didn't here. So close to Disneyland and we enjoyed the firework shows from Disneyland. They were SUPER close! Hotel room smelled amazing. We ordered pizza in and it tasted AMAZING! We will DEFINITELY stay here again.

Can not fault this hotel at all. A nice 15 minute walk to Disneyland or one stop bus ride. Rooms spotless, no issues with Wi-Fi, Breakfast was busy as everyone seemed to show up around a 45 minute block when the breakfast room is open from 6:30am-10:30am. Staff where amazing, helpful and quick to assist. I wont be looking at any other hotel on return trips it will be Ramada Anaheim Maingate North only. Having traveled 18,000km this was the prefect place to stay and relax.
If you are looking for a CHEAP option for while you are at Disneyland, this is it. It might be worth a little bit more per night ($10-$20) for a better breakfast and closer location.
All was fine until about 10:00 pm. You could hear every single thing happening on the second floor especially on the room above.

Summary Heading: not up to the 2 1/2 stars ranking
Summary: The room is old and tiny.  It lacks of storage space for luggage and coats.  The hotwire website stated 75% recommended.  I would not recommend this hotel at all.  I would give it 2 stars instead of 2 1/2.  Also , there are lots of street noise.

Summary Heading: Continues to be a great place
Summary: We love the convenience and atmosphere at this facility. The staff are friendly and helpful. We almost always stay here when we are in Anaheim.

This was an ok place to stay for a stop. We stayed here in our last night before leaving Disneyland. I wouldn't have wanted to stay for our entire Disneyland trip. It isn't within walking distance and with little ones that was important. It's about a 10 minute drive. Breakfast was fine. It fed us before heading out. Room was clean, and I have no complaints there. Staff was friendly. Wifi was not very strong.

Summary Heading: Very Comfortable, Extremely Convenient and Excellent Value for Money
Summary: Booked this hotel via travel agent due to its proximity to Disneyland and was very impressed.  We received a very warm welcome when checking in and that process was very efficient.  The rooms are in two blocks surrounding the car park and we were able to park outside our room which was extremely convenient.  An added bonus was complimentary wifi for as many devices as you had - a real bonus.  The room was very spacious, clean, comfortable and had all the essentials plus coffee maker.  The beds were very comfortable and there was plenty of storage space and the size of the room was generous.  The room was kept clean.  Despite the location off a main road there was very little noise other than the Disney fireworks that you could watch from the car park.  The hotel has a small

Summary Heading: Basic rooms nothing fancy but close to Disneyland
Summary: The rooms are dated and you wont get anything fancy here for your dollar. What you do get is walking distance to Disneyland or ART bus almost at the front door for $5 a day full day use. The free breakfast is good, basic offerings in a bit of a crowded room but enough to fill you before heading to Disneyland. Area is pretty safe, safe to walk to nearby fast food restaurants (El Loco Polo / Burger King / KFC /McDonalds)  and theres a small Walmart within the vicinity for incidentals. Budget stay that serves its purpose

Clean rooms, comfortable, friendly staff, breakfast included and apart from most people arriving within a 45 minute window over the 4 hours the dinning room is open its easy to get breakfast and take it back to the room, no issue with Wi-FI. 15 minute walk to Disney, lazies can catch bus a few yards for one stop. Fireworks seen from the pool & some rooms.
Shabby,little tiny pool in parking lot. Would never ever tecommend this place. Costs the same as much nicer hotels. Scares me to book thru Wyndom.
Great room. Perfect location. Steps away from bus stop. One stop away from Disney. Don't get a room by the stairs. Other guests aren't always considerate.

Welcome agent was knowledgeable and courteous. I asked extra towel and received them,they were kind of brown but clean. Surprised you didn't have eggs in your breakfast,first time in a hotel breakfast for me but overall staff was nice,location was fine and room was clean.
Clean but not super friendly. Also took a $50 swipe on credit card for incidentals that none were incurred but still have not received money back
I enjoyed my stay at this Ramada. The staff were friendly and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable. The breakfast needs some improvement.
Great little hotel right down the street from Disneyland. Next door to a great Italian restaurant and plenty other restaurants down the street. We liked it!

Impressed by the cleanliness of the room.  Bathroom was spotless.  Liked the mini-frig and microwave that were in the room.  The free continental breakfast was also appreciated.  Staff was polite and professional.  Would stay here again.

Front desk was great and helpful. Parking was easy, breakfast was decent (they really need another waffle maker). But I couldn't get past the cloudy water coming from the tap. It was simply gross. The tub water was clear but not the sink water. Just something that completely turned me off of this hotel. Won't stay here again unless it gets fixed. Oh and we found a fake fingernail on the floor - classy.

Summary Heading: Reasonable room for our family vacation to Disneyland
Summary: We stayed for 7 nights and really had no complaints. The hotel is about what you would expect from a Ramada - nothing real fancy or special, but clean and comfortable.  Pros:  The shuttle to Disneyland is almost right outside the hotel Reasonably clean room Beds and pillows were adequate (we like a matress that is a bit less firm, but they were not hard) Lots of ree parking Quiet even though we were near the lobby and Harbour Blvd. Breakfast included Carolina's Restaurant adjacent to hotel (Reasonably priced, large quantities, can share)  Pool was nice and clean Can watch the Disney fireworks from the back parking lot (or back rooms I would imagine) Lower cost than many of the hotels near Disneyland (while still being a decent place to stay)  Cons:  A bit of a long walk to

Summary Heading: Clean, remodeled rooms and bathrooms! We had a perfect view...
Summary: Clean, remodeled rooms and bathrooms! We had a perfect view of the Disneyland fireworks too. The breakfast area is a little crowded but everything else was great!

The hotel was only a mile from the drop off for Disneyland.  The bus route was cheap and easy to use.  The rooms was clean and in good repair. Staff was very helpful and answered all my questions.  Last year I stayed at another hotel for the same price the room was old and run down.  Def staying here again!

I would highly recommend this hotel. The price is right and it was much nicer than I thought it would be. We are used to staying at nicer hotels but we wanted to try something more affordable so we can come to Disneyland on a weekly basis for I take advantage of our annual pass.  We will definitely be staying at this hotel again.   Super clean room and updated furnishings. They just had a remodel.  We were at Disneyland all day and returned at night to a hot shower and comfy bed.  It is within walking distance but we did have to cross the overpass bridge which we were very careful when crossing But other than that I had my two year old in her stroller and the few blocks walk was just the right warm up to a full day of running around Disneyland.  They do have a shuttle service

The Ramada was a great find for our trip to Disney.  Very convenient to the park and clean and comfortable.  The pizza from the Italian restaurant right in the parking lot was yummy and they were kind enough to deliver it to our room.  This was a great place to refresh after a long day experiencing the magic of Disney.  As a extra perk -- we were able to see the Disney fireworks from the balcony at the hotel!

Summary Heading: Great value and just across the street
Summary: This has always been our go to hotel when going to Disneyland.  It is just a short walk across the street.  Until this last trip parking was free.  They still have free small breakfast by the pool.  We really miss the pizza and coffee place that used to be in front of the hotel.  The renovations are nice and you can see fireworks from many rooms.  We will continue to go to this hotel.
Nice, clean hotel with friendly staff.  Good continental breakfast.  Good location to Disney parks

Summary Heading: In the dodgy part of Anaheim, but OK if you need a cheap stay
Summary: We knew the location was not the best, but chose it for the shuttle bus to Disneyland at the front door. The shuttle however is not as regular as it is supposed to be and can be quite frustrating. On the shuttle trip you can see just a few blocks away, the town centre of Anaheim is quite lovely, then back to dodgy town when you get off. The shop next to the hotel at the bus stop is quite scary looking. Just a room to sleep at night is all we needed and is what we got. Was reasonably comfortable.
No issues at all.  Very helpful front office, clean room, easy access and great price.  What else can you ask for in a hotel.
The lighting made the room feel like we were staying in a mental hospital. All bright white bulbs.

I thought because I was booking with Wyndham I had a certain degree of expectation, and was blown out of my my mind, the place first of all was a motel in Anaheim near Disneyland,  I got there and the receptionist was rude, did Not make me feel welcome, I asked if my grandson May accidentally turn on the pay per view, if there was a lock,she looked at annoyed and said we don't have pay per view, she hardly even looked from what she was doing hardly any eye contact, I had questions she had yes or no answers, I was left to wonder ... I went to the room, there is a microwave and a small refrigerator, yuk is what came to mind, the towels were dingy, it smelled musty in there, I was afraid for my daughter and grandsons safety as it felt non secure...I have to wonder if Wyndham checks

This was the second time my husband and I stayed here for a quick Disney trip. I like this hotel a lot. Very reasonable rates, hotel rooms are clean (most important), parking is FREE (which is a rarity for that area around Disney), and breakfast is Included as well! The front desk staff I have encountered are always very nice and helpful, and usually grant us a late check out no problem, and the tram/bus to take you to Disney is right out the front door and only $5 for an all day pass and takes less than 10 minutes to get there, and that is taking into account the other 2 stops it makes for Disney pickups after us. The new awesome BONUS is the restaurant that shares their parking lot is no longer that nasty Mexican food place, it is now called Carolina's and has EXCELLENT

When staying in Anaheim this is my go to place to stay.  After the recent remodel the rooms look great.  It's a little over a mile walk to Disneyland from here but to me the cost savings makes it worth it.
very clean was enjoyable nice location would come back again. would tell to friends and family about this place.

Excellent location close to Disneyland.  Rooms could be cleaner.  The bathroom definitely needed to be cleaned better, toilet did not appear to have been cleaned.  Minimal breakfast included would be fine if you enjoy cereal and toast.

I'll like to start off with the fact that the front desk staff were very kind and were as helpful as possible. BUT, unfortunately the hotel itself left much to be desired. My main complaint was regarding my door key. I had to visit the front desk each time I tried to enter my room because the keys would not work. This was frustrating because my room was on the second floor and furthest away from the front desk.    In addition, the shower head had a spray of water that shot out onto the floor whenever the water was turned on. And the "heated" pool was not heated the entire weekend! The kids got in the pool with it being freezing cold. The pool/Jacuzzi is something many kids look forward to. I asked about it and I was simply told that the heater was broken. This kind of sucked
It is clean and decent. It is on a really bad ART route and too far to walk to Disney though. I will never stay again just because getting to the park was a hassle.

I was afraid of the distance from the motel to our destination but the convinence of the ART was great. It stopped right outside the motel. Even better was the fact that the rooms were relaxing and comfortable. I loved the fact there was a microwave and fridge in the room. The staff was so kind and polite. The whole establishment was clean and organized. This is a great place to stay when visiting Disneyland.

No complaints whatsoever. Great sized room and property. Plenty of parking. Great front desk staff. Less than 5 minute drive to Disneyland. You can see fireworks in the parking lot. Housekeeping was fantastic, rooms were always clean and smelled great. Beds were soooo comfy too. We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: Walking distance, but not recommended for little ones
Summary: I stayed there with teenagers. If you are on a budget and only need a place to sleep at night, then this hotel is a good option. The breakfast room is small, and while the options are not great, you won't be hungry after eating there (few fruits, some bread and pastries, pancake machine, but no protein). The pool is small, we did not use it though. Good amount of parking in the hotel. Wifi works but very slow.  Distance to Disneyland is close to 1 mile, maybe a bit less. We walked, but I don't recommend it with small kids.

Hotel was nice, not too far from the park...staff should let guest know about the Shuttles...but staff were nice and professional once we asked about the shuttle they had tickets...was a 10 minute walk to the park, but who wants to walk in 2016, enough walking done at Disney...overall the room was clean and spacious...continental breakfast was good....

The room was pretty clean except for the ants that I found in the bathroom in the morning. The hotel could definitely use some sound-proofing. I could hear a lot of noise from outside the room. The bed was comfortable, though.
Close enough to Disneyland. Rooms were comfortable and beds were comfortable. Would book again if we go to Disneyland again
Not really a good place, expected better service, but got crudy $20 a night motel service. Plus they didn't even have water.. Like... How can you not have complimentary water.

Check in was easy.  Room was clean with coordinating green and brown walls, spreads and curtains.  The bed was comfortable.  Breakfast was in the lobby which was across the parking lot.  This a motel, no indoor hallways.  I did not see an elevator.  Breakfast had the usual, cereal, toast, danish, make your own waffles, juice and coffee.  I didn't experience problems with the internet.

Room was very nice, a little noisy on ground floor. Very roomy and clean.   Price was great, check in/out pleasant.   Fitness room was closed, pool was fine and very convenient to park with ART shuttle.  Overall great!
I don't like that I was charged the $50 deposit twice because I had to make 2 separate reservations, one for 1 night and 1 for 3 nights.
