LOUD! From inside the room you can hear everything. People coming and going, knocking, car horns, EVERY TIME someone flushes or uses the shower. We left after only one night. They made the refund process difficult on top of it. I was only seeking a refund for the remainder of the stay that we weren't there for. They stated they would get back to me in 72 hours regarding the request for refund. The phone call never came. I had to track them down.

Summary Heading: Comfortable Room at a Good Location
Summary: We stayed recently at the RAMN. The room was comfortable, the location was down the street from Disneyland and the price was reasonable. The front desk person who checked us in was very friendly and went out of her way to be helpful. My only complaint was that the walls seamed to be thin as after I turned off my TV, I could still hear the TV of the room next door. I also heard their alarm clock the next morning. It wasn't bad but still noticeable. Also, the free breakfast selections were so so and the room where the breakfast was served was in need of ventilation as it was stuffy. All in all I was mostly satisfied and will probably come back if I ever need a room near Disneyland again.

Room was clean. They had my room at the top of the steps on the 2nd floor. The solid curtains did not close but the sheer ones did.  People could look in if they tried. They are really worried about people stealing items like towels and coffee makers. Front desk was ok. Needed to work on people skills a bit. I'd go back. Bed was hard.

Summary Heading: Very Clean and Awesome Free Continental  Breakfast
Summary: Very close to Disneyland just a mile driving. Hotel is very clean. Love the free continental breakfast. Very affordable. Easy checked in and checked out. We are very happy and comfortable with our stay. Totally recommended!

Summary Heading: Nice & beautiful rooms even Room was Far from office very back side.
Summary: I like this motel , front desk Girl gave me room very far from office & Back side room , I thought definitely room Not be Nice, But I was wrong , Very nice beautiful clean Room.

A lot of the reviews on here were quite negative, so I was not looking forward to visiting here. On arrival, however, the place was totally fine! We're not talking 5 star luxury, but a very comfortable bed, good wifi, helpful staff, large and clean room (with a microwave), nice bathroom. All together, very acceptable. It is a fair walk from disney, but the shuttle leaves half hourly (ish) and is only $5 return, and there's some places to eat within walking distance, although we didn't try any of them, as there were more places within a 5 minute drive. Breakfast included pastries, waffles, juice, tea, coffee, yoghurt, toast, fresh fruit and cereal. While basic, it was more than enough to start the day and there was always plenty. There was also plenty of parking, and while the

This was our first time staying at this location. Really close to the park. Plenty of parking. Super friendly staff. Clean rooms. Easy check in. They have a nice continental breakfast with Danishes waffle maker coffee and juices. Really a nice place to stay. Minutes from the parking structure for Disneyland.

We were not expecting much from this hotel as it seemed like just another one of the many small hotels surrounding Disneyland, but we could not have been more wrong!  Fantastic service, clean, comfy rooms, great breakfast and I walked back to the room from Disneyland after the 10k and I was tired, so I would say definitely walking distance!  What a fantastic stay!
It was within 5 min drive from Disney.  Nice clean room and decent continental breakfast.  Staff was very friendly and helpful.
Very pleased with how the rooms were presented, considering the 'motel' type property. Very clean and modern..as if it had  a recent remodel. Will go back again!
Clean room, polite staff & covinienit location to Disneyland. Most important is safe & reasonable price.

Summary Heading: Terrible front desk, nice clean rooms
Summary: We arrived at night after a long drive from San Francisco, it was raining and as we parked in front of the front desk, the lady, who we later found was named Laura (I read at least another complain about her specifically!) locked the reception door in our faces, turned around and LEFT!, we kept knocking the door thinking there was someone else in the office. About 15 minutes went by and a fellow guest told us "I think she went to the laundry" (I should let you know she DID go to the laundry and returned with blankets and pillows but NOT for a guest, but for her), we approached her in the hall and said we had a reservation to which she answered "Huh" and kept walking, we followed her to the front desk, she entered by a back door, unlocked the door and didn't even open the door,
Everything was 5 stars at this fairly priced hotel. easy in and out to Disneyland and a nice light breakfast to start the day.. We will return for sure !!

I hate to give this hotel a negative review because it was very,very clean and that is a real plus.  Also, the staff was friendly and helpful.  But I tossed  and turned the first two nights in a two queen bed room, waking up repeatedly.  I finally changed beds and slept perfectly on a newer, firm mattress.  Mattresses need to be replaced in a timely manner so visitors can get a good night's sleep.  After all, that's what they are there for. Extra blankets would have been helpful also.  I ended up using the blankets from the extra bed for warmth.
The hotel is very good. The breakfast area is a little small and tend to get crowded. The breakfast didn't have a "hot buffet", no sausage, eggs, bacon etc... Overall, very good.

Summary Heading: fair hotel for a fair price.
Summary: It is at a nice distance from Disney and It was okay. There was ants in one room so they gave us a new room. The rooms seem clean and the breakfast was basic but good. Overall for the price the hotel is in fair condition.
Great place 15 min walk from Disneyland gates. Free breakfast, not much but fills you up so you spend less in the park!rooms spacious and clean, great place for location, would definately be back!

Summary Heading: Nice update of rooms...but a few issues.
Summary: Nice update on the room, which was clean.  It is about 0.8 miles from Disneyland, so not too far to walk if you are just going there and back.  A nap and return later equals a lot of walking.  There were numerous issues, which all were taken care of, but probably should have never had occurred.  We had only 1 towel on check-in and zero towels on another day.  When requested, we were able to pick them up.  The electric outlets also went out in our room and they were fixed by the time we returned.  A couple of things took a while to fix (drawer that always slid open- safety hazard and a toilet seat that would slide around).  Those two issues took 2 -3 days to fix and a second call down.    Breakfast was good (waffles, bread, yogurt..).

Summary Heading: Nice but need a shutle to get to Disneyland
Summary: Very affordable but the name lies.  This is not the MAINGATE At ALL.  There is another Ramada that is the MAINGATE.  This location you need a shuttle.  The breakfast was okay but not tons of selection and the staff seems bugged to help you.

I was disappointed because the person at the front desk said that they could arrange a shuttle to the airport.  I gave them all my information including flight number and airport.  When I went to catch the shuttle in the morning there was no shuttle.  This left me in a bind and I paid an outrageous price for a uber driver which the front desk arranged.  I will never stay there again.  If they had no intention of arranging the shuttle they should have told me upfront so that I could make other arrangements,.  I was very upset and disappointed in the staff.  When no shuttle came the morning staff gave me the phone to call and see why the shuttle didn't come then I found out one was not arranged.

we traveled from Arizona and found this location at the last minute . we arrived early prior to the 3 pm check in time and was able to get in our room 30 minutes well done very friendly staff thank you. bg

Summary Heading: Spacious Room, Close to the park!
Summary: Very straightforward, standard hotel room. Everything was clean and neat, as well as had fast wifi. If you're heading to Disneyland, it's a bit of a walk, but very do-able. The front desk has daily shuttle passes available. Very helpful staff and the complimentary breakfast had a lot of options, including make your own waffles!

Summary Heading: I requested a very quiet room.  Instead I got a room where...
Summary: I requested a very quiet room.  Instead I got a room where every sound coming from all directions can be easily heard.  I hardly slept thru the night.  The materials that the building was made out of seemed paper-thin allowing all sounds from without to be easily heard in the room.

Quality remodel of an older exterior access hotel. Bathroom totally refreshed. Standard breakfast was busy. Close to shuttle; can't walk to park. Quiet location. Can see fireworks.   (-) Pillows and towels. Pool not warm enough in winter. Not vacuumed.

I was very impressed with the staff. Mainly Laura. We were to arrive at approximately 11:00 pm at night. I called earlier and requested a lower level. When we arrived it was perfect. We checked in and the room was next to the main office. The room was very clean. We will definately stay here for our next visit. The only complaint was there was no protein for breakfast.

Summary Heading: Nowhere near MAIN GATE Don't stay here.
Summary: This hotel's name is misleading.  It is NOT near the main gate of Disneyland.  It is a mile away.  And not a good mile for walking.  So don't pick this hotel if you think it is at the Main Gate.  IT ISN'T.
Please note there is a Ramada maingate and Ramada maingate "At the park" Pick the right one Breakfast was ok.

This hotel was a $5 Uber ride to Downtown Disney and the Parks, had snacks/supplies in the lobby, clean room, plenty of outlets, fridge/microwave in the room.  We came for a "quick" trip for a surprise birthday and would stay again…the only odd thing was the room had smelled like incense which was off putting..not sure if it was the cleaners they used or what, otherwise it was fine
Clean safe quiet, close to my destination, not outrageously priced all good.  Breakfast options could have used more protein

Overall this is a good place to stay.  Price is reasonable, easy access to Disneyland (bit of a walk but doable).  Rooms are clean with a decent breakfast.  However, don't rely on their internet, its terrible.

Summary Heading: Good hotel not far from theme parks
Summary: The hotel room was nice and recently remodeled everything was clean even  the bathroom. Lots of parking and free breakfast for the morning.

The room was clean and the staff was friendly. Could see the Disney fireworks from the hotel at night. Close to Disney, but no free shuttle. We had no problem walking but would not recommend doing that with children! It might be a bit much, especially at the end of the day.
Great value, great staff and AWESOME housekeeping! Updated rooms, good parking, quiet, and close to Disneyland. We will stay here again!

Well my dad accidently booked this hotel thinking it was the one closer to the entrance. It's a mile away definitely not at the maingate. It's a decent hotel for the price. Beds are comfortable, hotel was quiet, rooms and facility kept clean. Security cameras placed around so that's good. Rooms are pretty big too. You get a great view of the fireworks as it is close to the backside of the disneyland park. Parking lot is a bit small. Staff was friendly enough. The water pressure in the shower was lacking, but the bathrooms were nice and clean. No bucket for the ice machine. The ac worked fine. Fridge was super cold, but a little noisy. The first night I could hear our neighbors, but after that didn't hear anything. Wifi was spotty, that's normal in any hotel I think. Breakfast

Summary Heading: Priced real well..clean..breakfast good and staff very...
Summary: Priced real well..clean..breakfast good and staff very friendly and helpful.We will stay there again

Beds were super comfy and pillows were soft. Breakfast was pretty generic with waffles, cereal, yogurt, and donuts.  It's about a mile from Disney and we didn't have a problem walking too and from.  Some people complained about the area being sketchy, but we didn't really have any concerns.  There were a few homeless in the area, but walking home at midnight wasn't very scary since so many other people and cast members were also out and about.  The towels were kind of scratchy, but that's to be expected at a 2 star.  I was a bit disappointed though for no fridge or microwave when the website made it sound like we would have one.
Hotel is very good... the shuttle runs right in front of the hotel,  and it's only 5 minutes to the park...

The surroundings of the hotel is not romantic, but other than that it has a lot of nice features; clean comfortable rooms, two queenbeds, free parking. Breakfast is free, but do not expect a luxory breakfast. One can order meals to the room from nearby restaurants. Some of the disney fireworks can be seen from the hotel. It is a five minute drive to Disneyland.

This room is bigger than the Anaheim Marriott. I liked the quiet parking lot. Too bad the restaurant next door wasn't open at the time that I stayed, but oh well. Saw the Disneyland park fireworks right from my room. Very interesting (and that was the only loud part about it). Other than that, great place and very friendly and professional staff.

Summary Heading: Prior to visit was told our room had a microwave and...
Summary: Prior to visit was told our room had a microwave and frig...however, had neither. We could have talked with the manager the next morning about getting another room, but choose to actually go to Disneyland as planned rather than spend our time switching rooms. Staff should be aware of what room accomdations have. Room was clean, right on bus line, and small market near to purchase some items.

Summary Heading: Very good hotel with affordable price
Summary: Ramada is very good hotel. I spent two night here on my trip to disneyland last thanks giving. Plus point from me:  - free parking, big parking lot - free simple breakfast. - nice and friendly frontdesk, special thx to "ammar" for your help to allow me put my food/beverages on office fridge and using your office's microwave - close to disney, if you enjoy walk it only 10-15 minutes walk. - if using shuttle we can just pay $5 for a daily pass of disney shuttle service which halte is just 1-2 minute walk.  - I did walking that day, but when returned to the hotel I use Uber, $4.8 for one trip from outside disney to the hotel.   Minus: - No microwave in the room. - No refrigerator/fridge also in the room  Thank you

Summary Heading: I did NOT sign up to shower with ANTS!
Summary: After our first day back from the park, we noticed extra guests in our bathroom.  It was very late so before leaving the next morning, we stopped in the office let them know we had ants.  Lots of them.  We were very nice about it but expected the problem to be resolved upon returning that evening.  The young man said he would inform maintenance.  Upon our return late that evening, we didn’t see any ants in our bathroom area.  The next morning we found they had all gone in our shower!  They were all over the walls, on our shampoo and soap!  It was disgusting!  We did not sign up to shower with ANTS!  They were falling off the walls and floating by our feet as we showered!!!  We went back to the office and a young gal acted like it was the end of the world, apologized then said,

Summary Heading: You need to have a working toilet
Summary: The room was great except for the broken toilet handle which made us take the lid off the toilet & manually lift the lever to get the toilet to flush.  We reported it on Sat AM thinking it would get fixed when we returned from Disneyland on Sat at 11:30 PM.  To our surprise it did not get fixed & I was determined to not lift the lid on the toilet anymore so I was able to figure out how to screw the bolt back on the handle & fix it myself.  Sun AM we were getting ready to check out & the repair man came to fix it so I told him I fixed it myself & asked how much I should get paid.  He just laughed so I told the front desk the same story & they didn't even apologize let alone offer a discount because after all we paid for a clean room with a working bathroom.  It was cheaper then

This hotel was no where near the Disney parks. The location was sketch and unsafe after dark. The front desk staff was horrible. We had no towels in our room. The room had bugs and the carpet was coming out of the wall. The beds are hard and uncomfortable. The shuttle never came even though we paid for our passes. The breakfast was donuts and yogurt cups which was always gone even when we went right after they opened. Please don't be misled like we were and don't ever stay on the North side!

This hotel is very very deceiving! Me and my sister stayed here and were terrified the entire time. Every single day that we were waiting for the shuttle to Disney we were approached by drug addicts and drunks. The driver of our shuttle wouldn't even drop us off at the normal bus stop at night and would drop us off at our hotel door because she was so uncomfortable with us walking in this neighborhood. The room was fine I will admit, but the staff all had attitude and I personally had a terrible feeling about them. On our first night there one of the hotel staff walked in on me while I was getting changed without knocking or anything. If you are looking for a value hotel then yes I would suggest this...but just beware that the neighborhood is honestly terrifying. People

We were looking for something inexpensive and close to Disneyland; Ramada Anaheim Maingate North met our requirements. Room was clean, beds were ok. Rollaway was an extra $10/night, which was steep in our opinion. (As a Wyndham Rewards member, I would expect those types of things to be included at no charge.) Breakfast was provided, but didn't include many options. Regular (caffeinated) coffee was not available one morning, and upon asking about it, we were told we were mistaken- the Regular was in the Decaf pot. No attempt was made to fix the situation, and indeed, it was Decaf in the Decaf pot. The ceiling light in our bathroom kept shorting out-- we stood on the toilet and adjusted the fixture ourselves rather than calling the front desk (at 6am). Not sure we'd stay here

reserved a room 3 weeks ago traveled over 400 miles I called twice to confirm on the day we got there at 1am to find the hotel had over booked and had no space for us. We were advised to look for a new place -SERIOUSLY RUINED OUR SMALL VACATION AND MANAGEMENT IS A JOKE !!! Trying to charge us  SERIOUSLY DO NOT BOOK WITH THIS HOTEL

The room was clean and the bed was comfy. The free breakfast was good enough my hubby didn't like the lack of protein but my son and I liked the donuts. The room was small but considering the price we didn't mind. We thought there was a free shuttle to Disneyland but it was 5 bucks but Disneyland was about a mile or so away so not a bad walk. All in all we would stay here again.

Summary Heading: The water in the sink was dirty and you could not even see...
Summary: The water in the sink was dirty and you could not even see through it.  My family stayed at the other maingate at the park location and they had the same issue.  It had a weird chemical smell as well.  I told two staff members and the response was pretty lame.  The shower water was clear and I had to use that for coffee.  I didn't even brush my teeth with it.  I accidentally washed my face using the sink when I first arrived and the water made my eyes burn and water until I flushed them with sterile eye drops.  I am not a tap water snob but this was ridiculous.

The room had 2 Queen beds (beats a king and sofa anytime). It was clean with nice amenities (refrigerator and microwave). The shower flow was good (compared to some places with really low-flow shower heads). The continental breakfast was more than adequate. We enjoyed hot waffles, yogurt, and orange juice each day.  The guy who checked us in allowed us to check in a bit early (applause), but he forgot to tell us that the ART bus passes are cheaper if you buy them multi-day. Michelle, who is mentioned in other positive reviews, was very friendly and helpful. She mentioned the multi-day passes. Too bad we met her on the last day.  The self-service laundry was conveniently located, and there were large trash containers outside for things too bulky or messy for the in-room trash

Summary Heading: This location as much better than I had expected it would...
Summary: This location as much better than I had expected it would be for the price that I paid. The location was close to Disneyland and the public transportation worked just fine. The room was very clean and the bed comfortable. The only drawback was we had to keep reconnecting to the internet and food within walking distance was not much available. If we had brought our own car it would have been no problem. All in all I would recommend this location to anyone.

The room looked decent it was clean, modern and had a lot of room. But we only had one towel in the room. I went down to the front desk and got some they were all different shapes and shades of white but they smelt clean. I read a review of someone saying the place had cockroaches we did not see any in the room but as we parked the car there was one in the parking lot about six feet from a rooms door.

Summary Heading: Within walking distance to the parks
Summary: The hotel is acceptable and the cleaning staff is very nice. Had problems with the key card reader on our room, as did my sister.  Either an internal clock issue or a programming issue but at 11:00 a.m. , which is checkout time, the room cards stopped working. This happened 4 times during our stay. Breakfast consisted of mostly carbs - donuts, mini-danish, toast, waffles, apples, yogurt, juice, coffee, and tea. Would have liked to see some protein, even just some hardboiled eggs. Can see park fireworks from some rooms, and hear them from all rooms - it was startling the first night. Walking to the park takes as long as driving to the parking structure, or less time if you get routed to the Woody lots farther down Harbor. Unfortunately our room was below a thundering herd of

Michelle and the staff have been helpful as always during our stay. Rooms are kept clean. Somewhat close to Disneyland if you want to walk. This was my 3rd stay in two years. So far so good! My only gripes are, I hope they have more warm food selections for breakfast other than waffles,toast, and English muffins. Their Wifi is slow. Other than that, it's reasonably priced for the rooms. Looking forward to next time.

We arrived at Ramada Anaheim Maingate North and were greated by the lovliest lady on reception called Michelle. She instantly made us feel welcome and was super friendly and helpful. We were allocated a disabled room but this was fine - the only difference was that the bathroom was more of a wetroom. The room was comfortable and clean. We used the laundry facilities there too which were very reasonably priced - the rails in the disabled room came in very handy for drying our clothes!! The inclusive free breakfast was nice too with plenty of choice and variety.  We used the local bus service rather than the Disney bus - the bus stop was only a few yards from the entrance of the hotel. Would definitely recommend this hotel as a cheap and very cheerful base while visiting

Summary Heading: We found ants crawling  around the vanity area near the...
Summary: We found ants crawling  around the vanity area near the faucet. They were all over our toothbrushes. I put a complaint in and was given a 10% discount on one day of our two day stay. I felt the discount  should've been for both days of our stay.

We tried to give this hotel the benefit of the doubt but... 1. I am an avid walker and the distance to Disney maingate was way too far to walk after a day at the park. 2. The linens were in terrible condition. The sheets and towels were thin and a lovely shade of grey. 3. Cockroachs in the room. 4. Nothing but fast food dining options in the surrounding area.  On the positive side the staff were lovely and the shuttle for $5 all day had a stop just outside the hotel  property.
Would stay again, room was clean, bathroom was very clean. If just looking for somewhere to crash this is a good spot.

Summary Heading: An ok stay, but don't be fooled, it's not at the "maingate"
Summary: We, like many, accidentally booked this hotel thinking it was the ramada across the street from the entrance to Disneyland. In fact,we knew there was two that often are confused and still booked the wrong one. Our bad,  but they really shouldn't have the same name. So, despite our initial disappointment, the hotel was fine.  The room was clean and beds were firm but comfortable. The staff was kind and accomidating.  The area however is a little scetchy with a closed restaurant in the parking lot and a liquor store next door. One day (in the middle of the day) there was a homeless looking man passed out on the grass out front.  (Welcome to Disneyland kids! ) It really is a hike to Disneyland but the ART bus stop is right out front.  That said, with the money spent on bus passes

Summary Heading: Staff and manager not customer focused
Summary: Had a work emergency come up and I had to leave my stay 1 day early. staff and manager were Unwilling to make some sort of arrangement (refund, credit for another night, anything) was told I could leave early but I would still be charged for the room and there was nothing they could do. Spoke to manager over the phone and got same answer. They had my money and were in no hurry to make any kind of exception or arrangement. Not good customer service in my opinion

Although we reserved a 2 bed room for our the three of us, we were checked into a king size one bed room. The staff informed me that this was the room requested, however that was not what our reservation online showed.  Even still the staff was friendly and we were happy to have a two night stay with them.

This place seems to get a lot of 1 and 2 star reviews, it really isn't that bad.   They have a small pool, and new breakfast room.  The rooms are clean, and I have stayed here multiple times.  You can walk to Disneyland, but it is a long walk. There is a shuttle across the street that charges $5.00/adult and $2 per child that goes straight to the park.

We stayed as a family for three nights in order to be close to Disney. We were really impressed in particular with the friendly staff (all of them), and also the quiet room. We were at the back on the second floor. Loved the view of the fireworks, and were amazed to see that there were several young children in the rooms near us, including next door. Hadn't heard a peep until they appeared for the fireworks! Breakfast was very crowded during the rush to get to Disney but otherwise was quiet. Food was stocked up frequently right to the end of the breakfast window. Would like to see more sturdy plastic cutlery - the waffles were a challenge with forks that bend! Overall good value. Most important to us is that our room was really really clean. Bed was also very comfortable.
Location was good, Rooms were clean, Staff was friendly.  We were able to see the fireworks from outside our room.  We plan to stay there again.

Summary Heading: The beds were very uncomfortable and hard. The hotel is on...
Summary: The beds were very uncomfortable and hard. The hotel is on the other side of the freeway off-ramp from Disneyland and not very safe to cross with young children.

Summary Heading: Good hotel, ART is close for getting to Disney. Breakfast...
Summary: Good hotel, ART is close for getting to Disney. Breakfast could be improved with protein options.

My family and I stayed at the Ramada Inn Maingate North for over a week in August 2015.  We were initially put into a bottom floor room in the rear of the hotel.  At first, we liked the room assignment because we thought it offered a good deal of privacy.  As it turned out, the area was heavily used by the cleaning staff to take their breaks all during the day and therefore provided very little privacy.  We found ourselves having to keep the curtains closed just to avoid having the staff staring in at us as they sat tables outside our room.  They also used the area as their smoking break area.  Worst of all, though, was the filthy condition of the carpet.  I had a nice pair of leather sandals completely ruined by the black filth that came off the carpets onto my feet and was
Good hotel away from disneyland bug still close enough to take less then 10 min to get to the park and with an Anaheim resort transportation pick up right in front of the hotel. Makes it even nicer

First I do not think that they should call the Hotel Ramada Maingate North, it should be Ramada North period! I booked that hotel by mistake and the front desk told me it happens all the time. It is confusing ! The hotel is not in the best location with lots of sketchy people around it. One morning a homeless person came in to the kitchen area served himself to  several apples, yogurts and put his dirty hands and grabbed several donuts... Every was shocked by fear  to say anything to him The rooms appear to be newly renovated and were fairly clean. The towels are horrible ( used to be white) now very grey and look like the belong at the Frontier Hotel next door.

Everyone of the staff members I came in contact with were sincere starting with Sam on Graveyard. My two young daughters and I stayed in room 219. The room was very clean and up to date. There was no grime on the baseboards or stains on the carpet or furniture. Our room was also much larger than many queen rooms with 2 beds than I have seen all summer in our travels. The bed was comfortable and there were both flat and fluffy pillows on each bed. There were numerous outlets to plug in our many electronic devices. We did not get the chance to use the pool but it looked well kept. The breakfast was good and included doughnuts, pastries, breads, cereals, oatmeal, fruit, waffles, and yogurt. I was disappointed there wasn't any peanut butter. The staff let me leave my car there after

Not at all representative of most Ramada Inns.  Deadbolt didn't work.  Blackout curtains couldn't close all the whole way. Toilet seat extremely loose.  No channel listing for Anaheim  area TV.  Telephone message light blinking every day although no messages so had to call front desk once or twice a day for the front desk to turn it off.  Breakfast area half the size it should have been to accommodate the guests.  Worst part was that staff were informed immediately and daily thereafter of problems and at checkout seven (7) days later none of the problems had been addressed.  The building was clearly some old motel in which Ramada had poorly renovated the rooms with unsatisfactory workmanship.
My credit card was charged for room deposit when I paid cash for room deposit til check out.still waiting on my credit.

This place is very accomadating from checkin to checkout. Laura was the young Lady that checked us in, she was courteous and efficient. Laura pays very good attention to detail as she  made sure we had a room in the front this time. I Cant speak on breakfast because i didn't indulge however, the room was comparable to some of the more expensive hotels. The room was fresh and had a nice not to overwhelming smell, bed and linen appeared to be new and is comfortable. This Ramada is definitely one of the better properties. I will definitely stay again, the valiente for your money mixed with great service is everything very great staff. Before i forget crystal is a delight and asset to This company, she is wonderful.

The hotel was clean and the beds were very comfortable!!  We could not get them to stop giving us new towels even though we hung them as the instructions read.  The staff was friendly.  The breakfast was standard continental.

My 10 year old daughter and I stayed for 4 nights for our Southern California Adventure.  Hotel is clean and quiet the rooms are modern with nice linen, flat screen TV.  There is a simple out door pool that is clean and well kept nice to jump in after hot day of touring around.  The continental breakfast is great, toast, doughnuts, danish, yogurt, apples, make your own waffles, orange juice, apple juice, coffee & tea.  Good view of the nightly Disnelyland fireworks.  We rode the ART transport to get around the disney area.  It's a bit of a walk from disney to the hotel especially after you spend the day walking around the Disney parks.  Two staff members from the hotel went above and beyond with thier customer service and genuine kindness.  Thank you Jasmine & Michelle .. Ramada

Summary Heading: Stayed here twice in two weeks
Summary: Prices on hot wire where cheap. $59 for a family of three. Hotel was easy to get to. If you come back early you can see the fireworks from the parking lot. The free breakfast selection is a little smaller than you would expect. Rooms were clean, beds were ok too. Air conditioner worked really well. Plenty of parking.

Summary Heading: we stayed 4 days from 13thsep to sep 17 , as we checkd iut...
Summary: we stayed 4 days from 13thsep to sep 17 , as we checkd iut i forgot my ipad in room 247 ,i cald back they didnt gave me

We really enjoyed staying here at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North!! Not only was it very clean and quiet but the staff was very anxious to please. It was really convenient to catch the shuttle to Disneyland so close to the hotel (just 2 doors away). We also enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone and would stay there again if I was going to Disneyland!!

We only stayed here one night but from what I could tell it was awesome. The room was really clean and spacious. The beds were fairly comfy the only thing about the beds was that on one of them the sheets were a little rough, but that was about it. other then that and a little bit of noise from the people next door every thing was good

Summary Heading: You get what you pay for
Summary: Towels were dingy and tattered, no coffee left in room 4 out of 5 days, no wash cloths left one day, room was dusty, toilet handle was broken.  I booked this hotel in error, I wanted to stay directly across from Disneyland at the Ramada Maingate at the Park, this is the Ramada Maingate North about a mile from Disneyland.

We loved it, got an early check in. Clean, nice employees, nice breakfast. The bonus was that our parking was included so we parked early and went to Disneylanf. The shuttle dropped us off right in front of our hotel. We also got to see the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot. It was the best view for fireworks. The reason I gave a 4 star is because there were some random people wondering in the parking lot. They seemed a little weary. But other than that it was a great place to stay. I will definately stay at Ramada again.

The Hotel was good enough.  It was Pet Friendly, at the time we were there they were having a BIG Mexican wedding, so parking was crowded, a lot of noise, next morning half empty beer cans, bottles all over the parking lot.  The room and hallways smelled of smoke.  Okay in a pinch.

Summary Heading: ok except for two bugs in bathroom
Summary: There were two bugs we found on our first night but none after that. Have a 3 rating on the "service" section because of the lady in the office in the afternoon/evening. She wasn't really friendly but everyone else, ie the guy in there and housekeepers, WERE AWESOME! especially the housekeepers. The ladies were VERY Helpful and friendly.

We arrived to the hotel, it was quiet, but that works for me. Went to the main lobby to check in and the front desk lady was very friendly and helpful. The free breakfast was nice, they had waffles and donuts and other breakfast basics but the waffles and donuts did it for me. The pool was small but didn't seem to be a big deal, it did the job. The beds were comfy but a little too much on the floral closing bleach used. No skin reaction just strong smell. I will say if you get a back rppm do not go to sleep until after Disney's firework show at 9:30, it sounds like they are set off right outside your door.

I got this hotel as a Hotwire deal-which put my price at half what I would have paid at my usual hotel near Disneyland (and about 30% less than the motel's own website). I go to Disney every year, and usually stay at one of the places on Harbor across the street-but this trip was quick, just one night. The place is renovated; my room was clean and the bathroom shower surround was nice. The free breakfast (waffle, yogurt, apple, cereal, pastries and toast) was a nice added value. The AC seemed to get less efficient around 3am, but still cooled the room.  My room was in the back building, so no road noise-but I did hear loud guests outside in the parking lot. Michele was very friendly and helpful at the front desk. The only real drawback is the distance from the parks-if you want

Fine for one night, comfortable, clean and quiet with friendly, helpful staff. Didn´t have a car and there weren´t many restaurants close by. Could see the Disneyland fireworks from the room. Breakfast was basic, but the best alternative due to the  location.

We stayed over Labor Day weekend (Sept 4-7).  The room was a good size with 2 queen beds, desk, microwave, small refrigerator, coffee make and A/C.  They proved small shampoo, conditioner and lotion (but we had to ask for them to provide more after the first day).  The shower had good water pressure.  The towels were a little older, but clean.  I had to ask them for more Kleenex the first night and was told there were out, but the next morning I had a box after she cleaned the room.  The beds are comfy, more on the firm side and the pillow are flat.   The desk tells you it’s a 5 minute walk to Disneyland.  Only if you are in tip-top shape is it a 5 minute walk.  A normal person walk is about 15-20 minutes.  They have a bus (ART) that comes every 30 minutes for $3 one way, $5 all

This was our third stay at this hotel.. Michelle is always very welcoming and helpful. We stay here one cause it's close to Disneyland (less than 2 blocks) and two it is affordable. It's comfortable and i have had no issues so it will continue to be my go to hotel.

I celebrated my birthday at Disneyland and decided to stay at Ramada for a good night rest after a long day of adventure. The room was AWESOME! The bed was comfortable & water pressure for the shower was perfect. The front desk was super friendly and very helpful. The person in charge for breakfast made sure it was fully stocked. I will definitely be coming back soon. I wanted to say thank you to the Ramada staff for a remarkable stay.

We had a great stay in this hotel in Anaheim.  Our air conditioning was not working the second morning, but this was dealt with very quickly and professionally.  Walking to Disneyland is easy from this property.

Best Hotel I've stayed at on a budget. We have Annual passes and go over once a month. The rooms were clean, beds great, fridge in room, pool and a wonderful breakfast. Disney is .8 of a mile away walking.

Another wonderful time spent here. Michelle.....you are awesome, up beat and made us feel welcomed. Only down side is the free breakfast area. It gets very crowded and maybe you could throw in some other fruit like oranges and bananas for those who are not apple people.

Summary Heading: Overall, the experience is okay.  However, the towels need...
Summary: Overall, the experience is okay.  However, the towels need refurbishing.  Though clean, they look dirty because of its color.  They are almost yellow in color and really feels old.  I like my towels sparking clean.

Summary Heading: Floors were a little dirty in room, but besides that it was...
Summary: Floors were a little dirty in room, but besides that it was very clean. Very friendly staff and great location for Disneyland. There was also a large dumpster close to our room with garbage all over. Would have been nice to have stayed in a cleaner area.

The room was perfect for what we needed it for! A good nights rest!! It was a perfect distance from disneyland. The parking was a bit full during our return to the hotel around midnight but managed to get a spot. Overall my stay was great. I will stay there again.

Ramada was alright. It's nothing spectacular, but it has amenities we were looking for. Lots of parking space, swimming pool (didn't use), fridge and microwave in the room (nice). We got a room overlooking the Disneyland so around 9:30PM, we got a very good view of the fireworks from the room. Breakfast could be improved. Menu was sparse and not much of diversity from one day to another. Room was clean and beds were comfortable.

Summary Heading: Hi this is diana , everything was great  and thank so much...
Summary: Hi this is diana , everything was great  and thank so much for all u good services. But please you need to change the clock in room number 147 is a bit noise all the night. Lol that why  I turn off. Thanks so much again.

Summary Heading: Great staff, good room and paper thin walls
Summary: I was pleased with the front desk staff and how helpful they were. The property was well kept and the room was clean. The only problem I encountered was the paper thin walls. I could hear every conversation from the people in the adjoining rooms. Even when they were whispering. As a hotel right next to Disneyland, people are coming and going at early and late hours. I was not appreciative of the surrounding noise.

we stayed at the Ramada as we had a 2 day pass to Disneyland. The room was comfortable with a fridge coffee making. The staff were polite and friendly and Michelle was very helpful. The office sell an all day shuttle bus ticket for 5 dollars that you catch just down the road and it will take you straight to Disneyland front gate, the last trip is around midnight. The free breakfast was all you could expect, you hade coffee, juice, cereal, toast, fruit, waffles and pasteries.

Ramada Maingate North is a motel across the freeway, on the edge of the Disney area. The Carrows restaurant is closed, so the parking was free and abundant. But every night there would be a new set of transients sleeping on the lawn in front of the Carrows, and it made you feel sad for them, after spending a day at Disneyland. If you take your car to Disneyland, no worries I guess, but if you take the ART then you will need to walk by. The staff was great. We requested an upstairs room, in the back.  Our room was freshly renovated and clean. The air conditioner smelled moldy, so I clipped our car air freshener on it, and that helped. Never ate breakfast there because we took the ART early for Disneyland. I would probably stay again, but the kids definitely did not want to come

Summary Heading: Not Even Close to WorldMark Living
Summary: Housekeeping knocked on the door at 8:40 a.m. And opened the door even after my husband yelled "we are still sleeping" because we arrived at 4:00 a.m.  You can hear all conversations going on outside. The AC is very loud and in need of an update. The room was clean and the front desk staff were very nice.

Summary Heading: The breakfast was very poor and the front desk clerks were...
Summary: The breakfast was very poor and the front desk clerks were not very cooperative and friendly.    Good location to freeway and bus stops.

Summary Heading: The location of this hotel is perfect!  Simply a few minute...
Summary: The location of this hotel is perfect!  Simply a few minute walk to the parks makes the stay so worth it!

Summary Heading: This was a very clean hotel, walking distance to the park...
Summary: This was a very clean hotel, walking distance to the park. They provide complimentary breakfast which has a good selection of food selection, coffee, and juice. Would be a plus the If there were eggs though. The only complaint was the maid just barge in without announcing themselves which is very rude. They need to keep track of when people are checked in rooms and do not use keys for freely after check in hours. Also the room was so hot when I first checked in it was uncomfortable, I would suggest turning on the air prior to check ins to make the room comfortable for the guests.

I checked into Ramada Limited on a very hot day. I expected to kick back in a nice air conditioned room but the air conditioner barely worked. It was a corner back room and it was hot and stuffy. So my family went to the pool to try and cool down but the kids in there were being way to rowdy. So it wasnt the best of times as we expected. Also when we checked out the next morning the guy who checked the room (cause I left a cash deposit) he tried to say we smoked. We did not! So I had to argue to get my cash refund

Summary Heading: Room was missing mini-fridge and microwave.   Towels were...
Summary: Room was missing mini-fridge and microwave.   Towels were dingy.  Overall not a bad place to stay, close to Disneyland, could see fireworks from outside our room.  Breakfast choices not great but acceptable.  AC worked great, room was clean and slept well.

We loved our room it had everything we needed and the front desk was very helpful and pleasant .They gave us info about the shuttle service. It is walking distance to Disneyland and we walked one of the days. Took the shuttle the others. Continental Breakfast was nice. Rooms clean and updated. Cleaned promptly every day. Only thing I can think of negative is it has a small pool with a view of telephone wires. But we would definitely recommend this hotel.

Location close to Disney, freeway, restaurants. Lobby fresh and new, rooms clean, newly remodeled, staff at check in and check out fantastic and helpful. Did not use breakfast, but poked my head in to look. The only thing needing attention were the towels. Old and worn, and not the softest. Other then that, would still look forward to a return trip!
Clean but ac didn't work well but was fixed.  Towels were not soft. It was quiet considering how close to freeway

You could read what you want from other reviews but you'd be missing a great place to stay. The room was newly finished. The grounds were well kept. The office staff were very pleasant and helpful. The breakfast was mostly carbs but a fresh made waffle is better than a freezer waffle any day. The ART bus to Disneyland was right there and we were there in less than 10 minutes. This is the place every time to Anaheim.
Comfortable stay clean hotel the area is not bad at all continental breakfast was decent and staff were friendly!!

This hotel is a short walking distance to Disney so I think the location is good and the rooms are good-sized.  Breakfast included though very simple, so that's a plus.  No drinking water in breakfast room though.  I was just disappointed with the rate I was given, was told the rate was inclusive of tax but when actually charged, was asked to pay tax and other mysterious charges.  I didn't question anymore but I should have.

The most memorable part of this stay was perhaps the housekeeping! They did an excellent job, the room was spotless.  On the other hand, professional etiquette & breakfast was a disappointment. Of the numerous nights I stayed, not once did I get a single smile. On a side not, the amount of time the front desk staff takes is very lengthy. The one lady working on the front desk during the evening shifts never smiled, and made it seem I was causing her an inconvenience when asking her a question.  Stayed at Ramada's prior, the main reason for choosing this hotel was breakfast. Under the assumption there would be a variety, breakfast at this location is LACKING! Breakfast includes: cereal, coffee, waffles, yogurt, toast, and DONUTS. Yes, sugary donuts!  The rooms are way too

Summary Heading: We stayed at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North during a...
Summary: We stayed at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North during a recent trip to California in which my husband experienced a medical emergency and was hospitalized for an extended period.  We were able to book a room in the summer with little prior notification.  The room was clean and laid out nicely.  The beds were comfortable.  The staff was pleasant and helped out when we needed information.  Breakfast was available, but did not have the hot choices we had seen at previous hotels.  Overall, I would stay in this hotel again and would recommend it to my friends that don't want to spend a fortune to stay close to Disneyland.

Pretty good hotel, looks like remodeled recently. Not so great neighborhood. Front desk could be more friendlier. Small breakfast area gets crowded always, adding eggs and oatmeal would make breakfast better. Excellent view of fireworks right from the hotel parking, can't beat that :-) Could be little cheaper. Overall, a nice stay.

Summary Heading: A Little Professionalism and Attention to Detail Would Help
Summary: I had to take my copy of my reservation down to the manager to prove that I was there for two days.  When I returned from my outing in the afternoon of my first day, the maid was in my room on the phone with the front desk.  She handed me the phone, and it was the property manager who had me checking out that day.  When I checked in the day before with Richard, I showed my reservation and promptly paid. (There certainly is no lag time in asking for the credit card).  Their record keeping is shoddy, and the manager asked me to come down with my copy of the reservation to show her.  Really? So, I was not very happy.  Additionally, the repartee of the PM desk clerk Michelle) is excessive and earthy.  She is too chatty especially when there is a line.  The breakfast is "not behind

The staff were friendly and very helpful. The free breakfast is not bad considering the room rates. The linen and towels and especially the pillows are pretty old and in need of replacement. The Manager Nimisha is really very nice and went out of the way to help us with a late check out.

Summary Heading: Did not maintain basic Ramada standards
Summary: The hotel is not very well kept. In one of the rooms (room no. 130), the door would open just by a push even without a key. The towels for example were very old and seemed dirty. The breakfast was extremely basic.

Although this hotel is dated on the outside, it looks amazing on the inside. Our room was renovated, clean and comfortable.  The lady who checked us in (Michele) was very accommodating and friendly.  The lobby and breakfast room were immaculate. There is a small pool which we used once.  The ART bus which shuttles to Disney, is close by.  The shuttle also stops further away from Disney so it allows access to a grocery store and other restaurants that are away from Disney. The price for our room was extremely competitive compared to other hotels around Disney.

Summary Heading: More of a motel than a hotel.  Best feature is proximity to...
Summary: More of a motel than a hotel.  Best feature is proximity to Disneyland.  About .75 miles (a 20 minute walk).  Walls are thin.  When neighboring rooms turn on water it is very loud.

We stayed at the Ramada last weekend during Disneyland's 60th Anniversary.  Given that we don't spend much time in the hotel it was a good option since all hotels seemed to be booked that weekend.  The pro's were that the room was clean and had a refrigerator.  The staff was very friendly and we were able to check in at 2:00.  The con's were that it was not really walking distance to Disneyland, and the motel was noisy.  The noise might be the nature of a motel (we usually stay at the Wyndham in Garden Grove) I though it would be a close walk, but given that it was July and you have to walk over the I-5 overpass we took a cab.  The cab is about $7 each way.  You can take the shuttle that picks up at the light for $5/person per day.  We decided the cab was better since we would

The room was clean and comfortable - location, parking, facility in general were all fine.  Issues I had were:  The Wifi was really unreliable and performed poorly.  It would make me re-login multiple times and would sometimes not work at all.  I ended up having to use my phone hotspot to work.  I had no towels in my room when I arrived.  I called about it.  The next day I got back to the hotel after my room had been cleaned - still no towels.  I called again and the next day there were towels.

We had a great 2 day stay at the hotel.  The rooms were comfortable and had a view of the fireworks.  The staff were very helpful and you can jump on the ART buses to Disney next to the hotel.  The breakfast is a little lacking but overall a good hotel.

We stayed for 3 nights to see LA and of course to visit Disneyland.  This hotel is conveniently located near the highway to get to other locations in LA.    The hotel is probably about a mile from Disney.  It would be easy to walk.  Instead we took the ART shuttle that they have passes for sale at the front desk.  That was so easy to get to and from the park.    You can see the fireworks for Disney from some of the balconies, parking lot and pool.  The breakfast is typical for hotel breakfast.  The exception to this is their donuts.  Fresh, cake donuts that were excellent!!!    The rooms were comfortable.  Nicely decorated.  We were happy to have two pillows each.

Would not stay here again. Had to practically beg for towels; they won't give me a receipt (said I had to get it through Expedia); extremely poor breakfast.  There are no elevators so make sure you only have a small hand luggage to take up the stairs.  Parking was a nightmare--no spots available after 8 pm. Internet signal was OK but don't expect 'fast'.

We had a good stay at the Ramada but wondered why it was called "Maingate North".  There is an actual Ramada maingate under renovation but this one is on the other side of the freeway from Disneyland and not maingate at all.  The room was clean and the staff were friendly so no complaints!
Nothing too fancy but all we did was sleep there and take a mid-day break from Disney.  Clean and recently remodeled.  Only bummer is the breakfast is weak - all carbs except for yogurt.
A very good option for a Disneyland area vacation. The rooms were recently renovated and the beds were extremely comfortable.

Summary Heading: staff was the only reason I didn't give it one star.
Summary: No elevator. Name of hotel gave the impression close to Disneyland. Had to pay for shuttle. Two Ramadas with very similar names. Honestly I thought I had booked at the other which is walking distant to Disneyland. The laundry was room had buzzards sounds that woke me up.

We just got back from a trip to Disneyland. Our 3 day stay at this Ramada location was great. The hotel grounds and the pool were nice and clean. The breakfast was pretty basic, but it worked for us. The drive to the disney parking lots was very quick. Our room was very clean and everything looked well taken care of. The bed was comfortable, the air conditioning worked great, and the room had a nice TV, small fridge, microwave, iron/ironing board, and a desk. The furniture was all clean and the bathroom and sink area all looked nice and new. Overall, this place was great, had a good price, and worked well for our trip to Disneyland.

Clean room, good price. The room and being close to Disneyland was a big 👍🏼 thumbs up. Close to Disneyland but not walking distance if you consider how much walking you do at Disneyland and being exhausted to walk 1 mile back after. We just drove the quick 2 minute drive to the them park parking and took the free shuttle from car to park and back. Or you can pay for a all day shuttle ticket from the ART. I would recommend this place definitely for an affordable stay to go to Disneyland. We paid about 40-100 dollar less a day then staying across the street from Disneyland. The only complaint I have would be the complimentary breakfast didn't impress me. Not enough variety seemed like all starch breakfast. Maybe some eggs and fruit would have made me happy. I ended up going to

Summary Heading: Very nice room & close to Disneyland
Summary: The room was very clean and well kept. The bed and pillows were very comfortable. And only half a mile from Disneyland! My only complaint was the breakfast buffet didn't have any protein on it like sausages or bacon, it was all carbs.

Overall nice place for the price. Room was nicely clean and bed was comfortable. It had a refrigerator and microwave. Within walking distance of Disneyland, grocery store, and Resturaunts. Staff was very nice and helpful. The continental breakfast was ok if you are not diabetic.:(. Overall it was a very good.

Summary Heading: Accommodating for our group, and good service!
Summary: Our group of nearly 60 plus people stayed at this hotel during an event we had in Fullerton. We've stayed at this place the year prior. They have been more than accommodating and patient with us since we were a pretty rowdy bunch. Haha! We had the rooms that had two queen beds, a fridge (upon request) microwave, wifi, and pretty good hanging and drawer space. Beds were comfy and the rooms are overall pretty clean. Michelle at the front desk, was really kind and helped us out a lot. The room service staff was fairly friendly. Being that unfortunately the Carrow's that was close by was recently closed, it fortunately gave more parking spaces. So, that was a plus for us. Breakfast is pretty standard, and you can make your own waffles. They also have a few vending and an ice machine

Arrived  at 3:05 pm, reservations  stated check in was at 3pm. Had to wait 15 min. because room wasn't ready. 2 other guest received room before I did, even though I was first person to arrive. Once in the room, no shower curtain, luckily housekeeping  was passing by and I asked for shower curtain. Just disappointed

My Mother In Law and I stayed here for 2 nights.  We paid a bit more for a remodeled room.  It was nice enough...two queen beds, fridge, microwave. Pros....very easy walk to the parks, clean, friendly staff, free breakfast. Cons.....difficult to find a parking spot, door on room had to be forcefully slammed to shut properly, very limited breakfast options, kind of noisy.   I would probably try a different place next time.  It was just fine, but not fabulous.
While a good deal there's no fridge or microwave in room. No shuttle to Disneyland and just out of comfortable walking distance. It was clean and the staff was nice.
Remodeled rooms. Close to attractions. Microwave & mini fridge in room. Less than desirable breakfast. I suggest you take your own breakfast.

Good price; nice bedrooms everything worked, everything clean. Only thing is that breakfast wasn't tasted bad ,really bad i didn't even drink the apple juice . Had to take breakfast somewhere else the whole week i stayed.

the staff was incredible...sooo friendly & helpful...our 1st night we were startled by the fireworks...our last night there we finally got to enjoy them...only thing I would request is a better selection at breakfast...but the last day I did get a chocolate donut that I had been wishing I had arrived earlier LOL

Summary Heading: The toilet flush is very weak. Breakfast - need to have...
Summary: The toilet flush is very weak. Breakfast - need to have scramble eggs, potato or hot meal. Coffee pot is dirty.

Overall this hotel was very nice.  Beds were comfortable, pool was clean, and staff was pleasant.  Had a couple of issues only 2 of our 4 rooms were ready when we checked in after 3pm and a/c units were not on which made the rooms extremely hot and humid.  Took the entire evening to cool down.

We chose this hotel for its location close to Disneyland and the price. Upon arrival we were not disappointed. Checkin was smooth and friendly.  The rooms were spacious and clean with Wifi and ample choice of TV channels.  Breakfast was standard hotel fare with cereals, waffles, yoghurt, and bagels. There are some simple (fastfood) restaurants closeby..  I would not recommend walking to Disneyland from the hotel, but ART Shuttle stops right down the road (50m) and tickets are sold at the hotel's reception. Very convenient.
Comfortable bed, clean room, coffee machine in room, friendly staff, coin operated laundry and easy walking distance to Disneyland & restaurants

We had originally stayed at this hotel 3 years ago. It was our first Disney trip as a married couple for our 2 year anniversary. Needless to say, we were very unimpressed as we did not stay again for 3 years.   But then the hotel was touted as improved and under new management, we decided to give it another go. The pictures online made it look so much better that it was before. And it was better, cleaner and updated, but that was about it.  When we first arrived they were doing asphalt work in the parking lot, so a ridiculous number of parking spaces were unusable. So for a hotel that is sold out, there was zero available parking. When we asked the lobby attendant where to park, he said to just move some of the barricades out of the way and park on the fresh asphalt. Sorry, but

Much better hotels in the same area for the  same price.  There are two hotels in the same area with the same name.  Both under construction this on in a run down condition.  After a very late night at Disneyland with two children we were awakened to a loud echoing jackhammer into our room at 8:45.  Made for a miserably long day.  Pool was a standard rectangle with no jacuzzi.  Nothing exciting like the other comparable pools in the area.  Free breakfact is simply contenental with loud contruction in the way.   Rooms were clean.

Summary Heading: A 1950s Roadside Motel offered at 3-Star Prices
Summary: Needing accommodations for 3-5 people on short notice in the Disney-Anaheim area (not for pleasure but a family crisis) my Mother attempted to get us a 2 bedroom suite at the Wyndham (since she is an owner) since we had been unsuccessful through our exchange connections.  Wyndham offered her what was described as a 3-4 Star 2 Bedroom suite with a pull out sofa that could sleep 6 for 6 nights at $1200 for the stay.  When my wfie arrived at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North she found that the buildings looked like they had been in a time capsule from a 950s roadside motel.  Additionally, the entire parking lot was under reconstruction, with few available parking places, lots of loose tar and asphalt all over and construction materials and machines all over the lot - not a very

The hotel rooms are good and close to Disney but they were working on the parking lot and the ramp for the handicap could not be used which cause a problem for us since we had a scooter we had to use to get around.

We stayed 4 nights. Room was recently remodeled, clean, comfortable bed. Could see the Disneyland fireworks right out my window and the ART bus stop was right at the corner less than a block away. We bought passes at the front desk it runs every 20 mins to Disneyland. 3 day passes were $12 each. Cons: loud noises in the morning due to remodeling/construction in parking lot. Liquor store next door had a few questionable people outside. Overall cheap room and convenient location. We booked on Hotwire at about $63 a night. Also breakfast was good donuts, cereal, waffles, yougurt, pastries

Do not stay at this hotel until construction is finished!  We were not told that the hotel was under major construction!  The parking lot was torn up and there was heavy machinery parked in the "lot."  We actually had to park on dirt.  Very rough pavement and tons of holes!  The main lobby was not open for check-in (at 3 p.m.!)--had to interact with the person through a security window.  The room itself was clean but having to navigate around construction was not fun!  There was a free breakfast (waffles, rolls, cereal, etc.) but was offered in a very small room.  It was packed and was not monitored by hotel staff.  A touring group was also staying at the hotel and were filling up drink bottles and carafes with coffee, milk and juice.  Needless to say, there was no coffee left

Management has drained every nickel of value they can from this motel: from the under-heated pool (with no spa) and pool towels barely larger than a hand towel to the continental breakfast that consists mostly of cheap donuts and cold cereal (no eggs, bacon, etc.). The rooms are clean and comfortable if unremarkable but for the three towels to accommodate up to 4 guests. This motel is so unattractive and uninviting that we drove by it twice before we realized this was our destination.   Its proximity to Disneyland is deceptively close. You may be tempted not to walk to the park, thinking it is farther away than it is. You might opt to drive to Disneyland anyway, but we discovered that it is faster to walk than to drive...which is still unfortunate, because it is a rather long
We had a great time. It was great. Breakfast was amazing. The service was great, and the maids were very pleasant.

This property is in very poor condition the parking lot is a mess. Transient visitors were a long side families grabbing breakfast. The desk agent was pleasant until once I seen my room did not have proper accommodations for my entire family then offered no suggestions I figured it out for myself and he seemed annoyed that he was going to have to deliver a roll away to my room. The breakfast selection was all unhealthy. I didn't eat anything.

Summary Heading: Nice Hotel but parking is awful while they are under construction!
Summary: Nice room. Nice staff. Great breakfast. However, the hotel is under construction so there are numerous parking spaces that cannot be utilized. During my stay the hotel seemed to be at capacity leaving some folks with no place to park. I was out late one night and had to sit in my car waiting nearly an hour for someone to leave so I could park and go to bed. I had to go to the bathroom too and had no where to go as the office was closed. Very bad situation!

About the only good thing I can say is that the room was clean. Breakfast was pretty meh and overcrowded. The parking lot was torn up on a Friday to replace some concrete thereby losing half the parking in the parking lot the staff didn't really seem to care about it and there was no hot water in our room in the evening. We will not be staying here again. Extremely mismanaged

Summary Heading: The hotel was better than I expected.  Great location and...
Summary: The hotel was better than I expected.  Great location and value. Rooms were recently remodeled and  I had a great view of the Disneyland fireworks.  I'm not sure of the view for the Anaheim Angels fireworks because they didn't win that night.

We usually stay in hotels right across from the pedestrian entrance to Disneyland on Harbor. This trip coincided with Disneyland's 60th anniversary, and all our usual hotels were priced in the $200/night range. I decided to try a hotel further out to save money. I'm very glad I did. This was a great value. Recently refurbished, the room was updated with flat-screen TV and quality finishes including granite countertops, nice bathroom tile, soft duvet-style bedding, nice towels, and quiet efficient air conditioning. The front desk staff were helpful and friendly. The breakfast was well staffed who kept it clean and well stocked. It was great to have before heading to parks. Add that to the free parking and WiFi (extra charges at many other hotels) and you have a gem of a hotel
Room was not ready when arrived. Had to wait till4:45 for our room. Check in at 3:00The water was  cloudy the whole parking lot was begin repaved

The room was updated, clean, and comfortable. Very close to Disneyland. Decent free breakfast. Appreciated being able to keep the car parked at the hotel during the day without extra charge. Nearby shuttle was $2.50 each way to and from Disneyland. Great value for a great price!

Summary Heading: Okey Kind of Hotel Not great
Summary: Pros:  Location was very good, lot of eating options nearby, hotel also offer good breakfast options, close to disneyland.  Cons: Super Dirty carpet(or very old), if you walk bare foot your foot will be extremely dirty(black color or dust was coming off from carpet on to the foot which was getting transferred to bathtub so we have to wear slippers all time while in room. room was having very unpleasant odor as if it was closed for whole rainy reason and is opened after months. Manager did offered to change the room but the next one was nothing better so we stayed in the same room. Manager promised to upgrade but offered same kind of room (i.e no upgrade) and the reason told was they only have 1 room(probably dont know the meaninig of upgrade) Will i stay next time: Probably not

The room was nice and beds comfortable. Front desk staff were very friendly and accommodating. We arrived several hours before check in and they found a room for us right away. Free breakfast wasn't much- no protein, all carbs, and only apples for fruits- but it was free. TV was very small- but we didn't use it much. Liked that the room had fridge and microwave. The only real issue we had was the area- not much around us and shady people at bus stop and motel on corner. But our vehicle and belongings were safe in the parking lot.

Check in time is 3 P.M. I checked in at that time and was told there were no rooms available. I did not get my room until 3:30 PM. When I checked out I called the front desk from my room to let them know, I was told I couldn't check out until one of the employees went to my room and made sure I didn't break/ destroy or smoke in the room. I travel a lot and I have stayed at many hotels and never had I experienced something like that. I went on a family trip with my 3 year old daughter like I told the employee, why would I request a non- smoking room if I was planning on smoking? I have a 3 year old with me why would I smoke in the room? I was very irritated. Will never go back to that hotel. To make things worse the swimming pool was not heated! When I asked I was told it was!

Very good establishment, but the maid service lack of understanding English and unfriendliness got a bad mark. Asked the maid for things, she replied do not speak English and turned away-unreal. It was pretty close to Disneyland, about a mile. A hotel shuttle service would have been nice. We took our car to Disneyland. Woman that worked the breakfast was so nice, hard worker and attentive to guess needs. She deserves a 10 score. Front desk personnel were nice, helpful and informative. Our overall rating is an 8. We would definitely come back.
We stay at this place multiple times per year. We always feel we are welcomed almost as friends, not clients.
Our room was very clean and well maintained.  The bed was so comfortable. And the staff was friendly and helpful. The price was amazing!  Highly recommend.

Summary Heading: Although the hotel's site and the building exteriors don't...
Summary: Although the hotel's site and the building exteriors don't exactly look up to par, the rooms were very nice. I could tell they'd been recently remodeled. Everything was neat and clean, bedding was fine, television was a bit on the small side but offered a nice amount of channels.The complimentary breakfast in the lobby was a very welcome incentive (orange juice, coffee, pastries, cereal and even a waffle machine!). Overall, I was very pleased, especially since my sole intent for the room was a place to temporarily rest during Disneyland's 24-hr celebration.

Rooms were ok, always shorted us on towels (3 full size towels for a double queen room), had to go to office to get towels ourselves. Breakfast is a carbohydrate feast. Location is sketchy. Employees are nice, BUT they screwed up on the charges and will not credit account. The price charged to my card was $25 more than stated. Never again.

Great location for what we needed.  Very reasonably priced with sufficient amenities.  Front desk person was very friendly, and the room she gave us ended up giving us a beautiful view of the Disneyland fireworks.  Room was clean and comfortable.  Would stay here again for sure!

- very obliging front desk staff - whilst not wiht in walking distance i=to DisneyLand, very handy ART service and bust stop next door - reasonably complimentary breakfats (great slef serve waffle machine) - convenient hotel laundry mat
The room was very clean and staff extremely friendly and helpful. Within a mile walk to Disneyland.

The hotel was pretty basic.  It is not walking distance to Disneyland, but the Anaheim Resort Transit stop is right outside the hotel and runs every 30 minutes starting at 7:20 am and ends after Disneyland closes.  I believe the line that runs from this hotel to DL is 10 or 11;  the stop drops you off right in front of DL and each line for the ART has it's own well marked stop at the DL entrance which was helpful after leaving the park late in the evening.  The ART fee was $5 per day per person and a good value in my opinion and sold at the front desk.   Didn't use the pool, but it is very small. The continental breakfast was pretty simple but free.  Free parking was included.  A few student groups were staying at this hotel, probably due to the lower cost and relative

Hotel was ok for the price paid. The only issue was the air conditioning.  While it worked fine, it always emitted a damp and moldy smell.  The fact that it had a microwave and a refrigerator was a plus.  Also, housekeeping knocked on the door and woke us up asking us when we were going to check out, when check out wasn't for a couple of hours.

I was looking for a room at a value but nice. I took my granddaughter to Disneyland. Very close to the shuttle bus. Clean, nice rooms. Beds so comfortable, very quiet. I will be staying here always. Michelle is awesome! She was so helpful. Took that extra step. The rest of the staff was ok. As long as she is there, we will stay there!!

Summary Heading: Get more than you pay for
Summary: We stayed here to save and I was worried about the $105.00 a night price tag during spring break. I was relieved once we got there. The hotel had undergone a major renovation and the place looked very nice. The room was a bit bigger than most Marriott rooms and it included a simple breakfast for the price. The property was clean and neat. Eat early as the food disappears quickly. It is a long walk to Disney, and a cab is not needed. This is not a resort, but a convenient place to sleep. Huntington Beach, and Newport are  25 minutes away. The pool was out of order and the restaurant next door had gone out of business. It can be noisy because the rooms face out and it is not far from the freeway. Still, once in the room I was pleased with the noise level.

The motel is close to Disneyland, very nice facilities, very clean rooms, had everything we need, including a coffee maker. The staff was very nice, except for one lady who seems unfriendly. Breakfast was delightful. they even had a waffle maker!

Great price   Front desk friendly and helpful.  The race went right by the hotel so we could call our sleeping kids to come down and cheer for us and take photos.  Would stay there again for other runs at Disneyland.  Free shuttle to Disneyland a plus and within walking distance of the park

The shower knobs were missing the place had a bad smell construction goin all day and no security guards people drinking and smoking pot all around homeless sleeping around the corner not a good exp for Disney land

Stay upstairs for sure! Noise from neighbors wasn't bad, it was really clean, decent size rooms. Breakfast was very basic but it was free. The desk clerk was great! Friendly and helpful! Would totally stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location ok, value for price good and clean
Summary: We were looking for a hotel that was reasonably priced in the Anaheim area where we could base ourselves. This hotel fit the brief.  It was close to the freeway so we could head out on our day trips quite easily, it was close to Disney Land and the accommodation itself was comfortable.  The first room they put us in failed to overwhelm us however as it was right above the laundry.  We asked to move but were not able to until the 2nd night. They were accommodating to us and we were moved to the bottom floor on another wing for the rest of our stay which was considerably better.   There is a small breakfast room which gives you a good continental breakfast to start the day. We were too busy with our activities to utilize the pool however it did look inviting.  There is a

Summary Heading: Disney Trip- well worth it for the price!
Summary: We stayed in February 2015, and I was able to get 7 nights for $470 on an Expedia deal.  The breakfast was just fine and filled us up till lunch, which saved a pretty penny.  The ART shuttle bus went straight up to the front gates, and it's only $55 for 5 days for two adults and two children.  Honestly, if you're looking for a good deal, this is it.  It's clean, and yes there is a liquor store right by the bus, but if you are just there to go to Disneyland, not walk 3 miles back to a hotel, and crash, it's well worth it, in my opinion.  We didn't spend the bomb and we had a magnificent, wonderful experience as a family.  The ice machines came in handy for going to the beach.  I'd stay here again.
The room was very nice and clean. Not a lot of towels (family of 4) and there was no fridge or microwave.

I enjoyed my two night stay at this Ramada. It was my first. I found the room to be clean and pleasant. It was mostly quiet, aside from the doors slamming in the middle of the night (that isn't the hotel's fault though, it is the other guests).  I felt safe staying at this hotel and will definitely visit again.

Summary Heading: The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, customer service...
Summary: The staff is very friendly, knowledgeable, customer service oriented and helpful. I enjoyed staying at this property. I will be staying at this location again. I would and did refer this property to friends and family. Thank you for the opportunity to share the Wonderful experience we had during our stay. Thank you to the staff at the Ramada Inn for everything.

Summary Heading: THIS IS A NICE OLDER HOTEL
Summary: This facility is very nice.  It has a great location and very close to the bus service direct to Disneyland.  The room was clean and spacious.  The staff were all helpful and courteous.  The help in the breakfast area were especially nice.  The only downside to this hotel is its age.  The staff takes great strides to keep the facility nice but the age is just something they can't overcome.
Friendly staff, clean room, good price and convenient access to Disneyland.  Only downside was limited parking.

Stayed in unit 104 - two queen beds.  Very accommodating since most of our day was at the theme park.  Breakfast was adequate for us.  Room was clean with one sink in the bathroom.  Nearby shuttle service was available, but we didn't need it.
