Good location close to Disneyland, but not at walking distance. good breakfast, clean, had some problems with the bathroom light, had to turn it on and off several times to make it work. TV remote not always work. In general nice accommodation.
Friendly desk staff; good breakfast; convenient shuttle ride to Disneyland; and very clean and quiet rooms!
Hotel was good for its type.  However Ran out of Hot Water on the Second day in the morning.  When front desk notified, clerk wanted to refund one day, but Manager said no and just apologized.

The title pretty much sums it up.  Probably the most helpful person I've ever had the pleasure of dealing with at a hotel.  The only reason I rated the property 4 out of 5, was the homeless people on the property.  They seemed quite comfortable hanging out behind the now closed restaurant in the parking lot.  They also seemed to enjoy marijuana throughout the evening, based on the strong smell.  I don't know what you guys could do about homelessness in the world today, but if they could not smoke weed upwind of the open end of the hallway, that would be good.  To be clear, it was a group of homeless people smoking marijuana, not Michelle.  All comedy aside, she was as helpful and courteous as could be, helping us get to restaurants, giving tips on Disneyland, etc...  The little

This location was pretty good.  The price was half of what it was outside Disney's gate and a daily bus pass was cheap and quick.  The rooms were clean ...  could have used a better breakfast.  The only beef I had was with the people at the 1-800 number I had to use to make the booking.  They weren't very helpful in most instances ... a bit of a language barrier(spanish) and they didn't book at the location I requested -- even though I double checked the address with them; booked in my husband's name intsead of mine, even though I repeated several times that it should be in mine.  Would have preferred to book directly with the hotel, versus the Wyndham Hotel chain that I think I talked too.  (only phone number that I could find attached to reservations of that hotel)  All in all

Comfortable room with a refrigerator and microwave.  Close to Disneyland.  The bed was very comfortable.  Service was exceptional.  I enjoyed my stay.  They provided breakfast, which was a little boring but it was nice to have it provided.

When we booked this hotel we were led to believe it was the maingate across from Disney. The one that is under construction. It was very clear on the phone that we were looking to stay across from Disney. We punched in the address to the gps and were surprised when we ended up 1 mile north of the Disney maingate. We met another couple with the same experience. The hotel/motel was clean but ramada is working a scam calling both hotels "maingate". If you book this hotel make sure you check the address and don't take the person on the phones assurance. We explained this to the check in person and they said it happens all the time and that they have a central booking office and they sometimes make mistakes.  The room was clean so we made the best of it. My kids are older so the walk

Summary Heading: Why are there "two" ramada maingates within one mile of each other
Summary: Why and how can you call yourself Ramada Maingate??????   We stayed at the ramada Maingate at the park three years ago and it was great because it really was at the Disneyland maingate, almost directly across the street. Well we were really upset when we arrived to check in only to find out we had actually booked the Ramada Maingate 1 Mile north of the park!!! Seems like a ploy to rip people off by misdirecting them to their crappy hotel. We met other families there who had also been misled by their name!!  Come on, this is ruining many peoples vacations!!!

The rooms where large and well appointed, had micro, fridge, coffee maker, and hair dryer.  One of the best shower heads in last five rooms I have rented.   Every thing was very clean and well cared for.  Breakfast included waffles, which were a big hit with the kids.  Will be coming  back for our future visit to Disneyland.  The pool was very nice and has handicap chair.  Also, there are fireworks everynight, which may be seen from the parking lot, a nice unexpected surprise.  The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant to deal with.

I am disappointed in this hotel. We stayed for 5 days, and we were unhappy that the cleaning aids had spilled some of our expensive hair products on the ground and also moved things around the tv dresser though they did not need to clean in that area. We didn't have anything stolen but we did not appreciate our things being moved around and spilled. The manager also did NOTHING about it. He said he couldn't do anything unless anything was stolen.
I spent good times at the hotel. Michelle, the girl of the front desk was so kind and help us in everything

Summary Heading: Great stay at a nicely updated motel.Also 10% off at the...
Summary: Great stay at a nicely updated motel. Also 10% off at the on-site restaurant by showing your Ramada room card.

My wife and I along with our daughter went to Disneyland on March 11th and 12th. This hotel is north of Disneyland. It is about 2 minutes drive from Disneyland. A 10 minute walk if you walk fast and 15 if you walk leisurely. The hotel is north of Ball Rd, so you have to cross over the freeway. This might bother some people if you are walking to Disneyland from the hotel. You have to be aware of the traffic at the 5 freeway exit. There is a crosswalk, but there is no light. So you need to cross to the concrete island which is only about 12 feet away. Then you cross again another 12 feet to get to sidewalk leading down Harbor to Disneyland. There is also a shuttle that comes every 1/2 hour known as ART that will take to and from Disneyland. The hotel had a breakfast. Self serve

With my son's birthday falling on spring break each year, it's difficult to plan trips. Ramada has made our stay each year amazing, from saving in fees, to comfortability, to convience. i would and do recommend this hotel to everyone !

Summary Heading: Experienced a problem with sofa bed and was promised a...
Summary: Experienced a problem with sofa bed and was promised a different suite and the next day the suite was rented to another guest
This will be my new go-to hotel for Disneyland trips! Clean, quiet, modern, and a very friendly staff. All the amenities you could need! Thanks again!

Front Desk Michelle very professional but, Laura not very friendly needs more people skills. Maids came in to pick up towels but, didntn't make beds or clean up room. But, room was nice and presentable when we first got there.
Let's just say that we found a new place to stay!!!  My kiddos feet were black from the nasty carpet.   Gross. Beds were very hard. We left and found a better place down the road
I was very pleased. With a big family of 8 a good room with great accommodation is what we are always worried about. At Ramada it was perfect.

This was a very affordable and clean place to stay, close to Disneyland.  We were able to walk to Disneyland in about 15 minutes, but the Anaheim Resort Transit Route stop is very close by.  There is food within walking distance.  The breakfast was nice with waffles, yogurt, cereal, coffee, juice, donuts and danishes, fruit, bagels, and english muffins.  The lobby staff were very helpful.  You can see the Disneyland fireworks from the parking lot.  The room was clean, had everything we needed, and had great water pressure for showers!  And there was free wifi that worked well.

Summary Heading: We love this place. We use it when we go to Disneyland and...
Summary: We love this place. We use it when we go to Disneyland and have a great time every time. Price is right, it's very clean, good location, shuttle. It has everything we need.

It was very conveniently located, I don't need much when it comes to hotel stays so I think it was a perfect room. It was clean, staff was friendly and complimentary breakfast was just fine. The walk to Disneyland was about 15min if not less. If you're tired after walking all day, a cab ride is very cheap as well.
Value for money here, clean.  Hispanic staff were very accommodating when you finally were able to communicate

The overall outside of this hotel isn't the most inviting. The staff was very friendly and helpful when checking in. The room was very nicely update! Looked modern and clean! The bed was very comfy. It was extremely noisy though. You could hear absolutely everything that was going on in the hotel. That kept us up at night and did not allow us to sleep in, which was very upsetting because of how comfortable the beds were.
Room was clean and comfortable. Staff did a great job maintaining our room during the stay, and all employees were friendly and helpful.
Very comfortable and clean hotel.  Complimentary breakfast was great.  NO complaints at all. .

We were pretty satisfied with our stay at this hotel. It was a bit of a walk however we did it everyday to Disney Land it was pretty awesome. The room itself was amazing however we reserved the queen deluxe sweet and I am pretty sure that it was not deluxe there was no couch however it wasn't to big of a deal because we brought our own inflatable one for our autistic son. The rooms were very clean amd tidy and there were no stains on the walls the shower was amazing amd the beds were very comfortable and the breakfast was awesome as well. The only thing I could say is that the r efridgerator didnt have a freezer area so we couldnt 're freeze our ice pack but we made it through. But the refrigerators also had room for a two liter of soda and a 1/2 gallon of milk as well. So we
Rooms were fantasic! Breakfast waffles were yummy! The staff is so nice and helpful. Other places need to learn from these wonderful people! We plan on going back and staying there!
Loved it. It was a great stay loved the staff and room. Made us feel at home and comfortable. Loved checking in and out it was quick and easy. Staff was very informative.

Area seemed shady upon arrival. However never felt unsafe the rest of the trip. Room had recently been remodeled. Room was clean and satisfactory. No safe or refrigerator. Quiet at night so sleep was good. Beds comfortable. Carrows Restaurant in parking lot. Food was very good and prices very reasonable. Would stay here again.

I was very happy with our stay! Very clean for an exterior entry hotel because those always seem to be less nice. They cleaned our room upon request. Wouldn't recommend walking to disney because it is a little far, but they do have a shuttle bus for $3 per person! Parking at disney is $17 per car so really depends on your travel load. Overall very happy!
The staff is so very helpful, the rooms are clean and have lots of amenities.  Whether it's business or a vacation, you will find the stay very enjoyable!
Room was very clean with fresh paint and new carpeting and new furniture and fixtures. Overall very happy with our stay at Ramada
the front office staff was great. the room was clean and the beds are comfortable. I probably had the best pillows ever. the only down side was thin walls.

This hotel was adequate. The free breakfast was pretty bad, and the room wasn't quite as nice as in the picture. Not bad overall, though, especially since we spent most of our time at Disneyland anyway.

rooms were nic and clean and quiet. Bed comfortable.  Went to breakfast at 6:30 when it opened. half the stuff wasnt out and had to ask for everything. the girl working spoke no english. If you are going to have one person working, please MAKE SURE SHE OR HE SPEAKS ENGLISH...OH and someone friendly too  soo frustratiing  good location There is a Carrow right next door though.
The front staff was Great! I can not recommend using this location enough! We plan on using this location every time we need to stay in Anaheim,

It's a clean hotel and staff are courteous. Room had a fridge, a coffee maker and a microwave. It should be about 20mins walk to Disneyland on foot but I always used the $5 daily shuttle. Breakfast was basic but okay, you can make waffle by yourself. The apples were always fresh and crunchy, and I loved the coffee creamer instead of milk. Wifi was good and free. Having said all these, the hotel didn't click it for me. Maybe it's the quietness. Surrounding seemed rather deserted at nights, I prefer hotels closer to Disneyland, those street lights raise your spirit, though they come with higher price. I didn't like the loud noises coming from Disneyland Fireworks at nights either. If you love tranquility, you'll love it here, though children can be noisy atimes.  Carrow's
Quiet,  well kept and close to everything without costing an arm and a leg.  Looks great and the rooms are really nice since the remodel.  Great beds,  very comfy for a tall guy.

FD person Michelle was awesome!! Felt the price was double what it should have been. Nicer hotels, closer to disneyland were less, w found out later. But the location was ok, busses were very convenient. Would have been nice to have a hot tub.

Summary Heading: Nice location. Yes, very clean only complaint is that the...
Summary: Nice location. Yes, very clean only complaint is that the towels look really old or just dingy...Otherwise awesome stay!

Overall, hotel was good. Only problem was the noise. We can hear everything. Unfortunately there were kids who made a lot of noise upstairs early morning and noise in the parking lot. Had a hard time sleeping. Hotel staff though was friendly

Summary Heading: Our stay at Ramada Maingate North
Summary: We really enjoyed our stay at the Ramada Maingate North. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and had everything we required. We found the staff very friendly and helpful from the start to the finish of our stay. Great location for catching buses as there is a bus stop out the front also a pick up stop for Disneyland and tours. Having a restaurant attached to the property was a bonus as after a tiring day it was very convenient.

Needed somewhere to lay our heads before our long trip began and this seemed as good a place as any. Very affordable room and relatively quiet for being so close to Disneyland. The free breakfast every morning was pretty great despite some of the negative reviews here - we come from New Zealand and almost nowhere gives you even a coffee in the morning so some cereal, pastries and waffles was a welcome start to the day. Room was plain but functional and clean - stay with confidence.

the room was probably one if the best ive stayed in during the past year. id compare it to the wyndham just up the street (formerly the crowne plaza). id give it 4 stars!  the bed was beyond comfortable ... felt like we slept on a cloud. the room was exceedingly clean. very close to disneyland's main entrances. easy freeway access.   definitely staying at the hotel again!!

Hotel was simple but rooms were very comfortable and clean. Reception staff friendly and helpful. We were accidently dropped off at another Ramada Anaheim but staff seemed very blazay about the fact we were now stranded at the wrong hotel and ended up walking to correct hotel. They casually said "it happens all the time" maybe there should be more awareness to advise the fact that there are more than one Ramada Hotels in the same area. Apart from that, overall fantastic and good location.
Everything was very nice, clean and bed supper comfortable! Definitely recommend and will stay here again.

Room was good. Only issue really was the courtin at the bathroom - it was not water repelent and a bit of water fell down to the floor during shower. Breakfast was simple (no bacon and eggs) but enough for my family. Internet connection was not working when I checked in. It was a problem 'cause I needed to meet other family members in another hotel and relied on internet to communicate. Frontdesk was always very helpful.

The bed was very worn.I woke with a sore back. I called them at 3:00pm when my room had not been made up. They did nothing except inform me that they had until 5:00PM to service my room! They knocked on the door at 4:30 and asked me if I wanted my room serviced.

Although the hotel was under construction we had a most enjoyable stay at Ramada. The woman at the main desk was very pleasant and accommodating. The room and linens were very clean and the continental breakfast was very nice. We enjoyed our 4 days at Ramada.

Summary Heading: The room was decent. Office was under construction. I got...
Summary: The room was decent. Office was under construction. I got some kind of bug bites from the room and ants were crawling around in the bathroom

I chose to stay at this hotel because, I booked last minute and the price was great.  However, the beds weren't very comfortable, the pillows were flat, we only had a sheet and a thin blanket, and the worst part was there was no curtain to close over the window.  There was only a shear curtain so light came into our room at dawn and at night there was no privacy.

Room itself was nice.  It was, however, loud and not as nice on the exterior as I would have expected.  I had to ask for a rollaway bed three times, even after I specifically noted it in my reservation.

Summary Heading: It's a Motel - Go for the sleep not the breakfast.
Summary: The property is undergoing some renovation now (a good thing) to modernize itself.  The layout is your typical roadside sleep-spot with rooms opening to an external corridor, no separate closet and a tiny bathroom.  However, aesthetically, the room decor has moved into the 21st century, shower water pressure is good and the beds are comfortably firm.  The door of our room was missing insulation underneath so it was necessary to heat it lest it got too cold at night.  If you can, score a room on the second floor facing away from the parking lot for a great view of Disney fireworks every evening.  The property is 15-20 minutes' walk from the Disneyland entrance, which is no problem in the morning, but is painful after midnight and being on your feet all day.  (There's a shuttle
I expected a more enjoyable ambiance at a Ramada, which is a step up from a Motel 6. The construction occurring onsite made for an average stay.

Summary Heading: Cockroach infested, cigarette smelling, loud dump.
Summary: I booked this hotel for my stay while at Disneyland. I live in Oregon and relied on reviews to choose hotel.  First, this is NOT within walking distance of Disney. It is approx 2 miles away. Second,this is a motel not a hotel. A hotel has a lobby and the rooms are off of an indoor corridor. A motel has doors going directly outside. Which is the case here. I would compare this location to more of a Days Inn, Super 8 type of place.  Third, the hotel shares a parking lot with Carrows Restaurant and it's hard to find parking. Fourth, when we arrived to hotel after 16 hours at Disneyland,  it was midnight. There were people out in the parking lot being loud and smoking right in front of the intakes for the AC units so there was an overwhelming cigarette smell everywhere. Not To
Stayed here for 2 nights. Not bad had the suite with 3 queen beds and sofa bed. Close to Disneyland and shuttle ser vice throughout the day was very convenient.  I would stay here again!

This is a great hotel, very clean bedroom... but we can hear everything from upstairs (foot steps, tv, shower).  Also... During the reservation, no one told me about 100dlls deposit or credit card. Luckily a friend borrow me the money for that night.

I have stayed before at the Ramada Maingate, across the street from Disneyland and that is where I thought I was making my reservation on the Ramada Inn website.  This is not that hotel. When I arrived, I discovered that my room was at a different location that was more than walking distance from Disneyland.  Although the Ramada Maingate I wanted had rooms available, I learned I would still have to pay for the Ramada Maingate North room if I changed hotels. I unhappily stayed at the Maingate north and had to go through the hassle of parking at Disneyland. I have no complaints about the room itself, just the fact that the two Ramada Inns have similar names and that Ramada was unwilling to allow me to change my reservation.

The front desk staff was very nice! Our room was clean and comfortable. This was a family trip to Disney so most of our time was not in the room. It rained while we were there so we did not use the pool but the pool looked very clean and nice. We were able to see the fireworks  in the evenings while standing near the pool in the parking lot and that was nice. Breakfast is average- pastries, cereal , waffle maker and juice as advertised.There is a laundry room available with a vending machine that sells soap- this was very handy for us to do a few loads of laundry instead of packing up all of our dirty clothes.    We purchased shuttle tickets each day and caught a shuttle because I dont feel that this hotel is in comfortable walking distance to the park. there is a freeway
Nice rooms inside. Easy access to room. Computer in lobby was outdated and couldn't access my email to print e-tickets. Also, while free breakfast is appreciated, it was a pretty sad breakfast.

Everything you wanted! Nothing too fancy but if your bussiness is to go shopping and visit Disney Park, it's most than you need! Great attention and service from the employees! I would definitely be back!

We just got back from Disneyland and tried a new hotel.  It was the Ramada North on Harbor.  I was a little worried but turned out just fine.  The place had been remodeling rooms over the summer and all the rooms have been finished.  They are just remodeling the front office at this point.  So, when we arrived (to be fair, really early to check in...10:30 am) the office said they'd have a room in about 30 minutes.  About 20 minutes later we had a room and it was great.  Nice and clean, spacious and the beds were actually comfortable too!  It was in the back of the property and there was virtually no road noise whatsoever.  The shower was quick to warm and nice and full!  We did try the breakfast the 2nd day and it was pretty blah...cereal, pastry, toast, etc. Would have been

great place, rooms comeswith free wifi, coffee maker, a mini fridge and satellite tv. great breakfast selection too specially the waffle maker. disneyland is literally round the corner too. there are two ramada hotel so make sure you book the right one.

Summary Heading: Could not walk up stairs, so given an upgraded room on the...
Summary: Could not walk up stairs, so given an upgraded room on the first floor at no addition cost. Scores an A+ for this.
.8 miles to Disneyland, free wifi, breakfast and parking, polite front-desk, thorough cleaning crew, Carrows and Shakey's Pizza next door, great value!

This was not the Ramada I thought.  We had previously stayed at a Ramada very close to the Disneyland gate.  This one is the other direction on Harbor, across the freeway (I-5).  While the walk was okay (less than a mile to the gate, I think), I still don't know how I managed to book the wrong hotel.  I was not aware there were two Ramadas that call themselves Main Gate.  The hotel itself was okay.  The room had been updated, was clean and functional.  The only mystery was where to find the light switch for the light above the window (next to the entry door).  Plenty of coffee in the morning, waffles, English muffins, but no eggs or yogurt.

The room was very clean and the bed and pillows were incredibly comfortable.  Refrigerator and microwave in room but coffee pot was broken.  Outside the entrance to the hotel was the ART shuttle to take us to Disneyland ($12 for a 3 day pass per person) and because we were on the less popular side of the park, we were only 1 stop away from Disney.  Very convenient.  Our only complaint was that the front desk employee (Jonathan) was not helpful when presented with questions related to taxis, dining, etc.  We were left to do research of the area on our own while most hotels have information readily available.  The breakfast consisted of cereal, waffles, apples and beverages.  No real protein.

We styed at this hotel last summer and the location was great! About a 5 minute walk to Disneyland. Lots of restaurants near by. When we checked in to our room the A/C was not working but they quickly fixed that problem. The room was nice for the price we paid. The free breakfast in the morning was a plus because we could eat that before we headed to Disneyland. All in all I would def stay there again!

The hotel was still in the process of being remodeled but at the time we were there only the hotel lobby was torn up.  The rooms are really nicely redone.  The bed wasn't that comfortable but doable for a over night stay. The breakfast is worth stopping in for.  Waffles, toast, cereal. danish, and donuts.  They had orange juice and coffee.  The only thing I have to really complain about is that they authorize your credit card the room rate that you have been quoted plus a $50 deposit.  Then when you check out they then charge your card the room rate quoted.  If you are visiting on a long weekend like we were on checking out on Thanksgiving day you better have enough credit on your card to sustain a large authorization and be able to eat afterwards.  The bank won't release the

I was not happy with the fact that when I booked my trip, the hotel information available at booking was altogether different from what I really booked. There are two Ramada Maingates near Disneyland, which I am sure you are well aware of, and I felt there was a bait and switch because I got the impression from the website I would be truly walking distance from Disneyland. It turns out I was booked at the other hotel which was not true walking distance.Then the woman at the front desk charged me for both nights the day I arrived so that it would be inconvenient for me to get a refund. I did not appreciate that at all once I seen a guest paying for her stay as she was checking out. Honesty goes a long way. This hotel was not that bad,but the deception at the time of booking and
The room was clean and just perfect for my wife and me.  The staff at Ramada Inn were very nice and helpful.  I highly recommend this motel.  It is conveniently located near Disneyland.

Front desk staff friendly and helpful, clean  and comfortable hotel, fridge/microwave/hairdryer/iron in room.  Pool is not heated-so did not enjoy using it.  Carrow's family restaraunt in same parking lot-very good, ART shuttle for 5.00/day saved us from walking to/from Disneyland, WalMart grocery store on ART route was convenient. Pizza Press across from Disneylands main gate was fast and very good, but mostly vegetable toppings(not so appealing to kids).

I stayed at this property because of the proximity to Disneyland. The front desk clerks were friendly and extremely hospitable. The room was comfortable, clean and quiet.  I would highly recommend this property to all my friends and family.

I have stayed here before and the rooms are nice & clean for the most part. This trip our room even had a refrigerator and microwave (a previous stay here, the room did not have these features).   The parking lot, however, never seemed to have enough parking. One night we returned to the room to find zero spots open so the front desk advised me to park in Carrow's spot and took my room number in case a tow was threatened.

Stayed here for the weekend for my recent trip to Disneyland. Upon check-in I was greeted and givien EXCELLENT customer service from front desk clerk. The hotel is in close proximetry to D-Land. The hotel offers a shuttle to take you back and forth to the theme park for $5/per adult R/T. Not, bad better than paying $20 to park at D-Land. The lobby is under construction, but that didn't faze me. Free parking and internet. Continental breakfast is your usual waffles, fruit, cereal, there is a Carrows Restaurant next door that you can eat breakfast at. Overall I have already decided this will definitely be my GO To hotel anytime I go back to D-Land!!
It's not a 3 star facility. I would not stay. The breakfast offering is below standard. It's not worth it.

Stayed here during Halloween for Mickey's Halloween Party at Disneyland. While it is a bit away from the park, the rooms are great and Shakey's Pizza and Carol's are nearby. The service could not have been better. Richard at the front desk gave me tips on Disneyland, directions to banks, and called cabs for us as well as explained the ART transit system which saved me money. Next door is a small store with reasonable prices for microwave popcorn soda etc as well as a small beauty shop that hooked up my daughters hair for a tenth of what it would have cost at the Disney Salon.
one thing I would like is a later check out time without having to to 25.00 per hr. Maybe something like 1:00 or 1:30. And also a few more towels. We didn't even have two face towels.

My pregnant wife, two year old daughter and I were woken up @ 3:30 in the morning by hotel gusts walking into are room. The front desk gave are room to anouther guest. When I talked to the manager she acted like it was no big deal.

Summary Heading: This hotel was clean and newly remodeled,  the staff was...
Summary: This hotel was clean and newly remodeled,  the staff was friendly and very helpful.  the only draw back is I could hear the kid next door crying early in the morning.   I would stay here again.

When you finally find the place, you can miss it if you aren't careful, and can park (it can be tight) it is worth the effort based on our trip to Disneyland last weekend.  The outside of the hotel looked old, but the inside of our room was quite pleasant and pleasing.  The bed was surprisingly comfy and plenty of pillows. The location is very close to Disney and could be walking distance for some, but was just a bit too far for us especially at the end of the night and walking all day. Overall, we were very pleased and felt received a good value for our $ spent here at this property.

We traveled to this hotel for a vacation to Disneyland for a weekend trip, overall it was a good hotel, very friendly staff,  & the room was remodeled, the only complaint I have is the pillows were not soft, they were very hard pillows that gave me a neck ache/headache when I woke up the next day, other then that it was fine. Was about a mile and a 1/4 away from Disneyland, we were able to ride the shuttle to and from Disneyland through the pre-paid shuttle service, and then walked one time, was about a 20 min walk. I do not recommend walking to and from at night as it is not in the best part of the neighborhood it seemed like. I suggest this hotel if you are looking to save a lot of money & put it towards Disneyland food etc. It works well for that.

Good value for what was offered.  Construction was underway when we arrived, however it did not interfer with the comfort of our stay.  Contractors were long gone and it was quiet when we arrived back at our room from a day out.  Beds were comfortable and the room was well appointed and clean.  The continental breakfast was rather weak but had enough of a selection to safisfy our morning needs.  We will return on our next visit to the area.

Stayed here during our Disney vacation, and was very happy. It was so nice to come back to the room after a long day at the park to a made bed and fresh towels. Staff was friendly, knowledgeable and helpful. My only complaint was that the bed was hard and stiff and the pillows too soft. (I prefer a soft bed and firm pillows). Other wise I was very happy and intend to stay again during my next Disney visit.

Very good hotel. Ideal for a family going to Disneyland. Walking distance. Great view of the fireworks just after we arrived.  Very friendly & helpful staff. The worst I can say is that the tv was very slow changing channels, it would have been nice to have 4 cups in room for 4 people, and the kids only wanted yoghurt for breakfast and this was the first hotel in 2 weeks that didn't serve it.

The hotel has just been remodeled and it is very nice.. The room was so pretty and spacious and outside our door were tables and chairs to sit outside if you wanted. A very pretty peaceful spot .. We really enjoyed our stay here and the price is wonderful. We took the art bus to disney everyday.. You can get tickets for that at the office which is very convenient.. They are still doing a bit of remodeling with the breakfast room so that is just cereal , waffles, coffee, tea , donuts, toast.. No eggs or yogurt or fruit but that will change they said when the room is complete.. But there is a Carrows right in the parking lot which is delicious and they even deliver to your room... We ate their twice once before going into disneyland and the day we left .. The office staff is very

I was very pleased with the location of this property. The room was good. Everything looked newly renovated. The bed was comfortable and clean. Only issue we had which ended up not being an issue was that we came back to the room on a fri night real late...past midnight and there was no parking. The front desk staff said to park where it was marked for Carrows restaurant, which was going to be ok. He just said that we may have to move the car in the morning...and thank goodness we didn't have too, since we got in so late I didn't want to get up early just to move the car.  But our overall stay was great and we will probably stay there again the next time we are in Anaheim.

I was surprised at the other reviews... I thought it was a great place to stay!  Close to Disneyland ~ newly remodeled ~ clean ~ great staff ~ great waffles in continental breakfast! Nice pool  Only set back is any hotel near the park you can hear fireworks  like cannons! Not any fault of hotel...

We were walking distance (less than a mile) from the Disneyland Main Gate. The room was clean, large and well maintained. It was up to date with a very comfortable king size bed. Nothing flashy, but just very nice. We had a little trouble with some noisy neighbors (I'm still not quite sure what they were doing), but it stopped after a call to the front desk. As a bonus, the 2nd story balcony on the back side has an incredible (and up close) view of the fireworks.

Had a long drive, was very tired. Showed up earlier then check in time. They were kind enough to get room ready earlier & let us in. The room was nice & clean. Breakfast was good.  All employees that we spoke with were nice and helpful.   Great price for what we got! We will come back.

Truly enjoyed the quality service. The site was dark and motel like. Rooms were simple but nice. For the price of stay it is a good place. Breakfast was just ok. Cereal, milk, oj, and pastries with waffles.

The hotel was clean, staff were professional and efficient.  Close to the parks, the shuttle was inexpensive and quick, but it is within walking distance.  You can see and hear the fireworks from your room -- great for adults and night owls, not so great for small children who are easily frightened by loud noises.  Overall, a good value.

Our reservation was "lost" in the system for some reason, but Michelle was able to find a paper copy and give us a room.  She was very professional and kind and handled this problem very well.  We stayed three nights.  It has a free breakfast (nothing special, but free!), clean rooms, a clean pool, and a short walk or drive to Disneyland.  Carrow's in the parking lot was also a good place to grab a bite to eat.  We'd stay here again!

Filthy property , poorly maintained and cleanliness where non-existent. To start the towels where dark grey  , we had to buy our own towels to have a shower . Couple of times the housekeeper forgot to leave any toilet paper . If you walked barefooted in the room your feet where black because the carpet was so filthy. Continental breakfast was terrible ,coffee looked like dirty water with no taste what so ever . We only had breakfast once in all of the 8 nights we stayed there. vending machines where never filled , if you wanted to buy water to had to walk down the street . I would not recommend this place to anyone and i cannot believe the star rating expedia has given this property. In one word "disgusting " We requested a room with two double beds and got a king bed instead

Summary Heading: Our room was average; clean, remodeled bathroom, beds were...
Summary: Our room was average; clean, remodeled bathroom, beds were comfy. No funky smell. Free parking, wifi.

Nice Hotel, near Disneyland, right next to Carrows Restaurant, but there is not enough parking for all guest, you have to park in Carrows Parking lot, and you can be towed away, I couldn't sleep, so I woke up at 4:30 am to move car
Room was clean Breakfast was substandard at best The noise was a major issue. You can here your neighbors and people at all hours of the night. The room rate reflects the issues above.

Summary Heading: I was surprised at how nice the property really was...
Summary: I was surprised at how nice the property really was considering the location and the service was great!

I booked this room at the Maingate Ramada in Anaheim with the understanding that it was near the "main gate" of Disneyland. It was actually located .8 miles from the entrance, a distance to walk over the 5 Freeway and across a busy on ramp/off ramp to boot! The room was ok, but the breakfast left a lot to be desired. It consisted of waffles, Danish, 3kinds of dry cereal, juice and coffee. The only fruit was a stack of apples. This is just not the nutrition I was hoping to get before a long day at Disneyland. We wound up eating at the Carrows next door. The staff was very nice.

Summary Heading: Very good value for a trip to Disneyland where we spent...
Summary: Very good value for a trip to Disneyland where we spent most of our time at the parks.  No frills, but the room was clean, bed was comfortable, and the staff was helpful.  The cost of the room was low so I wasn't expecting anything fancy, but this was a very good value for the price.  Breakfast was very basic but it was adequate, and considering it was included in the room price I was pleased with it.

There are 2 Ramada Maingate hotels. The one that's directly opposite disneyland is called Ramada Maingate at the Park. The other that is about a mile away is called Ramada Maingate North. I stayed at the North hotel. The staff was super helpful. The breakfast was good. The room was clean with good beds.  A fridge and microwave was a bonus. The bathroom was clean. There is a coin operated laundry. Free wi-fi. There is a shuttle to and from disneyland for $5 per person per day.

Stayed for 3 days at Ramada main gate north...receptionist were very helpful especially the night girl caucasian I believe...room were clean even its an old hotel...well maintained... complimentary breakfast is awesome...I recommend this if u want to stay in a good budget...wifi Internet was Superb !!!

The hotel was alright and nice for the area it was in. However I was upset that when I got there it was not close to Disney, when I called I specifically asked if it was within walking distance and was told it was right across the street from down town disney. Which was not the case. $20 went right to parking which was a waste.
Nice staff, clean room, except the floors were a little dirty.  Breakfast was fully stocked just wanted more of a variety.
This hotel was amazing super clean and customer service excellent!! This is our new favorite hotel every time we come for Disney!!

I came here on a trip with four people. We booked two rooms with two double beds each. Check-in time was not until 3:00 pm, but because of our early flight, we ended up arriving there a little before 1:00 pm. At the time of our trip, the location was fully booked so I understood having to wait for them to get a room ready before we could check-in. The front desk agent named Ricardo was able to find us a room immediately so we won't even have to wait until check-in time. We very much appreciated that. Although the building showed some age, we were very happy with the rooms inside. It was well kept and everything was tidy. The second room was no different in cleanliness and quality. He was even able to place our rooms right beside each other for our convenience. When hotel staff

The room was relatively clean EXCEPT the carpet was very dirty. By mistake I took my shoes off and within a couple of minutes my feet were so dirty.I thought the lay out of the room was bad- enter through the door and you are on tile in the bathroom- with the toilet off to the left. Never have stayed in a room where you enter the bathroom. If you needed to use the sink at night then you had to turn on the light which would wake up anyone sleeping in bed because it was in their face.Also, wished I would have brought my own pillow, but I forgot. Their pillows were lumpy.You get what you pay for and the stay wasn't expensive.
Loved the room. It was very clean and had everything that was listed. Also, very convenient to Disneyland. Only a couple of blocks away.

Summary Heading: Stayed here at the last minute on a trip to Disneyland...
Summary: Stayed here at the last minute on a trip to Disneyland.  The park is close, but not walkable for an adult couple.  Well maintained for its age.  Could use some upgrades, but it was apparent they have kept up what they have.  Noticed some renovations going on around the office.

Summary Heading: Nice remodeled room. Courteous front desk clerk. Within a...
Summary: Nice remodeled room. Courteous front desk clerk. Within a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. Overall very satisfied with stay.

Everything was so clean and comfortable. But what blew me away were the ladies at the front desk. They were so friendly and so helpful. On arrival one of the ladies gave us the entire low down on Disney. She spend extra time to make sure my family knew what to expect, where to go and what to see. The next night the other young lady gave my daughters bowls and spoons so that they could eat their late night snack after a fun day at Disney. I was beyond impressed. I wish I remembered their names so they could get proper credit. I will stay there again and will recommend Ramada to anyone. Thanks for making our vacation special.

The hotel is close to freeway and sits only about a mile north of Disneyland, making it easy to get to but just far away enough to not have all the car/foot traffic and noise right in front of your hotel. It also shares its parking lot with a Carrow's, which is really convenient when you're too tired to drive somewhere to eat. There's a raggedy little liquor store around the corner from Carrow's... Skip it. They're cash only, no AC and products are sketchy in there; I'd suggest going down the street towards Disneyland for a convenience store (the gas stations are well equipped too) if you need one.  The hotel seems to be almost complete with renovations; the front desk was just about complete but the rooms were all up to date and pretty new. A new flat screen TV, fridge &

We stayed here for three nights for our trip to Disneyland.  Location is great.  You could walk to Disneyland, but that might be a little tough after being there all day.  The Mickey and Friends parking area is just a short drive from the motel, so that's a good way to go. The fireworks from Disneyland can be seen right over the motel.  We stood in the parking lot and enjoyed the show!  This is an older property, but well maintained.  Rooms were clean and seemed like they were recently updated.  Wi Fi worked great, which is a big plus to me.  The breakfast room was fairly spaciouis and selection wasn't bad.  It did the trick for us.  They do charge a 50.00 deposit when you check in, but that was indicated on the reservation, so this wasn't an unexpected surprise. There's a

We were on a girls trip to San Diego & decided to go to Disney for 3 days. The hotel was peaceful & the people in the office were very helpful & friendly. Even the grounds keepers were very friendly and always said good morning. All these things make your trip a little nicer

The motel was clean and recently updated. The free breakfast of cereal, donuts, and juice was offered in a very unappealing room We each had an apple that we ate in the car. I wasn't too unhappy about the breakfast since the price was right.
Stayed here for 3 nights and had an incident which in still waiting to get compensated for. Room was nice, area was quiet, except for neighbors upstairs. Good location.

Overall I was pretty impressed with this motel for the value. Had a bit of a long wait to check in due to only 1 worker and some reservation mix ups in front of me. Staff was nice enough. Room was decent. My biggest complaint was the unfortunate experience of the Mrs. stepping barefoot on a dead cockroach in the middle of the floor. At least it was dead I guess? Continental breakfast was slightly below average, not too many choices. Booked same day through priceline. Most of the TV channels didn't work, but we weren't there to watch TV, obviously.

We had gotten a deal for a nights stay through a website, and for the price, and distance from Disneyland, it was great! The only complaint I have, is the beds are so stiff, I felt like I was sleeping on cement, and with my back problems, it wasn't comfortable for me. My friend who came though said it was comfortable for her! So if you like mattresses on the hard side, you won't have any issues. But if you're like me, you may have a harder time sleeping comfortably. I feel like most hotels have hard mattresses though, so I wasn't unhappy. I also brought my almost 3 years old, and she had a blast!

We enjoyed our stay at the Ramada Limited. Very close to Disney Resort area. Our room was beautiful -totally renovated, clean and comfortable! Breakfast was good with lots of choices. Only problem was the breakfast room was not air conditioned so it was too hot! Would recommend this hotel!

We thought the hotel stay was great.  I enjoyed the location and the pool was very clean.  The only thing that really bothered my husband and I were the ants! There were ants all over the counter in the bathroom and we had to move all of our belongings late that night.

We stayed here on our trip to Disney and sea world. This is a nice hotel with clean rooms and cleaner bathrooms. Staff is friendly and very personable. Stayed here for couple of nights. Less than a mile away from Disney's east entrance. One can save on the Disney parking by just waking from here provided you are willing to walk back with those tired legs to hotel after park closes. Breakfast area is small and was crowded during peak hours. They can definitely use another waffle iron there and not have a line there. Overall, no complaints as such. Nearby area had grocery store and restaurants as well. And it is 90 minutes from sea world..

I arrived at 1:30 in the morning with a toddler asleep in the back of the car.  The front desk employee (I don't know his name as he was not wearing a name tag as required) was surly.  Which is kind of understandable due to the hour, but not professional.  The first thing he shoved at me was the credit card receipt to sign; which I refused since the reservation was not made on my own credit card.  Normally the front desk asks what credit card I would like to use.  I am not normally required to have my credit card run and to have me sign the credit card form before I check out.  But due to the circumstances (early morning arrival)  I went along with this rude employee's attitude.

I originally tried to check in at the wrong hotel because I was not aware there are six different hotels named "Ramada Maingate." So I feel a bit mislead when booking but overall the quality was great. The proximity was disappointing because I thought I had booked at a different location. But the hotel was great and the service was great.

Summary Heading: My husband and I checked in in the late afternoon and the...
Summary: My husband and I checked in in the late afternoon and the young lady attending to us was very personable and helpful with our questions. The room was very nice and clean except our room did not have a table where we could eat at. We returned after a concert in LA and found the parking lot full and had to park in an unmark stall. Other then that I would recommend this place to family and friends.

Stayed here many times.  The remodel is very nice but you pay for it.  Previously all rooms had a frig and a microwave.  Now you pay more for the privilege.  Used to be a discount at the Carrows next door.  We were told that we didn't ask upon ordering (waited till we checked out).....therefore it didn't count.  Extra charge also for more than one vehicle.  Definitely not the deal that it used to be, although very nice rooms.

Hotel wasn't great.  Room was stuffy and hot.  We had to sleep with the air conditioner on all night and then that made my husband and I both have sore throats and runny noses for 3 days.  We didn't get our room serviced because we didn't want the staff in our room, so I called the front desk for towels at 8am the next day and they said they would not bring us towels and we had to go to the front desk and get them ourselves.  I thought that was pretty tacky.  We asked at check-in if a king bed was available and they said yes, but they wouldn't give it to us because we booked on hotwire.  The whole experience was weird.  Won't be returning even though the location was close to disneyland.  I would rather pay more to stay at a nicer hotel that values their guests.
The front desk staff did not give eye contact and I felt like I bothered him when asking about local restaurants. The room was very clean.

everything was perfect. room had 2 queen beds. and a little chai with ottoman under it. just the right size. only 2 complaints.  no bags in the trash cans....but i had my own and just put them in before i threw my trash in there.  and each day around 7-8; the towels were brought to our rooms. we didnt need them till late at night and early in the am for our showers. not bothered me much. but just kinda weird.  I didnt see a elevator. i was with 3 kids and a stroller.  but we used the stairs. And we were all ok with that.  Just pointing that out.  It was very clean.  Not as close as i thought it was going to be to Disneyland and we decided to go with the bus. Cheaper and less headache to deal with than paying $15 for parking....and walking 15 minutes .  It was a great experience.

I was pleasantly surprised by the clieanliness, the furnishings and how quiet this hotel was.  It was about 1/3 of a mile from Disneyland and the ART bus shuttle was very close. I would definitely stay here again, Nice room, good service and clean.
Hotel looked ok from the ou5size, but pleasantly surprised by the rooms. Comfortable beds and great air. Watched Disney's fireworks from the balcony.

Found the Ramada very clean and the location was fabulous! Fireworks at Disneyland were well visible and very entertaining.  Restaurant next door had delicious meals, inexpensive and portions huge! Staff at Ramada were very helpful and friendly. Will definitely stay here again!

Summary Heading: Every thing is fine like location, room  services...
Summary: Every thing is fine like location, room  services etc...  Only one thing need to improve thag is breakfast section. Breakfast is not good at all.

The staff were friendly and helpful.  The AM staff for our visit, Michelle, informed us to a great deal, to ride the ART bus to Disneyland for $5/ticket  This was great because Disney is rite down the street.  I suggest because u can ride as many times needed until 3AM.  So if you want to visit the Packing district nite life, you'd be able to as well.

We really enjoyed our stay here, it was neat to watch the Disney Fireworks each evening and it was a good central location for things in Anaheim. The breakfast was forgettable and I only went in once. Some decent spreads and cereals and yoghurt would help here. Pool was good but didnt seem to get tidied up much. Rooms were excellent . Good size new AirCon, Good showers and other amenities. Good to have laundry services too. Front desk staff were very good also.
I'm very pleased to stay during my trip.  Room is clean and fresh.  All staffs are good services.  Michele at front desk is knowledgeable.

The hotel was in a perfect location if u r going to Disney parks. The walk is about 20 min or so. The rooms were decent and beds were comfy. My only issue was that we got called twice from the front desk to be told that we were making too much noise which wasn't true. We had just came in from Disney parks and were getting settled for bed. Other than that this was an ok stay.

I was a little weary of a hotel for such a good value and so close to Disneyland.. I was surprised from the helpful workers to the modern clean room. It was a full hotel when we stayed and it wasn't noisy at all. The only thing is be for warned that breakfast is continental only, waffle maker, cereal, pastries, and few types of juice. It was packed at breakfast and it states you have to eat in the room, well there was not seating so we went back to our room. I felt no one (as in guest) had any idea they weren't the only one staying at the hotel. They were taking anything they saw on the counter. So get there early if you want to eat. Even though it's supervised she didn't do or say anything and was very slow re stocking.
Great clean hotel with excellent customer service! Exceptional value. Michelle at the front desk was so polite!

I was nervous when this was the hotel I had won from Hotwire because I had heard bad things about the Ramada's in the area but when I arrived I was pleasantly surprised. Check-in was fast and easy and they allowed the deposit to be cash or credit. The rooms were clean and a good size. The beds were comfortable, one being more firm than the other. The room had a good size refrigerator and a microwave, hair dryer and coffee maker. The continental breakfast was juice, coffee, milk, 2 kinds of cold cereal, oatmeal, danish's, donuts, toast and waffles. Basic but great for the price. This was my first time staying on the North side of Disneyland but I really liked that there was less traffic and it took two rights and a left and I was in the Mickey and Friends parking lot. There was

We spent 5 days at this Hotel during our Disneyland Visit, We visit Disneyland at least 2 times per year so We stayed at a lot of different hotels around Disneyland but it was our first time staying at this one. Lady at the front desk I believe her name was Michelle, she was really nice and helpful, Property is clean and quiet (except around 9:30pm, that's when you can hear and see the fireworks at Disneyland) You can see the full show from the Hotel parking lot! Pool was clean and water temperature was perfect, they don't have pool towels outside but if you go to the front desk they'll give you some. Free Parking and you can buy shuttle tickets at the front desk for a very good price, 3 day pass is $12 per adult and $3 per kid. Room was a good size, sink was separate from

Good service, great staff at the front desk. Continent breakfast was good.  AC ran like a champ. Newer remodeled rooms that were Very clean. Pool was awesome.  Only negative thing I can say is the beds were hard as a rock.

Summary Heading: good place but don't confuse with other Maingate
Summary: I thought we were directly across from the walk in to the parks- but we were booked for the NORTH loacation which we found out only after getting to the park location.  My first opinion of that one was that it was pretty noisy, the pool was in the center and really noisy with traffic on all sides, there was not a parking spot to be had (lines of standstill cars waiting for a spot) so it took an additional 30 min for me to get to a spot where I illegally parked to find out that my reservation was not at this location. insert frown face here  we were directed a few miles north on Harbor to the sister hotel to the NORTH and were pleasantly surprised with the quietness, the nice staff, I had called before to get a room on second floor with micro and fridge and was given just that.

Not at par with the Ramada worldwide hotels. The breakfast was horrible and was just for the sake of adding "incl BF" in the tariff. The rooms dont have the proper curtain due to split AC's fitted wrongly resulting into sunlight getting into your room early morning. So if you want to sleep beyond 5 am......use eye mask...

Myself my wife and my kid arrived to check in at 8:30pm on Monday June 9th 2014. We were giving the key and were checked into room 119. When I opened the door there were luggage and personal belongings everywhere there was another family already staying there. We informed front desk and they didn't even apologize.  I was just checks into room 119. I have no faith in this hotel company anymore and not only will i not stay there ever again. I will be sure to recommend any friends family and over 300 Facebook followers not to either. There was also people smoking drugs by the dumpster when I went to my car to get my phone charger.

We had a great stay at this Ramada location!  Rooms really nice and big, very clean.  The free breakfast buffet is great when traveling with kids and the pool was nice.  The housekeeping staff even spread out our blankets for us on the bed as we brought our own blankets & pillows.  Definitely recommend this spot and you can't beat their room rates!

We arrived at 11:30pm and had to wait for the room to be cleaned. No towels, front desk refused to bring towel said no staff at 8am, and when I went to get the towels no washclothes. Promised a maid would bring them never showed. To make it worse dirty pillow cases.

Summary Heading: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room. I...
Summary: I was pleasantly surprised by the quality of the room. I have never stayed at a hotel that cost under $100 a night and I was pleased to see that the quality of the room itself was comparable to a much more expensive hotel. I wish there were better breakfast foods, a hot tub, and shuttle service to disneyland, but you get what you pay for.

Our room was very clean, the beds were very Comfortable & pillows too. The pool was away from the rooms which was a plus! I loved that the shower & toilet were separate from the bathroom vanity! Remodeled recently too!

The room was very clean,  soft towels, fridge and microwave. We stayed four nights with our kids the breakfast was good. The pool was okay, we were able to see the fireworks from there. The stuff was very friendly. The only issue was the walls because we were able to hear everything from the other rooms tvs, kids crying, and people walking in second floor, etc. Great place to stay for the price we paid, we'll definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: We stayed with a group of friends had 5 rooms and had a...
Summary: We stayed with a group of friends had 5 rooms and had a great time! Was very easy traveling with all our children.

Okay place to stay for one night. Rooms were pretty clean and free breakfast was okay. There was some sketchy people there though and I think they were living there which made me and my girlfriend feel kind of uncomfortable. Other than that it was just an average stay.

The free breakfast was a little week. Basic donuts toast cereal and 1 waffle iron but free is free I suppose.  The walk to disneyland was a bit much especially in 100 degree weather so I am really glad we rented a car. The hottest day of the week (105) the maid came in our room and shut off the air conditioner I was not overly happy about that. We hung our do not disturb on the door after that. The maid took all the dirty towels and did not replace them and the one time she did she only gave us 3 there were 4 people in the room so every day I would have to go to the front desk to get towels :( I would not choose this hotel to stay at again :\
No complaints with our stay. Was great for the price. Had fridge and microwave that is always a plus and continental breakfast. Short walk from disneyland.

My wife and I booked a room on short notice.  As we had called their phone number, which was at first an automated number which was then farmed out to someone who I could barely understand, and barely understood us, the booking of the room was difficult.  We verified three times over the phone that she had the correct address of the hotel we were looking at online.  She asked for my email to send me a confirmation, I gave my email address, when she read it back to me it was incorrect, so I corrected her, verifying an additional time what my email address was (which mind you is not difficult at all), I never received a confirmation email at all.  Which did not surprise me.  Upon driving out of state to stay at the hotel we had booked over the phone at the address that we had

I called Ramada Maingate North Friday before our scheduled stay to ensure that I am getting the room I requested which is adjoining room. I talked to Michelle personally to ensure and confirm that the room they will give me is adjoining rooms due to I have a 3 yr old granddaughter and I don't want her to go out the room to se us. I want her to have the luxury of going in and out of our room and her parents room. With all the calling and confirming that I get adjoining room. When we heck in we were given rom 103 and 104 which is NOT what I asked for. I asked the girl if I can speak with the manager, no manager was on duty, so I asked for phone number called Sam left him a voice message to call me back, Sam did not call back instead his assistant manager called. She will not even

Summary Heading: Hotel was close to the park, affordable, adequate for...
Summary: Hotel was close to the park, affordable, adequate for students and couples looking for a roof. Breakfast okay- mostly relied on do it yourself waffle maker every day, but lineups to make a waffle could get long. Not a lot of seating in breakfast area. Overall satisfied with quality for amount we paid.
We love the room the room was clean and quiet at night the beds aré the best and we really liked the pool we will come back next year.

Summary Heading: This is a great place to stay.  Close to Disneyland...
Summary: This is a great place to stay.  Close to Disneyland.  Clean, clean, clean rooms, even the bathtub shined.  Will stay here again.

Summary Heading: Location was good, but the rooms need a lot of cleaning...
Summary: Location was good, but the rooms need a lot of cleaning, very dirty carpets, towels were like cardboard, shower did not drain, very noisy

Summary Heading: Don't judge a book by its cover
Summary: I was concerned when I drove in, I needn't have been, the rooms were fresh and clean, comfy bed. Breakfast basic but good and close to Disneyland. Pleased with our stay

Summary Heading: Good value for money. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Clean...
Summary: Good value for money. Clean rooms, friendly staff. Clean corridors. Small breakfast area, waffle quality not good. No eggs for breakfast.

Upon check in was given the keys to the room that was not cleaned. Asked for service to room who came and only emptied the trash and vacuumed did not change out towels or linens. The shower would not drain asked office to fix they said they would send a maintenance person who never showed. Two hours if walking on the carpet my socks turned black. Apparently the carpet is never cleaned. In the reservation it was requested to be located near another persons reservation and we were placed on complete opposite ends. Breakfast room opened at 630 and most food was not available until 700. Would be good to know when booking room that the fireworks go off right behind the hotel as it sounds like explosions going off at 930pm when our kids were sleeping.

Pros: Room decor is updated, modern and clean. Front desk clerk was helpful, Wifi works well, parking is OK, pool is small but pleasant. At night you can see Disney fireworks from property.  Cons: Breakfast was dismal, one of the reasons we booked to stay here. Room is too small, there were only cereal, Waffle and some Danishes. IMO this hotel should not advertise that it offers free breakfast with the items it intends to offer. Also the wall between is not sound proof, we could hear the neighbors.   Other: This hotel was just outside of the busy "Disney-District" I wouldn't recommend walking to the park but doable,

It's a 5 minute shuttle to Disney & quick return as well. For about $100 a night, it's a no frills option. Perfect if you spend time actually seeing sites & not sitting at the hotel. They could really use a second waffle maker!

The updated rooms were nice and included a refrigerator and microwave.  Not within walking distance to Disneyland but it is an easy and quick drive.  The only complaint during our stay would be the breakfast.  It is extremely lacking in options.  Basically one waffle maker, cereal, and toast.   We ended up eating at Carrow's next door after the first day since having a good breakfast helped before heading to Disneyland.

OK.  When I think of a Ramada, I usually think a decent hotel. I don't think of a 25-year-old Motel 6 with the Ramada sign outside. The key point to this review is the fact that if you want around in the room with there, your feet turned black. That's right, black. Really? This is ridiculous. Ever hear of using the vacuum?
This hotel will do if your not looking for anything too fancy. The room includes a microwave & mini fridge, plus complimentary breakfast! Friendly staff, would stay again.

Summary Heading: The room was a room. I was disappointed in the fact that I...
Summary: The room was a room. I was disappointed in the fact that I was not told that there was an extra fee for roll away bed until I arrived. It was not in my room as I had confirmed that it would be. Although there is a shuttle to Disney they do not advertise that there is a fee - it was cheaper to park at Disney than take a shuttle. The parking is less than desirable - there is not enough parking spaces for even one car per room.

Summary Heading: Paper thin walls but very nice rooms
Summary: Our family visited Disneyland and all points tourist a couple of weeks ago and decided to stay at this hotel after getting a great deal a couple of months prior.  Sure I read the reviews and was aware that there was an issue with noise but wow was there a lot of it.  The rooms were absolutely awesome, had a fridge and microwave and were clean.  The problem is the noise.  You could have your TV on low and the neighbors would have been able to hear it.  We heard every word of the spanish show the neighbor was watching.  The neighbors above had small children who they allowed to run back and forth until 1 in the morning when I finally had to call the frontdesk.  I had ear plugs in and still heard the noise from the neighbor next door and above.  Didn't have a very good sleep.

Our recent stay was okay.  I was skeptical when I entered the office.  It didn't look clean...i.e windows dirty, dusting needed etc...  The hotel room was better.  Towels are limited and not the softest.  I was looking for a high protein breakfast and was disappointed when only carbs where available.  Overall...it was okay for the price.  $235 for 3 nights.  And, only a mile from DL.

2 Queens,a bit tight but nice & modern ,good working order. Staff accomodating& breakfast was good for continental ..could walk but didn't factoring in the late night tired factor..parking spaces too tight only real negative
Nice friendly staff. Very close to Disneyland (15 min walk). Rooms are very clean and comfortable. Breakfast could be better but with kids that eat cereal it will do just fine.

Our room was clean and well kept but the parking lot was being repaved and there was almost no where to park. When I expressed this to the front office they were less then helpful. This was not our first stay at this establishment so I would think they would have been a little nicer to guest that have stayed there 3 times in 6 months.
I enjoyed my stay here.  Clean room, fresh towels and soap.  Continental breakfast was good.  Parking lot was a little small but able to get parking space. Staff was very professional.

This hotel is very clean, newly updated, and very close to Disney Land. I was very happy with the service, the room and how they cleaned the room everyday. The breakfast room was a little funny to get to, and the breakfast was very simple. Nothing wrong with it, but if you were looking for bagels, or anything different, you won't get it here. The customer service was great, and any questions you had, they are more then willing to answer your questions. It was nice that you could kinda see the fireworks from the hotel. However, if you have a baby, which we did, that also meant that you could hear them. Saying that, I am not sure you can really get away from that anywhere, as fireworks are loud. Lol. There is absolutely nothing wrong with this hotel. Just don't expect the normal

This was a great stay that is very close to Disneyland. It can be within walking distance to the park. It is quite a walk, but atleast if you do, you do not have to pay for parking. Also, the rooms looked completely renovated, nice, and new. The breakfast in the morning was ok, but appreciated the breakfast as it is free with your stay. Overall very good experience!

Rooms were clean, beds were comfortable, room ammenities were good, and location was great.  The entire hotel staff, and most notably Michelle, were very friendly and helpful in assisting us and answering any questions we had about the area.  Breakfast offerred could have been a little better, but we didn't go there for the food anyway and a Carrows is next door if a hot breakfast is desired.  Would definitely return to this hotel next time we visit this area.

Summary Heading: Very comfortable beds. The only dissapointment was the fact...
Summary: Very comfortable beds. The only dissapointment was the fact that the towels were of poor quality. Expected better from a Ramada.

We have returned from a rain soaked week at Disneyland ! They have not had rain for the 6 months prior to our arrival, but it rained everyday except the day we left...go figure. For this trip we stayed at the Ramada Maingate North. Located (Harbor & Ball) a short 14 minute walk from the entrance to Disneyland.  The motel has been renovated and just the lobby has yet to be done.  Our room was very clean. No bed bugs !!! I am always worried about those pesky critters. The cleaning staff had our room cleaned and ready before we returned everyday from the park. Two thumbs up for them. The front desk staff was very helpful. ART buses (Anaheim Resort Transportation) are great. Passes are available at the from desk. After you buy your pass you can ride any of the buses all day. They
Very nice place to stay. Rooms were stylish and clean. The breakfast bar was very nice especially the waffle machine.

My friend and I took our two special needs' children to Disneyland and stayed at this hotel.  The staff were very kind, and provided great customer service.  The breakfast had a variety of different food, which our kids loved!  The pool was nice and warm.  We walked to Disneyland, pushing a stroller and wheelchair, and it was a little bit of a walk, but definitely not too much.  We had a great trip!

The staff and room were satisfactory. We were not in the room for most of the day, but the design and room were updated and modern, which was very pleasant to travel with. The only negative about our trip was the beds, the mattresses were extremely firm and our party had uncomfortable and restless nights. With this exception, our experience was enjoyable and we will look at this hotel next time we travel to Anaheim.

The room was renovated and spotless, beds were clean and very comfy. The bathroom area was very nice with new tile, and everything was spotless in the bathroom - new tile, new paint, no mold or mildew in sight! Front desk staff was very helpful at check-in and walked extra towels and pillows to our room late at night. I only have two complaints: first, is that the breakfast room is extremely small for the number of guests at this hotel, so it was very crowded. There is only one waffle maker, and space is limited, so you have to go very early for breakfast or plan on waiting in line. Don't plan on stopping in for a quick bite before heading to Disney parks unless you're okay with a danish or cake doughnut eaten in the car. Otherwise, it will take you some time to wait in line and

Your staff was GREAT. your hotel was not, paper thin walls. Looks great on the outside and inside but banging, screaming and TV on all night. No I tried with you and will never stay at this location again. You staff again was outstanding.

The room wasn't ready when we got there.  We had to wait an hour for it to be cleaned. We got there around 4pm.  Once in our room it was a nice place to stay.  The free breakfast was good, the location was great, close to Disney.  The staff was friendly and the price was fantastic.  I would stay here again. Most of all it was clean. The resteraunt carrow's across the parking lot was an added bonus.  they had big portions for a decent price. We had a big group and they kept us all close an accomodated us with extra towels and such as we needed. Thanks Richard for all your help.

The service was great at the front desk area. One girl helped me to find an address where I needed to pick up a friend. Another helped me to find a store in order to get a memory card. Those situations were not part of their job but both of them helped me and were very friendly. One night I was cold, I ask for a blanket and a gentleman brought me 2 instead, it was perfect! The person in charge of cleaning our room was very good. The lady that was at the breakfast area was very kind as well. And we also like the room. We were out during the day visiting different places but it was always nice to be back every night.

Your room had everything we need and more.  your towels were the finest we have ever used,  The lady that made waffle's for us did a perfect job and was so nice.  we will tell all our friends what a wonderful place you have..  Millie

This was exactly what I expected from this hotel. Good quality service. Clear rooms. Nothing over the top. Breakfast was reasonable. Make your own waffles, cereal, toast, pastries, and juice/coffee. Very close to disneyland
The place was great and the staff was very friendly and helpful. It's quite close to Disneyland and next to an ART bus stop.

The hotel was clean and the rooms were nicer than expected.  The breakfast was great, staff friendly.    I had a car, so the location was fine.  Dont think its "walking distance" to Disneyland though.

Summary Heading: A pretty good place to stay.
Summary: It's not too far from Disney, if you have a parking pass near by. The breakfast was good, but always over-crowded, and we went during the off-season. It is probably much more crowded during travel season.  The room was clean and comfortable. There were great movies on HBO to watch while relaxing after walking around Disneyland all day. The staff was nice enough, and check in was easy. Based on our experience, the hotel was fairly priced.

Stayed here because it was billed as being close to Disneyland, but it is not a convenient distance. Hotel isn't served by Disneyland Resort Express so we had to walk our bags up the street to catch the shuttle back to LAX.  Breakfast was nothing to write home about. We would not stay here again for a Disneyland vacation.
The staff was great with service and giving directions for Disneyland and the many dining options in the area.
Our room was large and clean.  The housekeeping was very efficient.  The front desk was prompt and courtious.

Room was great. Nice and big.  We only needed  it for one night then to take the shuttle to the Airport.  Quick ride to Newark. On the way back with the shuttle was not so good.  We waited for an hour at 11pm with our 2 year old.  we were not the only ones waiting that long.  There were lots of people waiting for the same shuttle.  They filled  up one to standing rom only and said he would be back in 10 minutes. We waited another 20 minutes or so then got on. In the time we waited we saw tons of others shuttles picking up families over and over again.    If you are just needing the room then I would say 'GREAT,  Stay here!'  If you need a shuttle from the Airport, I would suggest you do more research.

We were not expecting anything special from this hotel, and found it to be very good for the money.  The room looked recently refurbished and was very clean and tastefully decorated.  All three interactions I had with people at the front desk were very positive.  When we asked for extra blankets, we got them very quickly.  Breakfast is basic, but they did have a waffle maker, which was nice.  It's about a mile to the Disneyland parks, and a pretty easy walk.  I would recommend staying here if you are in the area.

Clean snd comfortable,  quiet, bed was great,  recently remodeled,  we had 7 rooms for trade show,  everyone was pleased with their rooms.  Rooms were cleaned daily,  would definitely recommend.   Also,   decent restaurant on site,  Shakeys Pizza 100 yds away and lots of other options snd conveniences within 1/4 mile.

We planned to stay in Ramada for 3 nights to visit the Disneyland Resort, all the budget rooms close the the main gate were fully booked. I saw the review of this hotel isn't that good, but anyway, we still booked it due to limited budget and choices. When we arrived the hotel, it was little surprising. The room looks very nice, clean, newly renovated, bathroom is clean. Free parking. It took about 15-20 mins to walk to the main gate of the Disneyland. Little bit far if you spent the whole day walking around in the theme park, anyway, I feel it's still acceptable, considering such this competitive room rate.  Breakfast is ok, pancake, bagels, donuts, apples, corn flakes, juices & coffee.

Summary Heading: It was a good value.  Close to Disneyland, although I...
Summary: It was a good value.  Close to Disneyland, although I didn't really like the route to walk to Disneyland.  Rooms were clean.

this hotel is a jewel amongst hotels that are a little rough! Perfect location you could walk to Disneyland but just driving the short distance is best.  the rooms are good size and you can get an additional rollaway for an extra guest.  The rooms were updated and very clean and the staff were friendly and accomodating and very helpful, there is a restaurant on the property corner and very nice but dated prices are good for that close to Disney. Can't beat the area you can easily get out of the traffic after your visit to Disney close to freeway on and off ramps.

Summary Heading: A little farther from Disneyland than I thought, but...
Summary: A little farther from Disneyland than I thought, but do-able! Watching the fireworks from the hotel balcony every night was a bonus!

We really enjoyed our stay this year as we have been coming to this hotel for a annual 5 day trip the last 3 years. The Staff was very helpful this year and the room had been renovated as was very pleasant. Would reccommend to anyone who was looking for a good value and great service!
