The service has been a little sketchy in the past so I hope they keep up the great work!

Staff was completely professional, friendly and accommodating, room was immaculate, clean and extremely comfortable. Breakfast was simple but satisfying, easy check in and out...will definitely stay there again!
Stayed 2 nights while visiting Disneyland and I was extremely satisfied with my stay. Staff was professional and friendly. Stayed in a 2bed Queen room which was very clean.

Located very close to Disney Land, and transportation available for low fee at motel. It's sponsored by City of Anaheim and has good schedule. The street is busy and a bit noisy, but has great view of nightly fireworks at Disney Land. No sleeping before 9pm beautiful but loud!

We changed hotels half way through our stay to the Ramada.  We were pleasantly surprised. It was very convenient access to transportation to Disneyland and the rooms where very clean and comfortable.  The staff was very pleasant and helpful.
A little longer walk to the Main Gate of Disneyland than we expected, but clean facility, comfy beds, quiet property.  Continental breakfast good, and very courteous staff.

Summary Heading: We loved this hotel! The people were very accommodating and...
Summary: We loved this hotel! The people were very accommodating and friendly! It was an amazing value and would definitely recommend friends and family to stay here.
Was really accommodating however expected to be on another property and ended up about a mile away from where I wanted to be... Otherwise, great service and a good rest.

Every time we go to Disney parks we stay here. Great location. Same parking lot as an IHOP. Hotel provides waffles, cereal, otameal, oj, apple juice, coffee, and donuts. My boys loved it. Spacey rooms. Very clean. Walking distance from a store. Beds are comfy and restroom is always clean. Loved the stay because the shuttle to Disney parks picks us up in front every 20 minute. Always going back!
The hotel bed has horrible. the location on the hotel doesn't make for an easy walk to Disneyland

The room had ants. We talked to the front desk in the morning about this and were advised that they would handle the matter. The ants mostly disappeared by that evening when we returned. The "continental breakfast" has quite a bit to be desired. Fruitloops, Corn Flake, a few donuts, coffee, orange juice, and an apple was the menu from which to choose. Otherwise, the stay was what should be expected for an average hotel.
At 600 in the morning found out the shower didn't work.  Was told no one could fix it until 8:00. Finally found us another room but morning manager was not nice about it.
My family and I stayed at this hotel for a night on our trip to Disneyland. Overall, the room was clean but the iron board was dirty. The neighbors were way too loud.

Summary Heading: just ok, not that great of service, we had no towels after...
Summary: just ok, not that great of service, we had no towels after they cleand the room. they had to wash them and bring some later ???

You cannot find a better hotel for the price. Clean and modern rooms.  The staff is friendly and it's far enough from Disneyland to not deal with hussle and bustle of the park but also close enough to the park to get rest after a day at Disneyland.  The exterior of the hotel is deceiving because it looks like the rooms would be old and musty; which is not the case. I'll definitely stay there again
Great customer service, all personnel was attentive and courteous.   The beds super comfortable. ..Overall excellent stay. Thank you!

the girl @ front desk was awesome,very helpful w/directions.Wish there was an ice machine near our room-I like my coffee iced,the little map they give you said there was an ice machine by our room but there wasn't & I had to walk all the way to the front,annoying,Also a dirty handprint on the back of the bathroom door

Clean, neat, and very convenient to Disneyland. Nothing special or luxurious but the price was right, and the service was excellent, they even called me when I was late arriving to make sure we were still on our way. I'd stay there again.

Summary Heading: We are very pleased with this property. It was our third...
Summary: We are very pleased with this property. It was our third stay there and has met all our expectations.

Miles away from Disneyland. Don't make the mistake as this is NOT RAMADA MAINGATE which is at the gate.   Richard manager overcharged and made charges to credit card without authority after we left have spent weeks trying to reverse.   Service was appalling. Rooms filthy and cleaned once in 5 days.   Breakfast which is included is terrible. There are plenty of other good hotels at same rate near Disney.   We had an infant and the front desk rang at all hours of the night for ridiculous petty requests.   Very very noisy and the smell was awful no food anywhere nearby so if you are going to stay expect to pay an extra $50 per day in taxis.   If you stay here don't expect an enjoyable trip. After all day at Disney to come back to this hole was just a nightmare

Summary Heading: Great stay at a really nice price
Summary: For the price, I wasn't expecting much. However, I was very pleasantly surprised to find a newly remodeled room with beautiful decor. I liked that there were no bed spreads on the bed but they did put a type of cover at the foot of the bed for decoration. Instead, there's a sheet, blanket and another sheet over the blanket. Very clean and I didn't have to worry about the cleanliness of it. Also, the beds were very comfortable; I slept very well. Good selection for breakfast items as well; not just danish, there was waffles, cereal, fruit, juice and coffee. My husband, 12 yr old daughter and I spent 4 nights here while spending the days at Disneyland. We go to Disneyland every year for a week and stay at a different hotel every time. This is one hotel that we'd definitely come

Not quite what I expected.  Not as close to Disneyland as reviews I read indicted.  It is not just across the street and/or 5 minutes.  Walk is not too bad if you are with a group.  Would not want to walk this alone or with a small child without a man present.  Very exhausting walk home after a day at the park.  Free breakfast left much to be desired.  Lucky if we got an apple one of the four mornings we were there.  Fruit was hard to come by.  The waffles are great if that is what you want.  Not much else.  Toast with butter/jam.  Would most likely not stay at this hotel again.

We got a good last minute deal. And you get good value for money! Room was large, clean and had what we needed. Coffe maker, fridge, cable tv and free wifi. Complimentary breakfast is sugar and carb loaded. Eat only if you have no other choice!

Great value for a nice place close to Disney. Was the best deal I found and no hidden extras such as parking make the extra 10mins to walk to Disney worth it. Breakfast was the real basics so nothing great there, but the Carrows next door was great value.
It was near the Disney Land. We can walk to there. It took about 10-15 minutes. The room was simple and free breakfast was not bad. Hot waffle was good.
We were in this hotel for 3 nights and was a Disney trip. The rooms were well maintained and clean. Breakfast was not up to the expectation and bit disappointed. But its OK. I will come back again.

Room was clean, quiet and comfortable.  Not at all close to Disneyland, but the ART stop was right outside and very convenient.  This is a great place to stay if you're looking for a good value and a nice place to sleep.  I wouldn't recommend it if you are looking for a luxury resort.  Don't let the "free breakfast" fool you - it's mainly donuts and sugar cereal.

This is a good value for the location.  We had ants in the bathroom but it looked and smelled clean.  The service desk personnel made it easy to get the room in the back with little noise and non-smoking as requested.

Summary Heading: * Basic services. Good value for money* Clean room. No bad...
Summary: * Basic services. Good value for money * Clean room. No bad odor. * Free parking * Complementary breakfast.  * Microwave/Refridgerator/iron w/board / hair dryer in the room.

Summary Heading: i enjoyed my stay in this hotel as well as my family..front...
Summary: i enjoyed my stay in this hotel as well as my family..front desk people were very friendly and helpful..room was clean as well as the bed..towels were clean but kind of old..breakfast served was healthy...

Not the nicest of hotels but it suited our needs well. My biggest complaint was that the sink area of the bathroom was open to the rest of the room. Mom couldn't get ready for the day without waking everyone up with the light.  Shuttle Express dropped us off at the wrong Ramada Inn. There is a Maingate at the Park AND a Maingate North. My error, should have given an address rather than a name but the office staff at the Maingate at the Park was rude and not helpful. At night the office is closed so you have to deal with a person via a window (unlike Maingate North where they have a nice office open all hours - I had to stop in several times late at night). I had to walk to the correct Ramada Inn at 1:00 am with all my luggage and two very tired children

The room was clean and neat, and for the most part comfortable. The limited tv access was kind of annoying as most of the channels didn't work, the internet was slow so watching movies on Netflix on our tablets was also a wash. The front desk staff were friendly but the house keeping staff were gruff. The continental breakfast was limited as house keeping staff and renovation construction crews cleaned the limited selection of food out leaving things like apples for the guests to eat. There was only one Waffle maker as well making the weight time for a waffle (if there was any batter left) long. The Breakfast room it self was clean but very small and cramped as well. It was an OK stay as we only really slept in the room (since we couldnt do anything else) and spent the rest of

The rooms were clean and had a good night rest. The price was reasonable to the accomadations. Just needed a clean place to sleep without noise and thats what i got, not your usual Ramada, but good enough.
Got a great rate per night, the room was more than I expected. Very pleased with the service and cleanliness!
The inside of the room was recently renovated and clean.  Great for a Disney visit.  A restaurant right next door and a Shakeys on the other side.
Great value. Recently remodeled so rooms are great! No problems. There is a Carrows in the parking lot that was a great value and great service as well. We will stay again!

Summary Heading: Very clean nice location. Everything was as expected you...
Summary: Very clean nice location. Everything was as expected you paid for what you buy. Continental breakfast was lacking not really what I expected.
The room was clean and the staff was friendly.  Not much worth eating for breakfast.  We brought our own.

The room was better that what I expected. It was clean and smelled good. The beds we're also very comfortable and it came equipped with a refrigerator and microwave. Very convenient. Will look to book this room next time we're in this area.

Very please with our choice, rooms were spacious new renovated with great showers. Rooms cleaned to a good standard everyday. Reception were friendly and helpful. Nimisha was partially good. Close to ART buses and several restaurants close by. Would definitely stay again. Only downside was small breakfast room and choices could be improved.

Summary Heading: Its got good and bad.  I actually meant to book at a Ramada...
Summary: Its got good and bad.  I actually meant to book at a Ramada further south, but the names are almost exactly the same.....
The room was very clean and roomy. The bathroom was very clean. My family was very happy with this hotel.

Summary Heading: This was our second stay at the Ramada, I did enjoy and had...
Summary: This was our second stay at the Ramada, I did enjoy and had no issues. The bed however was hard and the the pillow's were to big, and poofy. I did wake up with a sore neck and back. other than that it was plesant

I was excited to stay at this hotel since the rooms were recently remodeled. The rooms looked nice, however, the carpet turned our feet black. We called the front desk to tell them about it and the manager on duty said he was surprised since the room had been remodeled. He said he would get it cleaned. We were gone all day the next day and when we came back, the carpet was still dirty. We went to the front desk the next day to ask them how they cleaned the carpet and that's when we were told that they were well aware of the problem and they only do a maintenance once a month. It was very inconvenient for us since we had our 2 year old with us who loves to walk around barefoot. We all had to wear socks or shoes all the time. They did not offer to move us to another room. Upon

Summary Heading: Good hotel to stay is not expensive is close to disneyland...
Summary: Good hotel to stay is not expensive is close to disneyland and also has a lot of stores an restaurants nearby

Summary Heading: The hotel was perfect except it was not across Disneyland...
Summary: The hotel was perfect except it was not across Disneyland.  My family did not want to drive to the park everyday.

The wife and I enjoyed the newly renovated room! Area is close to everything and the breakfast was clean and well maintained. Even though they had new rooms they were working on it was quite and clean. Not bad worth the stay

The room itself was decent other than the walls being very thin where we could hear everything our neighbors were saying and doing. The staff was not helpful at all othere than the cleaning staff. The desk staff and one woman in particular was very rude. The continental breakfast was terrible and not even worth going to. Also they hit me with other taxes and fees at check in even though the Ramada Reservation staff assured me their quote included all of these fees. Terrible stuation to be in when your family is tired and all other hotels are booked. I will not return to this location.

We really enjoyed our stay there. It is probably about a 15 minute walk to Disneyland. We didn't walk because we had parking passes. The room we stayed in was recently renovated and great. We enjoyed the continental breakfast. You can have danishes, donuts, cereal, and make belgian waffles. The breakfast alone saved us a lot of money. One bonus we loved is being able to see the Disney fireworks from the second floor. Really for the price, this place is hard to beat. We stayed recently at another property near the Anaheim convention center and paid twice as much for not a near as nice room.

When we were staying there. We noticed the first couple days that there were some ants here and there in the bathroom/sink area. We got rid of them and didn't think anything of it as we were barely in our room. On our 3rd morning there, we spent a good while in our room as we didn't have much going on and noticed hundreds of ants everywhere around the sink area. On the molding, the counter the corners of the walls...EVERYWHERE!! They were in all of our toiletry items. We spent the next 2 hours (time wasted in our stay) cleaning them out of our things!! I called and spoke to the general manager and he said they'd come in and spray while we were gone...great!! He also sent over a maintenance worker to come look at how bad it was. He told the manager that there was food

Not Professional OR Smart!... We called 3 weeks in advance and booked two rooms. When we got there at 12:30 a.m. we were given two rooms at total opposite ends of the hotel! We went there as a family. You would think with common sense when someone books 2 rooms they should be booked side by side. The rooms were not clean we had to kill 3 roaches. We were only given 3 towels when we booked a room with two twin beds which would equal 4 people. The breakfast needed more varieed. By the time we got to the VERY small breakfast romm an hour after it was opened there was hardly anything there to choose from except for cereal. I do like the renovations you guys have gone but there needs to be more renovations on your staff, the cleanliness, and maybe an upgrade of your breakfast room.

This was a great place for the money. The hotel staff was very friendly and always helpful. We were never treated like a bother even though we kept going back for more towels blankets and pillows.  The breakfast was filling and the kids loved the waffles.  The room was clean and nice and the beds were like sleeping on a cloud. ( very comfortable )  The pool was perfect and the kids had a blast!!  All in all it was a very good choice and I would stay there again.

Just slightly away from the Disneyland Resort, it is close enough to walk (15min) and far enough away to relax when the day is done.  Newly renovated rooms are excellent... flooring/carpets, bathroom, furnishings, heat/air. Only disappointment was a small flat screen TV...it seemed either an after thought or budget ran out.  They are also working on the grounds. The back have been landscaped nicely with sitting areas. The front and pool area need work...and a good cleaning. Seeing 90°+ temps and not being able to use the dirty pool was unfortunate.

Summary Heading: Excellent value for the money. Bed was slightly hard. Great...
Summary: Excellent value for the money. Bed was slightly hard. Great location for Disneyland. Shuttle to the park was super close.

This motel is north of Disneyland, 20min walk or 10min ART. Very friendly check in. Found our way to our room. Wow the motel is being renovated, everything brand new and very well appointed, almost luxury. For the price you cannot go wrong. Fridge, microwave, coffe maker, big comfy bed and super clean. And from the walkway you can watch the fireworks.  The pool looked small and OK, but were her for Disney. Which you can book tickets in reception on their Disney site and print them, the also sell the ART tickets.  Breakfast was OK nothing special but filled you up for a long day. Carries restaurant next door is was good for standard food. Not much else around food wise. Would definetly return.

This was the nicest room for the price that I have ever stayed in. The place was beautiful. The area seemed very safe. Restraunt next door. The rooms have just been redone and the workmanship was out standing. Front desk was very nice as we did a late check in. It is less than 1 mile from Disneyland and we paid less than $70. Much better than I was expecting.

The room was nice since the remodel. Clean and not too hot, not too cold. Having a mini fridge and microwave was nice.  There was a tour group staying near us and they would smoke in front of our door. The smoke would come in our room. Called front desk, didn't do too much until the last day, gave us a discount then.

I read all the bad reviews for this hotel i could find and at first i wasn't to sure i wanted to take my family there.when you drive up it's not the prettiest hotel there is but the inside of the room was very clean didn't have any funny smells nothing like that plus the staff is great didn't have any problems at all. the only thing i would say that i didn't like was the breakfast room only having one waffle maker and sometimes it takes 30 mins or more that you have to wait to make your waffles. but the good thing is that my family really enjoyed there stay which is the most important part.

The room was very nice - newly refurbished, clean, comfortable, nice shower, and plenty of room.  TV was flat screen with great picture.  The staff was exceptionally nice and very helpful.  They did offer a shuttle to Disneyland for $5.00, but we were able to walk to Disneyland - about 1 mile.  Good complimentary continental breakfast.

Great room and price. Nice clean room, nice big comfy king size bed. Flat screen but i couldnt find the remote. Nice bathroom. Its close by disneyland so you will hear the fireworks if you dont mind the loud noise, but i Enjoyed my stay.

Summary Heading: ants, spiders, and told I would not be charged, yet I was. hotel wont refund
Summary: Arrived with no prior knowledge of hotel. Booked through ramada.com, as it was close to the main gate for a decent price. Little did I know that it would be a nasty place to stay. Booked 1 room for 2 nights.   Front desk guy was nice. We booked 2 queens because that's all they had at the time, he switched us to a king upon request.   First get in the door (room 220 I think), sit down for 5 mins checking laptop quickly for a place to eat. I get an ant crawling on my leg. No big deal. 2 min later, wife gets ant crawling on her on the bed. 3 mins later I have an ant crawling across my laptop....Search around, bathroom is infested with them. Long ant trail along the side of the tub to a crack in the wall. Go to front desk, ask to be moved. They apologize, and give me a new room.

Summary Heading: Excellent accomodations- close to freeways- close to...
Summary: Excellent accomodations- close to freeways- close to Disney. Very central for everything that we did. Would highly recommend this hotel. Friendly and knowledgeable staff- overall great experience. Thank you

Beds were comfortable. Front desk was helpful and polite. Room was super clean and provided everything we needed for our little vacation 5 mins tops from Disneyland. Discount at the restaurant next door with room keys. Overall experience was great definitely staying there again

We stayed at the Ramada in Anaheim Ca (Harbor and Ball)a week. The service was great and the bed was very comfortable. The room was cleaned every day and towels were always supplied. The management said it was remodeled at the beginning of summer and it was very nice. I would stay there again if I have a chance. Thanks -you

The room was comfy and serviced its propose  liked the free breakfast close to the park and not a long a walk to bus stop for parks staff couldve been more knowledge about the event in the area and the free bus service

Summary Heading: I arrive at 10:30am after traveling all night and the lady...
Summary: I arrive at 10:30am after traveling all night and the lady the front desk told me she would be more than glad to allow me to check in before the 3:00pm check in. She advised me a room would be cleaned by 11:00am and to come back and I would be able to check in early. I went across the way and had breakfast came back got my room. Beds were comfortable and my overall stay was plasant. Definitely will stay here again!!

Summary Heading: Average hotel situated in a low income area on one side...
Summary: Average hotel situated in a low income area on one side Disneyland on the other. Quiet, Older hotel but well kept. parking access was good.Close to area eating places and markets.

Unbelieveable bed bugs it was absolutely horrible. I got back with the wife and my two boys from Disneyland around 11 pm and my boys were sleeping so we go in the room and turn on the light and there all over the bed. I immediately went to lobby and told the staff and she did not look surprised at all. I checked out ASAP went back to the hotel and advised the manager and all he had to say was I went in this morning and did not see anything I explained to him do you really think I would check out at 11:00 pm with my two kids and showed him a picture he kept denying all of it advised that I would like a refund and said absolutely not. I took the liberty of knocking on everyone's door advising them of the problem and I am also taking it to the corporate level to see what can be

The room was clean, quiet, and close to Disneyland,  The bed was very comfortable and had 6 pillows that were big and amazingly soft, yet firm. I have a thing about clean bathrooms, and their's passed my test! The rate is reasonable.

We stayed 2 nights with my kids. The 1st day was ok, but the second day, sucks! Lobby receptionist called at 1130pm telling me that our neighbor complained about us banging on doors. Absolutely untrue. We were talking and laughing which is not really too loud. Our neighbors opened the double door partition on their end and banged 4 times very hard. Receptionist should've listened to our side first instead of accusing us altogether. What kind of place is this? I thought this was a free country. Me and my 2 kids cannot even have time to talk and laugh and have fun? This was supposed to be our vacation for the summer. My kids were terrorized and scared and had to hide right next to me because of the loud banging and plus the ringing of the phone from the lobby right after. The

For a 3 star hotel, this place was awesome. The beds were comfortable. A frig and microwave. It was nice to come back to a clean room after many days of sight seeing. We will come back here for our next trip.

Summary Heading: Richard, guy at front desk very helpful, courteous. Don't...
Summary: Richard, guy at front desk very helpful, courteous. Don't stay room 124, right behind laundry room, noisy early in the morning. Would go back.

The only good thing about this hotel was the location, It is close to Disneyland. The room was not clean, the mirror in front of the sink did not get cleaned once during our week long stay and the tub did not get cleaned either. The bed was kinda comfortable and the continental breakfast was a joke.
The room was clean and staff and house keepers was friendly.I will recommend this hotel and i will come back to this place on my next disneyland trip.

Summary Heading: our Disney hotel stay at Ramada Maingate North
Summary: Nice hotel for the cost.  Rooms have all been nicely remodeled.  Still has old smells though.  Had room behind hotel laundry that scared us at first and we could not hear each other talk or the TV.  The onsite mgr. "Kristine" pleasantly agreed to move us the next day when another room was available.  The next mgr. was not knowledgeable and gave us a hard time when we let her know we would like them to move us while we were at Disneyland (which was one of two choices the other mgr. had given us).  They have a nice continental breakfast that is open longer than most.  They need another waffle maker though since it's the only hot item available and everyone had to wait in line for a while to make one.  This hotel shares a parking lot with Carrows.  They have a great menu but it's

Summary Heading: Mr Lad,1st of all I was not looking for an upgrade to...
Summary: Mr Lad, 1st of all I was not looking for an upgrade to begin with! I simply would of been happy with a cleaner room. It became an upgrade issue when Nishima or Nimisha said because I did not pay a higher rate rooms were not available. So I said I will pay whatever it takes to get a better room. When I originally checked in Rosemary advised the customer before me they would be getting a newly renovated room... When I asked for a better room I was told it would happen on Tuesday 8/6. Not maybe, Not if I paid a higher rate. I was told I would get a better room by 11 am or after. I called on Tuesday before 11 to remind whomever on duty what I was told the night before.  A male took the call then said would call me back in ten minutes. Ten minutes passed and that is when Nimisha

Summary Heading: Nice rooms, good location. Wasn't impressed with the...
Summary: Nice rooms, good location. Wasn't impressed with the continental breakfast- very few items and ran out of food before breakfast was over.
very nice comfortable room, only issue with stay was parking stalls too tight and not enough

This hotel had all the amenities we were looking for:  Fair price,  heated pool, refrigerator, microwave, free breakfast, shuttle to Disneyland.  Rooms were clean and modern.  Sparkling pool.  Friendly &  staff.  Only complaint is that the breakfast room is way too small to accommodate that many guests, however breakfast is served until 10am.  We were very happy during our 3 day stay.

We recently stayed at the Ramada Anaheim Maingate North during our trip to Disney.  The room had recently been renovated and was very clean and nicely decorated.  The beds were comfortable and the room quiet.  The complimentary continental breakfast was appreciated to get our morning started and we liked having a microwave and fridge in our room.  We were able to watch the entire Disney fireworks from the balcony for those evenings that we wanted to leave the park early.  All in all, we were very satisfied with all aspects of our stay at the Ramada and would recommend this location.

The room was ok.  I did notice that my socks did get very dirty from the carpet.  I brought back my meal from a restaurant and threw away the take out box and that attracted ants.  So the last two days I had ants.  Also I left my card in the room.  When I went to the office to get another key, I was not asked for ID or even my name.  Only the room and I was handed two key cards.  This is NOT safe. I was a single worman traveling by myself.  That made me very uncomfortable.

Summary Heading: Overall our stay was very pleasant.   Enjoyed the...
Summary: Overall our stay was very pleasant.   Enjoyed the Disneyland Fireworks from our room on our first night.

Summary Heading: booked me in the wrong hotel
Summary: I was going for an overnight trip with my friend to disneyland. She has stayed at the ramada maingate at the park before so I took her recommendation. I called the 1-800 number and spoke to one of the reps. I had asked for the maingate at the park location because it was close. When we arrived to check in we were told that we did not have a reservation. I showed the girl at the counter my email from ramada and she responded with " sir your reservation is at the one down the street. That is the one you are at Ramada Maingate North." they have 2 Ramada Maingates on the same street. the girl told us that it happens alotand that there was nothing they could do. I went to the other location and he told me there was nothing he could do. Called the 1-800 number and asked to speek to a

Summary Heading: Very clean, comfortable bed and great furnishings.  If...
Summary: Very clean, comfortable bed and great furnishings.  If staying here and planning to walk to Disneyland, you should know that you have to cross several lanes of busy streets.  Not very safe traffic wise and a bit of a walk.  The property is great though.

Summary Heading: Poor Experience and No Sleep at Ramada Anaheim
Summary: Very Poor MOTEL!!!      I asked for a QUIET room when checking in as I had a very important meeting the following day and needed my rest.  Needless to say and due to the excessive noise, I was not able to sleep at all and was not able to properly prepare for my meeting.

I requested reservations in advance for the Ramada right across the street from Disneyland. Instead I got the Ramada that was across the bridge (Ball St). I complained to the receptionist but changing Hotels would do no good. I would still hv to pay for the reservation (2nights) at this specific Ramada. The staff was nice but needs to smile. The rooms were nice, the beds hard and uncomfortable. The outside just didnt make me feel safe at all. Ramada didnt care to fix their mistake so as a customer they lost my business. Breakfast was not good either unfortunately. But a nice restaurant is next to it.

Booked a 5 night stay there because it was within "walking" distance of the Disney park.  Nothing further from the truth.  We stayed one night, then booked the remaining nights at another hotel.  Staff was exceptional.  Nice and professional all the way around, too bad the hotel was the same.  Room was dated, the beds uncomfortable and there were ants all over the bathroom.  People upstairs were so noisy, finally at midnight I contacted the front desk, who handled it.  Breakfast was scary.  Too cramped where they serve it.  My grandkids said it was too unsanitary to eat the food and I have to agree.  While they can't stop the kids was touching everything, the set up made the person who had to keep stuff clean impossible.  I got coffee and made a fresh waffle (1 maker for all of
Excellent room (recently renovated), Very courteous employees.  I was very comfortable.  I would suggest the office provide courtesy water for customers.

We were on a Disneyland trip and needed to book an extra room for one night. We were extremely impressed with the hotels cleanliness.  Everything was fresh and newly updated.  The beds were very comfortable and the staff was very helpful and pleasant. We wished we had booked this hotel for our entire trip because when we did move to the other hotel we were very disappointed with it and it was $50.00 more expensive per night.    We will definitely stay here again.

Summary Heading: I didn't like the room, in the picture it showed a bigger...
Summary: I didn't like the room, in the picture it showed a bigger hotel but thos was a much smaller place. This is false advertising

Stinky room which STANK of pungent old cigarette smoke.  It had permeated the walls and soft furnishings and we actually had really tight chests when we were trying to sleep at night :(  As soon as we walked in to the room (even though was non-smoking!) we were hit with the stench.   We had requested a ground floor room but this was not done so ended up up a level which was annoying as we had many bags. No one helped us with our bags either.  The room which we expected, was old and tired. Needs updating very badly! Was pretty clean though.  The breakfast was the only good thing about this hotel!  We got a shuttle bus into disney which took 10 mins which was really convenient actually.  It was so cheap to stay at this hotel, so if you don't mind old cig smoke stench then book

Some of the rooms have been remodeled, so ask for one of those to avoid rooms with peeling wallpaper and dripping shower heads.  Even though they have upgraded, the noise level from the neighbors sounds like they are in your room.  If you looking for a quiet nights sleep...pass on this or bring Ambien!!  A call to the front desk can help quiet things down, but they can't control kids who are doing gymnastics off the bed at midnight.  Idiot parents think they are the only ones in the hotel!. If the hotel is full, they will clean your room, then bring towels later, as they don't have enough to replace them at the time. As for the breakfast...get there EARLY or its all gone!  Its supposed to go until 10:30, but there wasn't even milk for cereal after 10am. Only one waffel maker, so

I was extremely disappointed with this hotel and its misleading name.  I called the Ramada central reservation line and asked for the Ramada Maingate hotel right across from the park entrance.  I had seen this location on a prior trip to Disney and thought it would be very convenient.  Little did I know that they have multiple Ramada Maingates in Anaheim.  When I showed up on the evening of my reservation, I was informed that they did not have me in the system, and that there might be some confusion with another Ramada Maingate hotel designated with the modifier "North", down the road.  By the clerk's reaction, this name mix-up seems to happen all of the time, yet there was no sympathy since they were fully booked.  Sure enough, the other location did have my reservation, but

Nice reasonably priced hotel. The only problem was the lady making 7 waffles for her undocumented children in the breakfast room. Each waffle took about 3 minutes start to finish. They can use another machine

We were a late check in - 4 am. The night clerk was a nightmare. He sent us upstairs to the wrong area of the hotel. We had to make several trips up and down the stairs with my 75 year old mother and luggage. We woke to the pounding of cement due to the construction/remodeling of the hotel's exterior. (Which we were not informed of)  We immediately went to the front desk to complain.  We were told there were downstairs rooms available that had been available when we checked in.  The night clerk had informed us they had no down stair rooms open. They offered to move us. Lauren, one of the day clerks, showed us to a corner room which she felt would be quiet.  She was right.  It was a great room, far from construction.  The only issue was the tub kept backing up.  I noticed a

Summary Heading: The overall state of the room was very poor. The carpet was...
Summary: The overall state of the room was very poor. The carpet was dirty and left black residue on sites and bare feet. The sink countertop was sticky. The entire room needs to be remodeled.

I loved the water pressure and instant hot water in the shower! With refrigerator and microwave, very comfortable bed, and free parking, it was like home. I wish the pool could be open later (if people promise to be quiet). Convenient to Disneyland on the ART (Anaheim Rapid Transit). Staff very helpful and friendly.

Summary Heading: Update to previous review - they've made improvements!
Summary: Have been back off and on over the past 6 months, again to visit Disneyland.  Still like it because it's a reasonable price.  Still like it because it's an easy drive to the D-land parking lot we like.  But what's better still is the place has made improvements to many of its rooms!  Last time we stayed in a ground floor room along the right side (if you keep the office on your left).  They've updated much of the woodwork, moldings and appliances.  Updated the bed covering, carpeting, wall art and plumbing fixtures.  It's all looking pretty much of this century now.  We enjoyed our time.  Will still go back when we can, but they did increase the prices a bit to cover the renovations.  Guess it's gotta get paid for somehow.
I appreciated the fact that they had microwave oven and a refrigerator in the room.  These are amenities that most higher starred hotels don't provide.  Thank you.
Room and the bathroom where great. Swimming pool was clean. Night personal where not available or did not answer the phone and not sure to where things are.

Stayed just under a week which was very nice. Breakfast was good, service and hospitality was very good. Room was recently updated. Would of stayed a longer if there was a gym. You will have a great view of the Disney Land fireworks show.

We checked in late into our hotel room and did not notice at first with how filthy it was. The next day our kids were playing in the room after they just received a bath and we noticed there feet were dirty already. When I mean dirty there were black as if they were playing outside all day barefoot. We had to give the kids another bath and requested a refund. We couldn't get a refund since we went threw a third party. They did however give us a different room that was better but it still did not change our opinion that the hotel was filthy.

Went here for a 1 day stay. Service was good, Internet was good. I have a huge, king size bed, and the price was worth it, even cheap. Continental breakfast included apples, cereal, coffee, juice, etc. room was clean. And it was VERY close to Disneyland. It is 15 minutes to walk there. I woul recommend this place to anyone. It was worth it. You can see the Disney fireworks from hotel, but not the best view. This also means it can wake an early to bed person.

Summary Heading: Perfect hotel for a stay for a trip to Disneyland!  Walking...
Summary: Perfect hotel for a stay for a trip to Disneyland!  Walking distance from the park and a Starbucks....plus a great place to eat on hotel grounds, a Carrows
very nice and quite. Clean and close to disneyland. Staff very helpful and nice. If I was in the area I would stay there again.

Staff were excellent to deal with.  Room was clean and comfortable. Renovations were happening at the time which meant an earlier wakeup than planned, but overall a good place to stay.  Close to Disneyland

Summary Heading: Just average, good value for location
Summary: I booked this hotel by accident-I thought it was the Ramada closer to the Disneyland main gate. However, the room was recently redone, so that was nice. You can ride the ART bus the 1 mile or so to the park for a small fee, so that is convenient; especially if you have people who might go back and forth during the day. Breakfast was really lacking though. Only cereal, waffles, rice (why rice I can't imagine), fruit, assorted breads, coffee and juices. It would have been nice to see some eggs or sausage. Staff was VERY friendly. I doubt I would stay there again because I am happier walking into Disneyland that riding the bus.

The redecorated room was lovely and clean.  Accommodated all six family members well.  Staff was friendly and accommodating.  Was thrilled they  had found and saving my travel pillow for me.  Advance information on shuttling to and from Disney would have been helpful.  Possibly a printout of Disney and city shuttle bus schedules, etc.

I was very pleased with the comfort and cleanliness of the room. The bed was extremely comfortable and the pillows were fresh and plump. These are the things that are important to me when I stay in a room. The staff in the lobby were friendly and helpful with advice. The breakfast room had great stuff to eat like waffles and pastries, apple and orange juice, hot coffee, etc. The location is 1 1/2 blocks from Disneyland! I plan on staying again for sure.

I felt that the overall stay was great. My only concerns is that when booking the hotel I requested the Ramada Main gate across the street from Disneyland and I ended up about 1 mile away. When making the reservation make sure you are very specific on if you want main-gate or main-gate north. Overall great trip!
It was a good experience overall. The front desk should know what exit the guest should get off on for all major highways in the area.

Lovely,new,bright, friendly and great free hot breakfast. The sister property was under renovation, so we stayed just a couple of minutes down the street. The place was super. The price was fantastic and lots of room to roam.
Recently remodeled so rooms look great. Location to Disneyland is excellent.  One downs is only ice machine not working near our room so had long walk to the one that works near office.

Summary Heading: This room had been completely renovated and looked...
Summary: This room had been completely renovated and looked great. The staff is very pleasant and allowed me to check in early without any problem. The location and value is fantastic.

I was concerned to book this accomadation when I read the Trip Advisor reviews.  So when I booked I asked to be put in the newly renovated rooms.  We wanted this location because we are going to the baseball tonight at Angel stadium. I was appriehensive before arrival and have been really pleased with the hotel. Decor is great smells fresh and is very clean.  Great laundry. Sure there are still renovations going on but as yet they haven't inconvienienced us. Great work Ramada Main Gate North.

The carpet was detached from the walls, we found a sewing needle on the floor, the bathroom was gross. The paint in the tub was falling off. There was hairs from previous stayers on the wall in the tub. I was mortified by this hotel. With 3 children, I didn't like the quality at all. I also didn't feel safe. At 2 am there was a guy walking around the parking lot and went upstairs. The guy at the front desk had to chase him away saying he was going to call the cops. I will Never book a stay at this hotel again. And I DO NOT recommend it to anyone.

The staff was excellent. We needed a room early and they made sure we had two of three rooms ready by noon was awesome. The staff was very accommodating and nice. The rooms were very clean my feet did not turn black on the carpet. Was very nice and will stay here again.

Staff couldn't care less that all the noise, hammering, banging around of the construction happening in the room next to us.  My sister is disabled and we had to have a bottom room (no elevator) and she needs to sleep a great deal, she is awaiting a transplant, but front office staff could not care less.  Maid service was excellent.

Initially I was pleased with the rate but the location was not one that I would want to take my family too. The hotel was a little runned down and walking to the park from this location felt unsafe due to traffic and other hotel in the area  I would not recommend this hotel

The room we had smelled of a combination of urine/mildew.. The walls painting had cracks and all the seams in the shower were cracked. . TThe rug was dirty looking. The continental breakfast was lacking.

We stayed on this hotel on our trip to Disneyland last March. Location is great and is walking distance to the park but since I have a 4 yr old kid with me I drove and paid the parking fee at the park. The hotel can arrange a shuttle with a nominal fee, $5 for adults, 3$ for kids. If you're with a larger group then it's cheaper to pay 15$ parking fee at the park. Stayed there for 3 nights, first night we just stayed in the hotel, swim on their pool and we had an amazing view of the fireworks right at our hotel window. Continental breakfast is served in the morning and its crowded in the room. There's only 1 waffle maker so the lines for it tends to be longer. It is near Oriental stores and restaurants where I go if I'm tired of eating burgers and pizza.  The hotel is clean and

We had a great stay! The room was just as described and the location was great. Ricardo, at the front desk when we arrived, was very friendly and helpful. He helped us with our ART passes and towels. The ART is right next door and made getting to and from Disneyland a breeze!

It was fine during the day, but not at night. Shuttle service was helpful. Construction was annoying. Every door slams constantly. Hard to sleep past 6:30am. Room was clean enough, remodeled, has amenities. Ok for the cost, but due to sketch location I wouldn't choose it again.

This hotel was under renovation at the time of my stay. Sadly rather than staying in one of the new rooms we were placed in the last rooms to be renovated. We were woken up on several occasions by workers ripping apart the rooms above us and to either side of us. I was in the shower as they ripped apart the bathroom next door, afraid the entire time that a hammer would break through the wall at any moment. It took over 20 minutes to check in (despite my reservation). Service was terrible a other times, one night I had a question and called the front desk, after 6-8 rings I was simply hung up on. When I called back I was placed on hold without talking to a person. My grandma was nearly knocked down a flight of stairs by one of the construction workers. Came back one night to find

Went in expecting mediocracy considering amount we paid.  Got less than we bargained for.  Rooms appear clean, but carpets are filthy feet n socks black from walking on them. We came back to hotel during the day for a nap and housekeeping tried to open our door, no knock or announcement just tried to shove it open, "what the hey". Breakfast is ok but add the staffs sour face and beady eyes following u from benchtops to table far out give us some space to njoy our meal.  Dont recommend other nice places that are alot closer.

Beds were ok but carpet was disgusting and bathroom extremely run down and countertops were terrible. Solvents were used to clean it and removed the finish and made the sticky and dirty. It was pretty cheap cost but the hotel was definitely bellow expectations. I was glad were only there to sleep. Never go here again.
Clean, neat & tidy room. Comfy bed & nice bathroom. A bus 20 meters away to Disneyland. Carrows right out front with good food. Can see some of the Disney fireworks from the carpark.
still under renovation, very clean, free parking, couple of blocks away from disneyland parking area, safe and affordable for big families :)

Summary Heading: Value for Money & conveniently located to Disney Parks
Summary: We found this hotel conveniently located to Disney Parks. Cleanliness & hotel staff's friendlyness is worth noticing.

First day at 430 room not clean when complained was forced to leave room.  Now or never as the maid put it.  Day two get back at 1 door open.. Maid told manager on duty she had just gone in there....  But at ck out general manager laughed at us!  This was the worst stay ever.  We have been on vacation for two weeks and haven't had issues but here.  Had to file police report for harassment and stolen computer
The staff was very friendly and helpful. The breakfast room was clean and well stocked. I will recommend this to friends when they head over there.

Summary Heading: The shower head was very low. We had to squat to shower and...
Summary: The shower head was very low. We had to squat to shower and we are not tall people. The rest of the visit was great. The staff was so helpful with directions in the area too.

Summary Heading: The room was clean.  the only thing bad was that they do...
Summary: The room was clean.  the only thing bad was that they do not have a suite so you can stay all in one room.

Summary Heading: Had a great time in California. the employeess ther was...
Summary: Had a great time in California. the employeess ther was very nice & very helpful. keep up the good work.

Room was recently renovated, but not very much was upgraded. The bathroom since had granite, newer carpet, and new windows. However the tub was in need of help. As well as new paint and and lights. Area is a little sketchy. ART runs right by the hotel and for $5 per person to go back and forth from Disneyland is a great deal. Wouldn't walk to Disneyland from the hotel. Breakfast is okay with just carbs and coffee. Okay for cheap place to stay for a quick trip to Disneyland. We stayed 3 nights. Walls are thin.

If you go in expecting the Ritz, or even a Hampton Inn, you will be disappointed. If, however, you go in expecting a basic room that was inexpensive, you will get what you were expecting. We stayed one night for a Disneyland trip. It's about a mile from the park, down Harbor Blvd. Location felt safe, we even ventured to the liqour store and felt safe the whole time. Location was quiet. Housekeeping came in the morning, and when I yelled out "No Thank You", they actually LISTENED!! Thats rare for me. Breakfast was basic, but they did have a fresh waffle maker. The front desk was friendly and super helpful. The ONLY complaint I have is about the Ramada reservation line. I called to confirm my reservation, and asked 4 separate times if there was a deposit required. I was told NO 4

We didn't expect much based on previous reviews but ended up being pleasantly surprised. We were in one of the remodeled rooms and it was quite nice. The beds were so comfortable that we ended up taking an unexpected nap one evening and forgot to go back to Disneyland. The bathroom is clean and modern. There is a refrigerator and microwave in the room which was perfect for our multi-day stay. The breakfast room was clean and provided some wonderful choices to fill up on before heading to the park.   We were shocked on our first night around 8:40 PM to hear loud explosives outside of our room. Once we realized that we weren't under attack and it was the Disneyland fireworks show, we watched it in its entirety from the Ramada parking lot.   We took advantage of the Anaheim resort

Summary Heading: Great value for reasonable price and location
Summary: Stayed at this location for 3 nights, overall it was good other then thin walls in which your could hear other hotel guests in other rooms echo through the wall. Everything else was good.

We were not in the room much. It worked out fine. Good bed for sleep. Noisy guests in other rooms made it hard to sleep. Shower is too short. Ants were a problem. Desk staff and house keeping were very nice and helpful. The staff was really great.

Staff is good, but the motel is in dire need of help. Was told I wouldn't be charged until check out and I was charged prior to arrival. Not a big deal, but this place lacks consistency. I also wasn't given any information on a shuttle bus that you could pay $5/day for, instead we had to figure these things out on our own. I also inquired about their non renovated rooms vs renovated. Was told non-renovated rooms were still clean and comfortable. Boy was that a lie. I specifically mentioned I had a 3 year old and I couldn't let him stand on the floor without putting his shoes on. Although the staff was friendly, I would rather fork out 300 a night and stay at disneyland resort than ever risk not getting what I was told by a reservation agent. I've never stayed at ANY hotel in my

Summary Heading: Beds were a little hard, other then that it was close to...
Summary: Beds were a little hard, other then that it was close to disneyland a great place to stay for the price

Summary Heading: The name of the hotel is misleading. Main Gate North gives...
Summary: The name of the hotel is misleading. Main Gate North gives the impression that it is walking distance to Disneyland, it is not. They claim High Speed WiFi. It is not www.speedtest.net clocked it at .5mb sec. too slow to stream media.  Pros: the room has fridge, microwave, blow dryer, ironing board and iron, flat screen. Can see the fireworks at DL from the hotel pool area.  Cons: slow draining bathtub, Slow WiFi and COCKROACHES

Close to disneyland across freeway quiet area easy on and off freeway restaurant close to hotel didnt eat there so i can not comment on it internet description said recently remodeled im not to sure about that ice machine down stairs did not seem to sanitary carpets in room are filthy my children showered and then walked on carpet and feet turned black going to try another place next time i guess you get what you pay for

Summary Heading: Unfriendly staff, not a good neighborhood
Summary: I stayed 3 nights for a Disneyland trip, I thought it's walking distance but not at all, . not good idea to walk at--not a good neighborhood. Breakfast was boring, and the kitchen room was tight no place to sit's.  No restaurant nearby to eat.  The staff on the front desk are not very friendly at all.

Summary Heading: Sad, dirty hotel too far from Anaheim Convention center
Summary: Sad, dirty, OVERPRICED hotel too far from Anaheim Convention center; needed to get roundtrip cabs to/from twice daily ($20/day for 4days).  The rest of our party of 10 travelers was at the Ramada Maingate - I couldn't get switched because of a large convention in town.  The condition of the hotel was embarrassing; I did my very best to be there as LITTLE as possible.  An awful experience for the money - approx $100/dollars/day plus tax for a dump.  UGH - I could NOT wait to get out of there.

The Carpet in Handicap accessible room was FILTHY!! Leaving bare feet or socks BLACK, had to wear slippers unless in bed! Fixtures in the bathroom were falling out of the wall. Shower tiles were chipped, and their daily solution was to paint over it, which came off as soon as you took a shower. I don't know if all the rooms were maintained at this below acceptable condition, but just because a handicap room has wheelchairs used on the carpet is NO excuse to allow the carpet to become filthy! The harder wear and tear on accessible rooms should mean the carpeting is cleaned MORE regularly!! The office, maid and breakfast rooms were staffed with friendly helpful staff. The breakfast was limited mainly to cereal , doughnut's and toast, but the waffle machine worked if there was

Summary Heading: Our stay was ok. We decided to got o Disneyland the day...
Summary: Our stay was ok. We decided to got o Disneyland the day before and most places were booked. While the walk to Disneyland was ok, about 10 minutes, I would not want to do it by myself for safety reasons. It is on the opposite side of I-5. The rooms were nice but the heater and fridge were noisey and woke us up the first night. The hotel was clean. We took advantage of the breakfast (make your own waffles (good), cereal (2 types), dried oats for oatmeal, danish, donuts (better microwaved), bread/english muffins, 2 juices, coffee and milk. I ask for the roll away to be removed, it was not and they tried to charge me for it. My daughter ate breakfast in the room. Since the trash cans were not lined, we left the plates (with some left over food) on the side table. They were still

Summary Heading: Horrible accommodations the best the staff could do was apologize
Summary: First of all rooms with handicap accommodation are only 1 bed bedrooms so we had to go with a regular two bedroom.  Once we dropped off our luggage in the bedroom we asked the staff for a handicap shower chair. He didn't know what it was but went to look for it, when we arrived back in the evening it was there.  The bath drain was clogged with hair + the level to open the drain was missing. Either way, the water would not drain so we had to take a shower in 4-6 inches of water making it different for my handicap son to get in/out and take a shower. My son claims this is one of the worse experiences he ever had in a hotel his entire life.

I was pleasantly surprised with how nice our room was!  The outside of the hotel is a little misleading.  I was happy with how clean the room was. When I requested extra towels someone was there very quickly.  The complimentary breakfast was sufficent although I wish the coffee cups had been a little larger.

Summary Heading: We went for a family vacation to Disneyland. The hotel was...
Summary: We went for a family vacation to Disneyland. The hotel was an average hotel and they are in the middle of remodeling. The rooms were clean but the beds were uncomfortable (probably the only negative thing about the room). The guest desk staff were so helpful and pleasant. The hotel is maybe a mile +/- from the gate, however, the available trams are such a great convienence to have. So worth the 3 day unlimited pass. It ran every 15 minutes to and from Disneyland which is helpful when you have kids who are tired and ready to go. The trams are also useful to go to other locations other than Disneyland. I would stay here again due to the friendliness of the staff and the convienence of the trams and location.

We ended up having a really good room at a very good rate. Our initial room had some issues with the bathroom, however we were in the area of the hotel being renovated.  We were allowed to change to an upgraded room for just a few dollars more and were very happy with the results.  The beds and pillows were incredibly comfortable.  The location was perfect for Disney, as the ART bus that took us there only made three stops overall.  Only one stop between the hotel and Disney each way, so we werent riding for long.  Great hotel, I recommend it for everyone.  Just make sure to get the upgraded room if they are still doing work.    Also, Carrow's (sp?) was right there in the parking lot, amazing breakfast food :)  Great restaurant.

Family stayed here during vacation to Disneyland. It is within reasonable walking distance to the park. Parking is adequate but this property is under renovation and many units were unoccupied. Were they full parking would be questionable. The staff was not particularly warm but were professional. Our room was freshly renovated and all furnishings and linens were new. The mattresses were wonderful! Overall a good stay and a very good value. I would recommend to others and will stay there again.

Summary Heading: Excellent Value and Very near to Disneyland.
Summary: I stayed with my family ( 2 adults and 3 kids ) in a newly renovated room (the room is not so big and but std size). My kids enjoyed the Disney channel in LCD TV ( but it is 27 inch TV) . Most of the things in the room looks new.The lady in the Breakfast room was kind enough to make Waffles for us. The continental breakfast is OK ( Waffles, Donuts, Cereals (3 varieties) , coffee, Tea, Juice ( apple & Orange) etc.). This hotel is located very near to Disneyland and it is not walk-able distance. The manager( Kristine) was also very helpful to check-in and check-out process ( She even allowed us  do late checkout   without any extra charges and  made our trip and stay more memorable). The room was very clean and I would stay in this hotel with my family again.

The room was average  but not bad at all. The location was just right for what my family needed. I do feel the room could have been kept a little better. The shower water didn't drain properly, so as you shower the water fills in the tub. That gross me out a little. However, all and all I'll give the cleanliness a B grade. Could have been better, but wasn't bad.  I didn't have much interaction with the staff, but did help me as I needed and answered all my questions just fine. I will admit that the hotel as a whole was perfect for what we needed. It was close enough to the park, but not to close to have to be caught up in the park traffic every time I needed to go out. The very best part of the hotel is the economics. I think it was the best pick I could have made for my needs

Summary Heading: Hotel was being remodeled and there were ants in the...
Summary: Hotel was being remodeled and there were ants in the bathroom.  The staff was responsive and came and attempted to fix the bathtub that did not plug and the ant problem but it was not fixed.  The carpets were filthy and could not walk from bathroom to bed without getting very dirty feet.  It was located close to Disneyland.

Summary Heading: Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms, decor was very nice...
Summary: Stayed in one of the remodeled rooms, decor was very nice. Lots of hot water. Breakfast was good. Good value.  Shuttle to Disneyland made it covienent Will defintley stay again our next time at Disneyland. Free wifi internet that acutally worked unlike some of your more expensive hotels.

Very nice customer service. Very clean room. Quiet. Love the shuttle pick up in front of hotel every 20 mins to Disney parks. Good free breakfast. Just need 1 or 2 more waffle makers bc the wait is long at times when a big family is making their table waffles. The store next door is very convenient for last min snacks. Would definitely go back. Been there twice so far. Found a keeper!

Summary Heading: there were ants in my bathroom. Not a lot, 3 or 4 every...
Summary: there were ants in my bathroom. Not a lot, 3 or 4 every night. I was not in the room very much so I did not see them until about 1130pm, and I was out early every morning. I looked for where they were coming from but couldnt find a source. But the next night they were back again. I did not report it due to not being there very often and because I could not find a source. I am hoping it is an anomoly. I have stayed there for the last two years, this year is the first that I have not been completely happy with my room.

When booking this we accidently got the wrong hotel, but it turned out ok. The place is remodeling and I have hopes it'll get better. The rooms are great for the short time we needed them(mainly to sleep in). The bathrooms are run down, our towel rack came out of the wall. the breakfast was your usual danishes, cereal and waffles.  the orange juice is really colored water.  the carrows restraunt next door was below average and smelled!!!

Summary Heading: They don't care when their bed-bugs bite
Summary: Got all bit up by bed-bugs. I could've asked to be reimbursed for ointment, dry cleaning bill to wash all the potentially bed-bug contaminated clothes, and reparations for a ruined family vacation. Instead, I just wanted a refund. But General Manager Sam Lad was very discourteous and dismissive. Tried to offer discounts for future stays as if I'd want to come back and get attacked by bed-bugs AGAIN. No thanx!!!!!! It's been a few days since we left and I'm still extremely itchy with the bite bumps still visible. Sam finally gave in to giving us a $10 discount. I guess that's what our vacation experience and family's health is worth to him.  So unless you like to be itchy, DON'T STAY HERE!!!!

Summary Heading: It should have been nice, but didnt sleep for days
Summary: The hotel was nicely located, friendly, the room was basic but nice and clean. The showers were made for tiny people. I am 6'1 and had to duck to get even my upper chest. The big problem is they were doing construction in rooms down the hall and gave no warning. Every single day we were waking up with hammers banging, and other insanely loud noises from the workers. I called and complained stating how early it was and we needed sleep. All I got was an apology with continued jackhammer like noises. It was obvious they were more concerned about getting rooms ready to rent out than they were providing a restful nights sleep to those currently staying.

I stayed at ramada with family during my Disneyland trip. rates are good for the kind of service we get. it is real value package. The location is perfect. ART stop is just outside the hotel entrance. Good part u can buy ART tickets from reservation desk. Breakfast is good. Free internet... overall good experience....

Summary Heading: Great deal for the price and location!
Summary: This place used to be a piece of crap when I stayed here for company events throughout last year. Normally I wouldn't come back here but I couldn't pass up the cheap room rate when I came here with the family more than a month ago. I was pleasantly surprised at how much things change in just a year. Seems like they have new staff and management that seem to be doing a good job of maintaining the place. Rooms are very well maintained now and the staff is actually very friendly and courteous. It also helps, especially if you have kids, that it is very close to Disneyland and that you can see the Disneyland fireworks from the hotel every night. Will definitely stay here again.   Highly Recommended!!

The carpets were so dirty that it stained my white socks black where I had to throw them away. There were ants all over the bathroom and a clogged bathroom sink. The air conditioning and fan unit smelled like mold and dirt and once turned on wouldn't turn back off until I unplugged it. The TV channels kept shorting out and the towels were stained an off white. There was a ton of noise starting really early in the morning from a construction team remodeling one side of the hotel. I tried calling the front desk to switch roons at midnight and no one answered. I went to the front lobby and no one was there. After waiting 10 minutes I gave up and just dealt with the horrible, dirty room. I ended up having to shave and brush my teeth bent over the tub. Definitely don't recommend this

This motel is fine if you're looking for a good place and you don't plan to be there much.  We book it thru wyndhamrewards.com for a 15% discount and drive down from SF on weekends, arrive really late and are very happy when greeted by Ohare, the graveyard manager.  He's very pleasant and does everything he can to check us in smoothly - frequently giving us the room we request on the ground floor.  IMPORTANT NOTE:  this is not the place to stay if you think you're going to take a short walk to get into Disneyland Park.  It's a hike over an overpass of the freeway.  I'd say it's about 1/2 mile.  What it does do, however, is point you toward a good parking lot on Ball about 3/4 of a mile down the road, where the bus drops you almost at the ticket gate (in fact, they'll even sell

Hotel was in a great location...very close to Disney! Got to see the fireworks from our room window! Great value for the money we spent it was really reasonable! Only downfall was a group of obnoxious drunk guys that were very loud other than that had a wonderful stay!

Summary Heading: Most run down hotel I ever stayed at
Summary: I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.  The rooms are old and run down.  The air conditioner did not work.  The rooom had no towels.  We had to walk to the lobby to pick them up.
they were working on construction/remodel of rooms, parking lot crowded.  Rooms decent and somewhat clean.  Friendly staff, responsive and courteness, nice variety of breakfast items
Hotel is older, and in need of renovation.  Staff was accommodating, and noise at night was low.  Appeared safe, but not exactly what I was expecting for a Wyndham experience.

We booked this Ramada through Expedia.  We thought we were going to be staying at the Ramada MAINGATE but we were at thew MAINGATE NORTH, further away.   Check in was easy, room was small, but clean (except for the carpet - it really needs to be replaced). I understand the motel is undergoing renos, but we were not affected at all.  Pool was clean and we were usually the only ones in it.  Housekeepers did a good job.  Christine at the front desk was very nice and very helpful.

Summary Heading: Neighbors kept us up for three nights in a row.
Summary: Hotel was a nice location from Disneyland. We had some rude neighbors that felt they had to scream while they talked, they were Austrailians. I called the front desk several times and it continued. I suggest that the managers take problem guests and put them on one side of the hotel where families with children arent located. My daughter and I went to Disneyland tired for three days!!!

Location was ok if going to Disneyland, 5 minute drive tops.  The beds are comfortable and the best part of the room.  The bathroom had ants and the shower head was too short.  I'm 5'-10" and I had to bend over to rinse my head.  Can't imagine someone over 6' trying to take a shower.  My wife is 5'-6" and she had to do the same thing.  There is a Carrows right next door, so after passing on the continental breakfast, we went there.  Great service and food was great too.
rooms are average. this trip we had an ant problem overnight. I told the front desk at check out. her comment was "oh sorry" with the tone like she could care less.

When we checked in the desk clerk seemed annoyed to be disturbed by us.  He was not at all friendly.  The family that checked in behind us had the same last name so it was assumed that we were together so their room deposit was charged to our credit card.  There was no apology for this and we were treated like we were being unreasonable for being upset by this careless error.

Summary Heading: An experience to say the least...
Summary: I read reviews on this hotel before even arriving so I kinda knew what to expect. My brother & I stayed in room 208 & my aunt & uncle stayed in room 108 directly below us. Upon entering the rooms everything looked okay, the beds were neatly made, air conditioning unit worked well, & all amenities were basic. However, once I took my sandals off & walked around while putting my stuff up my feet were black and so were my brother's socks & in addition, there were ants in our shower everyday we were there. I was able to prevent the carpet turning our feet black issue by laying down the bed comforters my brother & I weren't going to use on the floor along with the extra towels we were provided. Needless to say, my aunt & uncles room was no better than ours & they were given a

Just a couple of blocks from Disneyland gateway, this little motel was a great place for our money. Last minute reservation was easy, the staff was very accommodating with our requests and we could see the fireworks from our window/balcony. I recommend this place for the price, the location (though not right out front of Disneyland gates, the shuttle stop is), cleanliness and the helpful, pleasant staff. One negative - the shower head was so low I had to stoop down to wash my hair and I'm 5'7". Overall very clean room.

I expected a hotel called "Maingate" to be closer to the maingate of Disneyland. The room was pretty dirty and the beds were extremely uncomfortable. The staff was pretty nice though. I probably won't stay here again.

Both Ramada hotels we stayed in with my family were under some sort of renovation, messy construction and a general sense of not having everything in place. I urge you to reconsider and make a general upgrade to the hotels soon, as value and location are concerned could be eally great if only more attention to details was placed in upgrades or reconstructions.

The hotel itself wasnt too bad. It was nice looking had a very clean pool and a nice breakfast room. So we arrived after driving the entire day and night and my mom is disabled to we packed everything up on the luggage cart and took it to the room for her. We got all the way to the room when we found out the room they'd given us had someone in it who preceeded to come out and yell at us. So we went back got our next room and went in. First thing in bam! Two light bulbs blow out. then then lamps by the bed wont turn on. Still trying to be optomistic we start unpacking while one of us hopped in the shower. The bath tub looked like it hadnt been cleaned in months. Then the carpet turned our feet black. While I took my shower the tub would'nt drain and then the electricity went out.

Summary Heading: I would stay there again if it were remodeled
Summary: Tub needed resurfacing. Could hear neighbors on both sides and could see through adjoining room door if we had looked.

The room was OK...could use some updating but I notice that there is a remodel project in progress.  Our room was quiet..that was a plus.  The breakfast was so-so.  I would suggest additional fruit such as bananas and oranges..there was only apples.  Also adding yogurt would be good.  The waffles were fine but we do not eat waffles every day.  The location was great..just a hop, skip to Disneyland.  We are planning on staying there again and hopefully the remodel will be complete.

The room was clean but the carpet was filthy.  Walking on it with our socks resulted in very black sock bottoms.      The people working there were very friendly and helpful.   Marvelous.  The continental breakfast left a lot to be desired.   All the offerings were carbohydrates.   No protein (such as hard boiled eggs or cheese).   Very poor selection of fruit.

The staff at this hotel was kind and for the most part helpful, don't ask for a phone book cause they really don't want to share the one they have. The carpets in the rooms were absolutely disgusting when we would get out of the shower and walked to the bed (which wasn't that far) and made your feet black. So when we got out of the shower we would put on our flip flops to walk around in those cause we didn't want are socks to get black when they were suppose to be white. Also everytime we turned on the T.V. it would automatically be on a mexican channel.

It worked, not gross, but the continental breakfast was lacking.  Aside from milk, which was not really cold, there was no protein offered.  No Cream cheese and bagels, no yogurt, only fresh fruit was apples, in general, it was not edible.    Thanks but I don't eat old bread and pastries.

We stayed here for our Disneyland trip last weekend. I read the reviews before we booked. I took most of them in stride and decided since it was two days and all we really needed was a place to sleep then it can't be that bad. We booked a 2 queen bed non-smoking room. We got room 210, which was VERY difficult to locate from the parking lot. It was upstairs and down a corridor. When we entered the room the first thing I noticed was a big paint stain on one the comforters. I went to the restroom and the tub was stained, paint peeling and towels looked very worn out. I took off my sandals then immediately put them back on because the floor was disgusting. The kids had dirty feet after taking a bath and walking on the carpet. The amenities were nice, coffee pot with paper cups,

The staff was friendly and the room was clean. Breakfast was a little slim and the construction workers were clearing it out fast, but we werent expecting much from the "continental breakfast" in the first place.

The beds were the absolute beds we have ever slept on in our life! The queen bed was as hard as a rock which hurt both me and my husbands back and neck! My children were scrapped up from the metal on the sofa bed and the mattress was as flat as can be. The carpet was flithy and left black on our socks and feet!! A refund would be greatly appreciated!!! We are going to the chiropractor for our backs. wont be staying there again.. the breakfast was good though and we enjoyed the pool.

Summary Heading: Not anything special but worth it
Summary: We were only going to sleep so it did the job well for a cheap price. Can't complain. We went to disney and the walk was not too far.

After a terrible start to our holiday with two absolutely shocking hotels we finally found this place at short notice. We had to move rooms once during our 10 day stay as the first room had some plumbing problems they couldn't fix. The rooms were clean and tidy, perfect after a long day at the theme parks. All of the staff were friendly although there were a few language barriers. We loved dining at the restaurant at the front. Like others we were a little misled about the location and expected it to be within walking distance to Disney, but it certainly wasn't.

This property should be required by law to remove the "Maingate" from it's name entirely.  Like yahoo68 I ended up booking this hotel instead of the Ramada Maingate which, true to ITS name, is at the Main Gate.  Arriving at the wrong property I immediately called RMLGN and asked if we could cancel, fully understanding that I could be charged the one night.  They said that I would be charged, so I decided to spend the one night there.  The staff at reception were indeed pleasant.  Once I arrived at the room it was obvious that I would be forfeiting the one nights' charge as there was absolutely no way I could stay in that room.  In their defense, the room is priced accordingly.  Anyone familiar with the market (it was only my second time there) would have probably been wary with

I read a LOT of hotel reviews from people who don't seem to travel that often. I, however, do. I know what to expect from a four star hotel and what to expect from a two star, and I think it would be silly to confuse the two. First off, the service was great. Me and my partner arrived early and without a rental car - such a short distance away from the park, we decided to hoof it for the trip - and the man at the front desk got us squared away. The room wasn't finished yet - it was only 11am - but he took our bags and locked them behind the desk so we didn't have to carry them with us all day. The room when it was done was perfect, a comfortable bed with clean linens and clean bathroom. The mini fridge was convienant and the breakfast was acceptable. No problems with noises or

Here is the real deal, if you want marble counter tops and room service pay $200 a night for the Hilton, but if you want a nice room for the price, this is the place. The rooms were clean, it was a quiet place, good breakfast, best A/C I have ever had in a hotel room and shuttle to Disneyland 100 feet from the hotel which ran every 20 minutes. We had no problems and would gladly stay there again anytime.

We started with kayak telling them we wanted to stay at the ramada maingate which is directly across from the maingate at disney.  Kayak transferred me to a reservation center for ramada and I proceeded to book the room. While doing so I was reassured 2 seperate times that I was being booked at Ramada Maingate and asked if it was the one across from disney and assured it was.
