Upon arrival we found we were booked at maingate north which is not walking distance from the park requiriing us to pay an additional $15 per day for parking and not convenient to go back and forth from teh park to the motel.  The clerk at check in was very cordial and understanding even telling us that she would not charge us for the room reservation if we were able to get a room at the hotel we thought we

This property is 9/10ths of a mile from Disneyland. If you want to spend the whole day in Disney you should bring the car and park it at Disney. It would be a long walk back after 12 hours on your feet. Especially if you had kids. The rooms were clean and immaculate and you can see the nightly fireworks from Disney at the hotel. The breakfast is great and plentiful. The staff was very helpful and answered your questions. I wouldn't hesitate to go back

If you want to pay for dirty,old, used up room then this is your spot. This hotel is not on the Disney side of the freeway, nor does it provide that "disney magic" that most people are looking for when staying in Anaheim. The service here would be better if my dog ran the place ( at least he is happy to see me when I walk in). Providing feedback to Sam Lad the General manager only makes your stay worse, so save yourself the effort. Save your time and money and stay anywhere else!

I could not remember which Ramada I usually book once a year. Googled the Ramadas and this one says its 0.8 miles from Disney and "walking distance" but the other said 1.7 from park, which led me to believe this was the one. Booking was non refundable so when I figures it out was too late. Anyway, its not walking distance, walls are thin, checkin wasnt so easy, but staff were okay with slight problem  with language barrier. We completed our stay there then moved to the right Ramada at 1650 south harbor. Just remember: 1600 or so are the addresses you want to be by the park.

The rooms were as expected for the value (price).  We had an excellent view of the Disneyland fireworks nightly, the pool was excellent, the breakfast satisfied hungry children and the facilities were clean and comfortable.  Would stay there again.

Besides the point that they state they are walking distance from Disneyland and it's a lie unless you consider walking over the freeway to get to it, this hotel is junk.  It has broken floors and old rooms and they charge you for movies that you didn't order and when asked what was the movie title they don't know.  Seriously travel sites should remove it from their hotel list.

Purpose of our stay was for the Angels 5K(Sun) and Angels game(Sat).  We didn't want to drive back and forth to home in LA, so the $55/night was Well Worth It!!!! This location did not have the traffic as the hotels near the Theme Parks, but it is only 2-blocks South to the Park Entrance to Disneyland and California Adventure. Our Room 126 was Very Clean and had microwave and refrigerator, this was the main purpose we chose this hotel, we stayed here years ago. As soon as we checked in we loaded up the refrigerator with our bottles of water and sodas. Had dinner at the Carrow's(Sat),Be Aware, this Carrow's is Not Open 24-hours like others, the hours are from 6am to 12am,  which shares the parking lot with the hotel. After dinner, at approx 9:30pm the Disneyland fireworks were

the room was very clean and the people there very nice especially the maids were very helpful but as one person said they say there is a free shuttle to disney but when i asked at the desk there is a shuttle but you need to pay and that was not  exceptable at all they need to get things straight and not tell people  one thing and not have it. breakfast was acceptable but always crowded and it was nver real clean they never once wiped things down like they should just checked and restocked.

Summary Heading: Cheap, nice continental breakfast but broken!
Summary: I made a reservation for 2 rooms for myself and my son and his family and other friends booked here too and while all 3 rooms were the same style, the level of acceptability were very different.  My rooms was "acceptable" as it was clean but very old and worn out.  The fan in the bathroom sounded like a rocket ship taking off, but the room was "ok" for a $51 a night room.  My son's room was barely acceptable and in need of repairs, but our friends room?  It was completely unacceptable with a broken door that needed to be lifted on to the hinges in order to close it.  There were holes in the curtains where the sunlight would pour in and it was by all means one of the worst hotel rooms I've ever seen and they even paid $20 a night more!  I saw the rooms for myself which is why I'm

I planned a trip to Disney and made reservations for this hotel (just want a clean place to sleep).  The web-site told me that they provided shuttle service to and from the Disney parks.  I tried to call them a week in advance for further details about the shuttle.  The first time I called (pre-check in business hours) I was placed on hold for over 5 minuets.  The second time...hold again.  The 3rd, 4th, 5th and 6th calls they didn't answer - just hung up.  On my 7th call (almost 30 minutes later) I got a rude greating and promptly told that they did not provide shuttle service.    I am not looking forward to our stay with them.  I can not believe that such a simple customer service experiance has turned into my first on-line negative review of a hotel.  If I had the option of

This is a great hotel if your expectations correspond with the price.  We went in with relatively low expectations and found our needs met.  The room was clean, but in need of minor repairs, such as significantly worn spots on the carpet.  I asked both with the reservation and in person for a quiet room, and if we were given a quiet room, then there are NO quiet rooms on the property.    I rated the service as "poor" because the person at the front desk when we checked in was very unhelpful and unfriendly.  He did not even acknowledge my presence for a marked amount of time even though I was the only one standing at the desk and in the lobby beside himself.
